Photo from left to right: Mercedes del Carmen Sánchez, María Adilia L. R., Darling del Rosario L. P., Jessenia del Carmen Muñoz García y Juan José plarte R.. The group Fuerza en Cristo are natives of the city of Masaya located in the Laguna Valley. They have worked with Adim for various cycles because they feel that it is an institution that has trusted them. They express that they feel part of the Adim family. Mercedes del Carmen is dedicated to selling produce in the Masaya market. She has done this for years and knows how her business runs. She says that she has seen how with each loan she gets more inventory for her business. María Adilia L. R. sells air fresheners for all uses. She sells on foot in the Granada market. She has five children and her husband helps her with the bills. With this loan, she'll buy essential oils to combine them and sell, in liquid, those air fresheners. Darling del Rosario L. P. is a young mother to one small child who is school age. Her husband is a bricklayer and he helps with the family expenses. She makes aprons and sells them in different markets in the country. She sells them in fixed places. Everything that she has achieved encourages her to keep working and remain in good standing with Adim. Her group know this and, as a result, she is in charge of making payments to guarantee they'll be on time. She will invest in fabric, lace to adorn the aprons, and she is making new designs. Jessenia del Carmen Muñoz sells perishable products like fruit and produce in the Masaya market. She invests her loan in the purchase of perishables like lettuce and carrots in order to offer more products to her customers. She dreams of having amenities in her home and to have greater earnings. Juan José P. is dedicated to selling clothing in the Masaya market. He sells from a fixed spot where he offers clothes for men and women. He uses the loan to purchase jeans, which are in great demand. The group hopes to always have the Adim financing for their ecomomic activities and, at the same time, to be punctual with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Material for making aprons and to purchase fruit and produce to sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a businesswoman. She trades in Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials. She mostly sells through hawking - it is a personal selling method which she says makes her goods move very fast. She is 29 years old and a married mother with three children. All her children are in school. She is supporting her family well with the proceeds she makes from her business. She has been selling for the past five years but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes this loan will enable her to revive the business and make more profit. She wants to purchase Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials in bulk to increase her inventory. She dreams of buying her own house from the savings she makes every day and she would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas clothes to increase inventory

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Hai, 44, and her husband, Mr. Huot Hin, 41, have been married since 1992 and have one son and one daughter, both of whom attend school. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

K. and her husband have been farming for twenty-nine years. They grow cucumbers, green beans, and jasmine. The couple transports their produce to sell at the Prek Phnao market about 30 kilometers from their house.

K. is requesting her second loan of $1,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides in order to continue her farming business and to buy more jasmine flower trees to grow.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Terrado Group

texts.es: El grupo “Terrado” esta representado por la señora Neuza y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a la venta de abarrotes, comida rápida, al servicio mecánico, a la venta de cosméticos por catálogos  y al alquiler de disfraces. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y de buena calidad. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y emprender pequeños negocios para incrementar más sus ganancias, que se traduce en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias que día a día van mejorando mas, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo de si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mr. Seng S., 45, was married in 1983 and has three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of his children work in a plywood factory and the youngest one is in a local school. The family lives along National Road Number Six about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Seng was not available for the photo and so his wife is shown instead.

Seng and his wife have been growing vegetables for over ten years. They sell their products to a middleman who comes to buy them at their house and who then sells them in Phnom Penh.

Seng is now requesting his second loan of US$250. He will use the loan to continue his farming business.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Chalie

texts.en:
Chalie C. is from the village of Zone 2, Lumbia Airport Compound, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 29 years old. Chalie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Chalie owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Chalie has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Chalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Chalie is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Chalie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Zone 2, Lumbia Airport Compound, Cagayan De Oro

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en: Adelyn L. is from the city of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 48 years old, is married, and has nine school-aged children. Adelyn owns and operates a "sari-sari" retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Adelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila B. is from the village of Barangay Uno. She is 19 years old. Sheila is engaged and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Sheila owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks the local community. Sheila has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sheila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sheila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Sheila is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Sheila from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Kleung

texts.en:
Kleung Y. is 40 years old and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She works in a massage club to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 2.50 per day, while her husband, pictured here, is a construction worker who makes an average of around US$ 4 each day. This couple has three children, two of whom are in school and one is a chef.

Kleung Y. would like to take out a loan of US$ 800 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Bullen

texts.en:
Bullen A. is currently in the business of selling fresh vegetables in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase beans and maize flour to sell. Bullen is 27 years old and is married with a husband that is a businessman. She has 8 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house to rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase beans and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase items in bulk for resale

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en: Mariafe B. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Mariafe owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Mariafe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mame Mariéme

texts.fr: Mame Mariéme D. est une femme de 43 ans, elle mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 05 ans. Elle développe une activité de vente de chaussures et de sacs à main pour dame. Elle est bien expérimentée dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plus de 5 ans. Son objectif est de mobiliser assez d'épargne afin de tendre vers une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Mame Mariéme D., age 43, is married and the mother of six children. She's been a member of the Village Bank for five years. Her business consists in selling shoes and women's handbags. She's very experienced in this field, since she's been working in it for five years. Her goal is to gather enough savings in order to be financially autonomous.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her ability to autofinance

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es: Doña María Consuelo T. T. cuenta con 41 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana, “Elaboración de fajas típicas” cuenta con un taller de 3 telares, habita junto a sus 5 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, Ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con tres empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 18 años de elaborar fajas típicas en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chisocop Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas por semana, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María Consuelo T. T. is 41 years old and married. She works in handicrafts, creating traditional sashes. She has a workshop with 3 looms. She lives with her husband and their 5 children. She and her husband are both artisans and have three employees who do the same work. She has been making traditional sashes for 18 years in her home located in Paraje Chisocop, Poxlajuj municipality, in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Her customers have increased, but her current economic conditions do not permit her to raise capital, so she has come to the Asociación ASDIR to request a loan. She will use the loan to purchase raw materials to increase her weekly sales. She hopes she can also help her children get ahead, so that they will have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (capital investment)

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben O. is 60 years old and lives in the town of Emuhaya in the Vihiga district. He is married to Agnes O. and they have five children, all of whom have graduated from high school except their youngest, who is eight years old.

For the last 34 years, he has operated a store in the town market. Having repaid a previous loan from our organization, Kadet Ltd., he has applied for a new one to buy more items to sell, including sugar, fat, tissue paper, soaps and soft drinks. His customers live in the surrounding community or go to local schools.

In the future, Reuben hopes to establish a milk-processing business whose profits will allow him to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking fat, tissue and others items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Mok

texts.en: Mrs. S. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops and raises a few pigs to earn a living. She typically generates an income of $5 per day. Mrs. S. is a widowed mother caring for three teenage children. All three of her children are students in the local public school. Mrs. S. has requested a loan of $1200 to be used to purchase a cultivating machine. With a new machine she can both plow her own farmland or rent it out to other farmers for additional profit.

loans.use: To purchase a cultivating machine.

loans.name: Henry Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor HENRY ANTONIO A. M., Labora como Ayudante de servicios Generales en Centro de Formación Profesional Nicaragüense Holandés, es casado y padre de  cinco Hijos y tres están en el colegio el junto con su esposo han podido sacar a delate la familia.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, para la remodelación  de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Henry Antonio A. M. is a General Services Assistant at the Dutch-Nicaraguan Center for Professional Training. He is married and the father of five children, three of whom are in high school. Together with his wife, he has been able to help his family get ahead. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of building materials to remodel his home to make it more secure. He will thereby provide his children with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements and addition to home

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena tiene 34 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 6 años, vende frutas en un puesto de venta que se encuentra cerca de su casa.  Es así que se levanta muy temprano para comprar frutas, logrando obtener variedad de ellas, y eso le da mucha ventaja en la venta. Su trabajo es de todos los días, y solo logra descansar por las tardes, lo que más le gusta de esta actividad es que este negocio le permite tener tiempo para dedicarse a su hogar. Con el tiempo anhela adquirir un puesto más y de esa manera ampliar el espacio de su puesto de venta. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP, y asegura ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más frutas.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 34 years old, and she lives with her three children in her own house. For six years she has been selling fruit at a stand, which is near her house. She gets up very early to buy the fruit. She gets a variety of fruit, and this gives her a big sales advantage. She works everyday, and she is only able to rest in the afternoons. What she likes best about this activity is that this business allows her to have time to spend on her house. In time she wishes to get another stand. That way she will expand her selling space. This is her twelfth loan with MFP. She guarantees that she will be very responsible with her payments. She feels that this support will be very helpful in the progress of her business. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy more fruits.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of fruits

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary B. is a 38-year-old widow who has one child. She is a hardworking woman who wants the best for her child.

Mary sells foodstuffs such as rice, beans, cooking oil, tomato paste and pepper. She hopes to expand her business. She needs a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Duong

texts.en:
Mr. Duong V. has been a professional construction foreman for five years and lives with other family members in a small wooden house located in the rural area of Seim Reap, a province of Cambodia. He has another financial earner in his wife who sells a few types of dessert from home for a profit. This couple is blessed with six children who are no longer in school.

To help support the family’s daily expenses, two of their children own a boat that they use to provide a taxi service along the river. Currently, their boat breaks down often and their income has been affected. Duong V. will be using his loan to repair the broken boat and use the rest of the loan to grow his wife’s dessert business.

loans.use: To repair his sons' broken boat

loans.name: Si

texts.en:
This humble woman, Mrs. Si P., 44 years old, resides in a medium-sized wooden house with other family members. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a district policeman and who earns a small income for the family. The couple has two young children who go to school every day.

To feed the family, Si P. has a small trade selling vegetables and some cooking ingredients in the market. She is taking out her loan to renovate her vegetable store and increase her business capital.

loans.use: To renovate her vegetable store and increase her business capital

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
Martha lives in Borewala, a city of shrines in Pakistan.  She does not have any children. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the market. He selected this business because he has ten years of sales experience in a grocery store.  

Martha is a very supportive lady. She runs a domestic-sewing business. She does this work to help her husband financially. 

Martha is a regular client of Asasah. She has successfully completed four loans and now she has applied for a loan for the fifth time from Asasah. She will invest the loan amount in her husband’s business. The loan amount will help him to buy groceries in bulk for his grocery shop.  

Martha is hopeful that this investment will put her husband’s business into a better position which will result in an increase in his income.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for grocery shop in bulk

loans.name: Geneflor

texts.en:
Geneflor I. is from the village of Kinangay, Norte Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, married, and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Geneflor owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Geneflor has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Geneflor joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geneflor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Geneflor is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair the existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Geneflor from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the existing vehicle to provide better service.

loans.name: Luchadores Por La Vida Group

texts.en:
The communal bank “Luchadores por la Vida” is composed of 21 members from the city of Talca. They are involved in artisan crafts, hairstyling, clothes and underwear sales, restaurants, and sewing.
Norma is the group’s president. In the photo she is in the first row on the left side wearing a red jacket and a pink scarf, with short hair. She sells American clothing. At weekends she sells in the flea market which is close to her home. She also sells from home and at different sites around and outside of Talca. She has been in this business for three years, and has support from her oldest son and her husband, who help her find places to sell and transport her clothing. Norma has three children but only lives with her daughter who is 17, as her other two children live with their own families. 
Norma will invest this loan into a much larger quantity of clothing to sell. Her dream is to grow her business and to set up a store in her home from which to sell. Norma enjoys working with Kiva partner, Fondo Esperanza, because she feels that the group members are responsible and committed.  Additionally, the workshops about business administration have helped her.
Talca is in the Maule region, located in the central part of Chile. The majority of the population live in rural areas, and dedicate themselves primarily to productive farming activities. Talca is known for its beautiful artisan products and its colonial architecture. The principal attractions are the plants, animals, and vineyards. Despite the fact that the workforce has increased, this region continues to be, according to the latest census, one of the poorest in the country.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris tiene 72 años y vive con su esposo en la ciudad del Cusco y fruto de esta unión tienen cuatro hijos. Doris  se dedica a la elaboración de chocolates y artesanía y solo vende a sus familiares, amigos y hermanos. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Con su próximo préstamo, Doris espera recibir $150 USD. Le gustaría comprar insumos y materiales para elaborar los chocolates.

El banco comunal “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo”  ya tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, pero Doris tiene 3 años participando  en el banco comunal y le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Doris, 72, lives with her husband in the city of Cusco; they have four children. Doris makes chocolates and crafts that she sells to her family members, friends and brothers. She has been in this business for several years now and does quite well thanks to the efforts she puts into it. She expects to get $150 USD in her next loan. She would like to buy ingredients and supplies to make the chocolates. The “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo” (Lionesses of San Jerónimo) communal bank has been in operation for 10 cycles but Doris has been participating for 3 years and does very well.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies to make chocolates.

loans.name: Tessa

texts.en:
Tessa L. is from the village of Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 25 years old, single and has 1 infant. Tessa owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Tessa has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Tessa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Tessa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Tessa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Telli

texts.en:
Telli B. is 55 years old and is married. She and her husband live in their own house with the basic essentials. They have three children. Telli has been the owner of a small general store for about a year. She sells foodstuffs for everyday use such as rice, flour, macaroni, soft drinks and sweets. Her monthly profit is 150-200 AZN. She also keeps a cow for her own use but would like to expand her business. 

The motivation for requesting a loan is to be able to purchase more merchandise to stock the business and to buy cattle. More products will attract more clients and generate a good monthly income to help her family. She dreams of, one day, opening her own store.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran M. lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Hovouny. He is a trained veterinarian but due to the limited salaries and employment opportunities for veterinarians, he has chosen the life of a farmer.  He is the proud father of three children: a 23-year-old daughter and two sons, who are 9 and 21 years old.  

Both Tigran and his wife have been working on the family farm for the past 17 years. He is looking for a loan to purchase wheat seeds and fuel and to rent a tractor to harvest wheat and his potato crop.  

With this investment, he is expecting his family income to increase by 20 percent. He considers himself a hard-working, disciplined farmer. His hopes and dreams include growing his business for his children and also supporting them to obtain college degrees.  

Trigan was born in Hovouny and enjoys living near his friends and family.

loans.use: Wheat seeds, fuel

loans.name: Amara

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Amara.  He is married and has two children, aged 9 and 6.  He has three additional dependents who assist in taking care of his family and help to educate his children.  

In 2001, Amara established his provisions and cigarette business.  He began his business to generate income and to care for his family.  Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, he earns about $340 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to buy additional inventory.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 270,600 SLL. With these additional profits, Amara plans to further grow his business and to be more independent.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory

loans.name: Alikisima United Group-Jinja

texts.en:
B. Pheibe is 35 years old and a mother of four children. Pig husbandry and fire wood sales have been her means of livelihood for the last four years in Ivunamba-Jinja. She was previously a dairy farmer. 

There was a need to elevate her finances and she figured the above trades would help her achieve that goal. She earns 120,000 shillings for her business on a weekly basis. With this loan, she wants to purchase more fire wood to supply to her clients.

Pheibe belongs to Alikisima United group in Jinja.

loans.use: To purchase more fire wood

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new taxi

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie M. is from the village of Oscariz Ramon. She is 49 years old. Josie is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Josie owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling milk fish, meat, chicken and frozen foods in the market. Josie has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 6,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Josie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora, D. 48 años, está casada con Anayo, D. 52 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad D. San Pedro D. Cajas. La elaboración D. tapices, chompas, gorras y mantas, son su especialidad, pues ya tiene 28 años dedicados a ello. La creatividad e innovación D. sus diseños, hace que sus ventas sean muy buenas, tanto así que hace algún tiempo abrió una tienda en la casa del artesano, que queda en la ciudad D. Huancayo. Nora, conocedora D. la demanda D. sus tejidos; también los comercializa en la capital del país, a donD. viaja 2 veces al mes. Asimismo ella tiene una tienda D. comestibles, y un carro que hace transporte público, trabajando en la línea Tarma –San Pedro D. Cajas. Con la variedad D. negocios que tiene se siente feliz por el desarrollo y progreso que tiene, por ello más adelante quiere expandir y mejorar sus negocios. Esté es el segundo crédito con MFP, y espera lograr sus objetivos con el trabajo mancomunado con su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará artesanía para surtir su tienda, D. la misma manera comprará lana para tejer las prendas D. vestir que realiza.
texts.en:
Nora is 48 years old.  She is married to 52 year-old Anayo.  They live in their own home in the town of San Pedro D. Cajas.  Nora's speciality is making tapestries, sweaters, caps and blankets.  She has been doing this for 28 years.  The creativity and innovation of her designs means that her sales are very good.  Her sales are so good, in fact, that some time ago she opened a store in 'La Casa del Artesano' ('The Craftman's House') in the city of Huancayo.

Nora is aware of the demand for her items; she also sells them in the country's capital where she travels twice a month.  In addition, she has a grocery store and a car which is used to proviD. public transport on the Tarma – San Pedro D. Cajas route.  Nora feels very happy with the development and progress which she has had with her different businesses.  In the future, she would like to expand and improve her businesses. 

This is Nora's second loan from MFP and she hopes to achieve her goals through her work together with her community bank.  She will use her loan to buy handicrafts to stock her store and she will also buy wool to knit her garments.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts to stock her store and to buy wool for knitting

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
María Cecilia H. P. es de procedencia campesina, su microempresa de trayectoria familiar de cría de cerdas para la venta ha sido su sustento durante años, aunque hace algún tiempo su negocio se derrumbó cuando se vio obligada a vender lo que tenía para pagar el sepelio de su hijo mayor. 

Aunque para María Cecilia este fue un golpe duro de la vida, la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus otros tres hijos la obligó a empezar de nuevo y rehacer su microempresa. Actualmente sigue trabajando en su hogar, lugar donde tiene la oportunidad de criar las cerdas y recibir las ganancias de la venta de las mismas. 

Esta emprendedora necesita del apoyo económico para comprar una cerda con sus respectivos cerdos pequeños, así podrá engordarlos y venderlos en poco tiempo, puesto que con las ganancias espera tener la oportunidad de arreglar el techo de su casa, ya que con la temporada invernal que asota el país se ha visto afectada. 

A futuro, María Cecilia anhela tener un corral con gran cantidad de cerdos con el fin de vivir con la tranquilidad que le genera una microempresa sólida.
texts.en:
María Cecilia H. P. comes from the countryside. For years, she has earned her living through her family's microenterprise raising pigs, though some time ago the business fell apart when she had to sell what she had in order to pay for the burial of her oldest son. 

Though this was a difficult blow in María Cecilia's life, the need to help her remaining three children get ahead in life drove her to start from scratch and rebuild her small business. Currently, she works from home, where she has the opportunity to raise her pigs and take in the income she earns from selling the pigs. 

This enterprising woman needs economic support to buy a sow and her piglets so that she can fatten them up and sell them within a short period of time. With the profit, she hopes to fix the roof of her house, which has been affected by the winter season that is currently battering the country. 

In the future, María Cecilia dreams of having a large corral with many pigs, in order to achieve the peace of mind generated by having a solid business.

loans.use: Buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora N. is a farmer from the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya. She has been farming for fifteen years. Her main products are maize, beans, bananas, coffee and milk – all of which she sells locally. She depends mainly on the income from her farm to provide for the basic needs of her family.

Flora recently repaid a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 30,000 KES.  She has requested another loan for 30,000 KES, this time to start a poultry project. The income from this investment will help educate her children and improve her family's livelihood. 

Her major challenges have been pests and diseases which affect her production, and the lack of proper markets for her products. She intends to improve her farming and open a cereals store in the future.

Flora is 35 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 2 and 8.

loans.use: To start a poultry project

loans.name: Nidia Liz

texts.es:
Nidia, tiene 59 años y vive junto con su pareja y sus hijos en la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de Nidia es la venta de artesanía en el centro artesanal “Inka”. El centro comercial se encuentra ubicado a 5 minutos de la plaza principal de la ciudad del Cusco. Ellos desde hace varios años que abrieron el puesto de venta en el centro artesanal y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo. 

Nidia con el microcrédito desea comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo chompas de la lana de alpaca, polos con logotipos del país, de la ciudad y de los monumentos arqueológicos y muchas cosas más.      

Nidia pertenece al banco comunal “Kukuli” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal tiene cuatro años de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Nidia is 59 years old and lives with her partner and children in the city of Cusco. Nidia’s main economic activity is to sell crafts in the craft center “Inka.” The commercial center is located some 5 minutes from the main square of the city of Cusco. They opened their stall in the crafts center and have done very well thanks to their hard work.

Nidia with the microloan hopes to buy more merchandize like alpaca wool sweaters, shirts with the country’s logo as well as the city and main archeological monuments and other items.

Nidia belongs to the “Kukuli” Communal Bank of the UMF Arariwa Association of the city of Cusco, Perú. The Communal Bank has been in operation for four years and is well managed by its governing board.

loans.use: To buy crafts.

loans.name: Sein

texts.en: Mrs. Sein T. is a villager in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province and she was born in 1967. She is a farmer who owns 2-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. To improve rice production, Mrs. Sein T. is applying for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and hire farming laborers so as to farm in the dry season. Her husband, Mr. T. Khiev is a duck breeder who is able to earn some money selling duck eggs to support his family. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while another one is a construction worker, and the others are students. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and hire farming laborers

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida lives in Okara, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has resided there with her family in a 2-room brick house for past 8 years.  She is a housewife who prefers to stay at home to manage her household responsibilities. She has 2 children, who are both enrolled in a local school.  

Her husband, K. J., is a rickshaw driver. He provides transport services to passengers to earn income for the family. His rickshaw has grown old and its engine needs repairing.  Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband in his transportation business. With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw. She hopes that with the fully repaired rickshaw her husband will be able to work for longer hours and provides better transport services to his passengers. 

Khalida is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit  and has never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.es: El señor Hilarión es transportista publico; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de un motor y caja para su movilidad que es la principal fuente de ingresos para la manutención de su familia. Hilarión es casado, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en casa de un familiar la cual esta ubicada en la zona de Cosmos 79 de la Ciudad de El Alto. Es la primera ocasión en la que el cliente trabaja con nuestra institución.
texts.en: Hilarión works in public transportation.  He needs the loan to buy an engine and a gearbox for his vehicle.  The vehicle is the primary source of income to support his family.  Hilarión is married and has four children.  He lives in a relative’s house, which is located in the Cosmos 79 zone in the city of El Alto.  This is the first time that he has worked with our institution.

loans.use: To buy an engine and a gearbox for his vehicle that he uses for passenger transportation

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 4 Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Unidas IV se conformó en el año 2007, y han crecido y aprendido con las diferentes circunstancias positivas y negativas que han podido superar y mejorar como parte de un proceso de crecimiento del comité.
Las señoras son de la ciudad Encarnacion, distante a 40 km. de la oficina de la fundación. Ellas destinan su dinero para diversas actividades en la zona en donde viven.
Actualmente 8 señoras son las que están desde el inicio del comité, otro número de integrantes han rotado para completar el número necesario requerido para la conformación del mismo.
Se sienten muy conformes con el crédito recibido en ciclos anteriores ya que les es de mucha ayuda para seguir adelante con sus actividades.
Renuevan por décima-segunda vez, pasando al siguiente ciclo por el excelente pago en sus cuotas, donde la directora general, Ramona M. las motiva a que sean puntuales y cumplan con sus responsabilidades.
La sra. Ramona posee una tienda general con cuyos ingresos mantiene a su familia, por eso solicita el préstamo porque como es el único ingreso económico para su familia, desea incrementarlo a través del aumento de las mercaderías y productos que ofrece.
texts.en:
The committee known as “Mujeres Unidas IV” (United Women IV) was established in 2007. The members have grown and learned through different circumstances, both positive and negative, to help them overcome obstacles and improve themselves as part of the growth process for their committee.

These women are from the city of Encarnación, which is 40km away from the office of Fundación Paraguaya. They will use this money for the different business activities that they operate in the area where they live.

There are currently eight ladies who were around when this committee was started. Other members have rotated in and out of the committee in order to reach the required number to maintain a group. The members are pleased with the loans they have received in previous cycles because they have helped them continue with their business activities. They are receiving a loan for the twelfth time. Going into this next cycle, the group maintains an excellent payment history. The group’s General Director, Ramona M., motivates her fellow group members to be prompt and thorough in all of their responsibilities.

Sra. Ramona has a general store that generates income to support her family. She is requesting a loan because this business is the only source of financial income for her family. Ramona wants to increase her inventory and the number of products that she offers.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to restock a general store.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
L. señora Consuelo es habitantante D. un lugar llamado Tierra Blanca el cual es mas conocido como L. novia del sol, ya que ademas D. ser una region ganadera es uno D. los lugares dnD. hace mas calor del estado D. VeraC..Doña consuelo tiene L. edad D. 43 años solo estudio hasta el tercer grado D. primaria y tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya estan casados.

ElL. nos platica que hace mas D. un año tuvo L. inquietud D. trabajar en su propio negocio y como tienen muchos amigos y conocidos sus hijos le aconsejaron  que vendiera ropa, elL. tomo esa idea he inicio con su propio negocio.

elL. necesita este credito para invertirlo en L. compra D. ropa(blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisas, shorts y vestidos)para su posterior venta.

elL. venD. casa por casa por casa en su comunida y espera que sus ganancias sean buenas para continuar invirtiendo y que su negocio cresca mas dia a dia
texts.en:
Consuelo lives in a place called Tierra Blanca ("White Earth"), which is more well-known as L. Novia del Sol ("Girlfriend of the Sun") since it is one of the hottest places in the state of VeraC., in addition to being a region for raising livestock.  Consuelo is 43 years old.  She only has a third-graD. education.  She has four children, all of whom are already married.

Over a year ago, Consuelo had a restlessness to start her own business.  Because she has a lot of friends and acquaintances, her children recommended she sell clothes.  Following her kids' advice, Consuelo started her own business.

Consuelo needs a loan to invest in buying clothes (blouses, skirts, pants, shirts, shorts, and dresses) to sell.  Consuelo sells clothes door-to-door in her community, and she hopes her earnings are good so she can continue investing in her business so it continues to grow each day.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, pants, shirts, shorts, and dresses to sell

loans.name: Marivie

texts.en:
Meeting life’s challenges head on is a habit that could be developed only by the brave. Marivie P., 28, does just that. Marivie is only a high school graduate but right now she manages her own micro-business as she learns entrepreneurship as a community partner in CCT*. She is married to Joenard,  who is a driver, and mothers her three children, who are now in elementary school.

For six years now, Marivie has been in the coconut business. She buys young coconut fruit directly from farmers and she retails them. She has a fruit stand along the highway by-pass leading to Tagaytay City, a local tourist destination in the province. Marivie also sells coconut by-products like pure coco vinegar and coco wine. She earns an estimated net monthly income of around 12,000 PHP from this business.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan.  She intends to use this loan to purchase more fresh young coconuts for selling.

Marivie acknowledges that no challenges are too hard to deal with. She knows that the Lord will enable her to overcome and uphold the future of both her children and her business. She dreams of making her sari-sari store grow. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fresh buko fruits (young coconut fruit) to sell

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en:
Batsuuri is 44 years old and lives with his wife and only son in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son, 10, goes to a local secondary school. 

Batsuuri manages a used clothes trading business with the help of his wife. They started their business in 2000 by selling used shoes at a rented stall at Narantuul market, one of the biggest markets. Their business has stabilized and this has allowed him to open one more booth near to his home. Now his wife is responsible for selling used clothes while Batsuuri is responsible for selling used shoes. He is planning to continue his business in the future. He is a polite man who says, "We live in a very small house. So I am planning to make my house bigger." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials to repair his house.

loans.use: To purchase construction material.

loans.name: Dorkas 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Ana runs a small business selling meals. In her food stall, she sells dinner and snacks like empanadas (rounds of flour dough filled with meat or vegetables), barbecued sausages, and fried food such as meat and plantains. This loan will allow her to increase her products by introducing different meals. She plans to use this loan to buy sausages, ketchup, flour, meat, and cooking oil.

She is excited to receive her first loan with Esperanza. Ana has three grown children and she is a married woman. She wants to continue to increase her business by investing her profits and saving. Her most difficult challenges are to finish studying at the university and to build her house.

Ana is the group coordinator of her group Dorkas 4 & 5 (a biblical name). Her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients, many of whom have recently immigrated to the DR. The group is based in L. Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town.

loans.use: to buy sausages, ketchup, flour, meat and cooking oil.

loans.name: Karin Janet

texts.es:
Janet tiene 34 años de edad,  vive en casa propia con su novio y sus 5 hijos. Ellos viven en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande - Piura, en una comunidad pequeña y humilde llamada Monteverde Bajo. Esta familia no cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua, luz y desagüe.

Janet es una madre trabajadora que se gana la vida criando cerdos para luego comercializarlos a los pobladores de la zona de Tambogrande. Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 3 años y cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos donde puede desarrollarla. El novio de Janet  es agricultor y cuenta con parcela propia donde siembra Mango de exportación, estos ingresos también ayudan a la economía familiar.

Janet solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado así como para satisfacer necesidades de uso personal. Janet ya ha trabajado con nuestra institución y este sería su segundo crédito.
texts.en:
Janet tiene 34 años de edad,  vive en casa propia con su novio y sus 5 hijos. Ellos viven en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande - Piura, en una comunidad pequeña y humilde llamada Monteverde Bajo. Esta familia no cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua, luz y desagüe.

Janet es una madre trabajadora que se gana la vida criando cerdos para luego comercializarlos a los pobladores de la zona de Tambogrande. Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 3 años y cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos donde puede desarrollarla. El novio de Janet  es agricultor y cuenta con parcela propia donde siembra Mango de exportación, estos ingresos también ayudan a la economía familiar.

Janet solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado así como para satisfacer necesidades de uso personal. Janet ya ha trabajado con nuestra institución y este sería su segundo crédito.

loans.use: Comprar alimento balanceado y uso personal.

loans.name: Genly

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Genly works hard to support her family.

She has a barbecue vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Genly is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her barbecue stand and buy ingredients for her barbecue vending business.

Genly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy materials for the repair of her barbecue stand and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a 44 years old married man living in the village of Rizal West, San Isidro. He is thankful because his only child has his own family already. Reynaldo would like to change his old sprocket and other motorcycle parts but due to insufficient funds he needs financial assistance, which is why he is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000.

According to him, he is able to earn about PHP 3,000 per month as motorcycle operator. Reynaldo has been in the business of transportation for 14 years. He hopes that the requested loan can help him maintain his business.

loans.use: to buy new sprockets and wheels for his motorcycle

loans.name: Dálida Rosa

texts.es:
Dálida es una mujer emprendedora que a sus 42 años es propietaria de una microempresa que existe desde hace 8 años, es una mujer que ha luchado por sacar adelante sus sueños, y como madre de 2 hijos lo que espera es poder brindarles en un futuro una mejor calidad de vida. 

Actualmente Dálida genera 4 empleos desde su negocio, donde se presta el servicio de confección a terceros labor que aprendió hace 18 años y desde entonces se ha dedicado a pulir sus técnicas para brindar un buen servicio y poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, sin embargo así como se preocupa por sus clientes, es para Dálidad muy importante la comodidad de sus empleadas ya que el lugar donde trabajan es un espacio cerrado donde el calor muchas veces no las deja cumplir adecuadamente con los pedidos ya que en algunas ocasiones el calor para la producción, es por esto que hoy Dálida solicita un prestamos con el cual hacerle adecuaciones a las instalaciones de su microempresa, en las cuales comprará ventiladores que le brinden frescura y comodidad a sus empleadas y una mejora en el piso, el cual no tiene el material adecuado para el progreso de la microempresa. 

Esta emprendedora sueña con poder en un futuro generar más empleos y convertir su negocio en un legado que mejore su economía y su calidad de vida en un futuro.
texts.en:
Dálida is an enterprising woman, who at her 42 years of age is the owner of a micro-enterprise that has been in existence for eight years. She is a woman who has fought to pursue her dreams, and as the mother of two children, she hopes to be able to offer them a better quality of life in the future. 

Currently Dálida generates four employment positions with her business, in which she provides dressmaking services to others. She learned the work 18 years ago and since then has dedicated herself to polishing her techniques, in order to provide a good service and be able to meet the needs of her clientele. However, while she is concerned for her customers, for Dálida her employees' comfort is of great significance, since the place where they work is a closed-in area where the heat often does not allow them to fulfill orders adequately, owing to the heat at times in the production process. For this reason Dálida today is requesting a loan with which to make adaptations to the premises of her micro-business, namely that she will buy fans for bringing fresh air and comfort to her employees, and improve the flooring, which is not of appropriate material for the advancement of the micro-business. 

Dálida dreams of one day being able to generate more employment, and of turning her business into a legacy which may improve her finances and future quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fans and make improvements to the premises.

loans.name: Svay's Group

texts.en:
Svay is a 28-year-old a domestic worker who transports fish to the market. She was elected to be the team leader for this group of four people, all of whom live in Siem Reap Province. Svay is a married woman blessed with three children, all of whom are still young and living under her care. Her husband is a porter in his village. Because of uncomfortable living conditions, Svay is requesting a loan to add to her savings in order to decorate her old house.

These are three other borrowers:

Sok is a porter as well as a fisherman who is seeking a loan to buy new fishing nets; Hok, a local porter, is requesting a Kiva loan to repair his house;. Choun, a motor driver, is also requesting a loan to repair his house.

loans.use: to decorate her old house.

loans.name: Gladis Aidee

texts.es:
Gladis, vive sola, sus hijos viven fuera de su casa ya son independientes, es divorciada, propietaria de una venta de lácteos, este negocio lo inicio por iniciativa propia, no tiene un horario establecido para atender a sus clientes.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de leche  para elaborar el queso, esta compra le ayudara a crecer en su negocio y gracias a ello ampliara el servcio a la clientela.
Su mayor sueño es tener un negocio grande, además que la experiencia con el negocio le ayude para continuar en el comercio y proveer para sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Gladis lives alone.  Her children do not live in her house because they are independent.  She is divorced.  She has a business selling dairy products, which she started with her own initiative.  She does not have a fixed schedule for seeing to her customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy milk in order to make cheese.  This purchase will help her to grow in her business.  Thanks to the loan she will expand her customer service.

Her greatest dream is to have a large business.  In addition to the experience in the business, it will help her continue with the business and provide for her necessities.

loans.use: to buy milk to make cheese.

loans.name: Tugirubumwe Group

texts.fr:
Béatrice  est agricultrice de pomme de terre et il est membre du groupe Tugirubumwe. Elle est née au Rwanda et a 51 ans. Elle est marié et il a 8 enfants de 12 à 22 ans, dont 7 enfants  scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 
C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour acheter 200kgs des pommes de terre pour semer, 100L d’eau, 6kgs des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre. 
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmentation des quantités pour agriculture de son activité actuelle d’agriculture de pommes de terre en achetant d’autres champs. Dans les prochaines années, Béatrice voudrait être une grande distributeur de pommes de terre dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants jusqu’au niveau de l’université
texts.en:
Beatrice is a potato farmer and is a member of the Tugirubumwe group. She was born in Rwanda and is 51 years old. She is married and has eight children from 12 to 22 years old, of whom seven are studying. She has six years of primary school education.

This is her first loan from ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy 200kg of potatoes for sowing, 100 liters of water and six kilos of fertilizer, as well as to pay for labor.

Her strategy for growing her business is to increase the amount of land for her potato farming business by buying other fields. In the coming years Beatrice would like to become a large distributor of potatoes in her area. With the profits she makes she is planning to pay her children's education fees to university level.

loans.use: to buy 200kg of potatoes for sowing,100 liters of water and 6kg of fertilizer, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Jimmy Santiago

texts.es: Jimmy Santiago tiene 40 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de transporte. Desde hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, él es una persona muy responsable y disfruta de proporcionarle a sus hijos los ingresos necesarios. El desea obtener otro camión que le ayude a generar más ganancias a su hogar. El crédito que actualmente solicita es para la compra de llantas, focos, vidrios entre otros repuestos que su camión necesita.
texts.en: Jimmy Santiago is 40 years old and provides a transport service.  He has owned his business for more than five years.  Jimmy is a very responsible person and he uses his income to provide his children with what they need.  He would like to buy another truck which would help him to make more money for his household.  The loan that Jimmy is currently requesting will be used to buy tires, headlamps, windows and other spare parts that his truck needs.

loans.use: to buy tires, headlamps, windows and other spare parts

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 21 years old, single, and lives with five family members, two of whom work. 

Ahmad has been an owner of a food market since 2008 that sells meat, fish, soft drinks, juices, and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is located in an area where they are in need of foodstuffs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area. 

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to buy an electric diesel generator and a tricycle truck. He aims to make more money to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to buy an electric diesel generator and a tricycle truck.

loans.name: Johnston Kadzoyo

texts.en: Johnston is 33 years old, single and makes a living repairing bicycles and selling spare parts. He has been in this business for two years and says he is doing well. He is applying for a loan for KES 50,000 to buy more spare parts to sell to his customers. In the future, his ambition is to expand his business into one where he sells spare parts for cars as well as bicycles.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for bicycles.

loans.name: Ulzii

texts.en: Ulzii is a 23-year-old man who lives with his sister and mother in a rented apartment in Ulaanbaatar city in Mongolia. All family members help him to run the business. He started his business in 2009 by renting a computer and a counter to run a typing and printing service. Now he owns his own computer and printer, and he also sells stationery. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I started off small; however, I made it here and I see a very bright future in my business." He is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan (MNT) to purchase office supplies and to repair his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase office supplies.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es: Rosalba, vive en unos de los barrios populares de la ciudad de León, tiene 38 años de edad, es comerciante, tiene 5 hijos,de los cuales dos de ellos están aún en la secundaria los otros son independientes su esposo trabaja en la alcaldía municipal de Totogalpa municipio de León . Antes ella era ama de casa pero necesitaba apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y además tener una actividad que le permitiera ser independiente y ganar su propio dinero al mismo tiempo cuidar a sus hijos, fue entonces que su esposo la ayudo a poner la pulpería , tiene 4 años de tenerla , sus hijos menores la ayudan a atender el negocio después de clases así ella logra hacer la compra de mercadería para surtir su pulpería, además ella vende ropa, zapato y cosméticos vende de manera ambulante y también en  su pulpería así poco a poco ha venido creciendo su negocio y aportando en su hogar . Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, inventario de granos básicos, enlatados, caramelos, leche, jugos, sodas, jabones para limpiar. EstO le ayudara a tener surtida su pulpería y comprar mercadería en general para vender.  Su próxima meta es lograr poner una tienda de ropa, compra vitrinas y maniquíes para exhibir la ropa.
texts.en: Rosalba lives in one of the neighborhoods around the city of León.  She is 38 years old, a shop owner and has 5 children, two of whom are still in secondary school.  Her other children live independently from her.  Her husband works in the mayor's office of Totogalpa, municipality of León.  Rosalba was a homemaker, but she needed to help her husband with the household expenses.  In addition, she wanted a business that would allow her to be independent and earn her own money but at the same time to take care of her children.  And so her husband helped her to open a small grocery, which Rosalba has now had for 4 years.  Her younger children help her in the store after school, which allows her to go out to purchase merchandise to stock her store.  In addition to running the store, Rosalba sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics from a street stand as well as in her store.  Little by little she has been growing her business and contributing financially to their household.  Rosalba needs the loan to purchase clothing, shoes, cosmetics, basic grain inventory, canned goods, candies, milk, juice, soda and cleaning agents.  The loan will help her to stock up her grocery and to purchase general merchandise to sell.  Her next goal is to open a clothing store and to purchase display cases and mannequins to display the clothing.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, cosmetics, basic grain inventory, canned goods, candies, milk, juice, sodas and cleaning agents.

loans.name: Sadek

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 44-years-old, married and has two children.

Sadek has been the owner of a bakery since 2000, selling bread and pastries. He has more than ten years experience in this field and a good reputation. His bakery is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot of customers passing by.

He decided to apply $2000 loan in order to fix and paint his bakery’s wall and floor. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to fix and paint his bakery’s wall and floor.

loans.name: Lidia Del Carmen

texts.es: En uno de los barrios mas pintorescos de la ciudad de León, donde las ventas ambulantes , la pulperías y venta de frutas vegetales son parte de la actividad diaria y cotidiana de sus habitantes , es donde vive doña Lidia , una mujer humilde llena de sueños y metas , es comerciante desde hace 20 años , tiene 47 años de edad, tiene tres hijos de 26, 23 y 18 años de edad, el mayor de sus hijos estudio administración de empresas, el segundo es mecánico industrial y el tercero esta cursando el tercer año de la secundaria  y fue con mucho esfuerzo y duro trabajo saliendo todo los días  con su humilde mesa y una pesa vender verduras y carne por libras en las afueras de su casa  que ella logro preparar a sus dos hijos mayores. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras  y carne para vender y surtir su negocio de estos productos para  vender  y ofrecer a sus clientes que a diario la visitan en busca de estos productos. Por lo pronto su meta principal es terminar de preparar a su hijo menor para que estudie una carrera universitaria y otra meta que tienes es comprar un freezer para almacenar carne y una mesa grande de adera para colocr sus productos pues la mes que tiene esta muy vieja y algo deteriorada.
texts.en:
Lidia lives in one of the most picturesque neighborhoods of León, where street sellers, small grocery stores, and fruit and vegetable sellers are part of daily life. She is a humble woman full of dreams and goals. She has been a seller for 20 years. She is 47 years old and has three children who are 26, 23, and 18 years old. The oldest of her children studied business administration, the second is an industrial mechanic, and third is in his third year of secondary school. It was through a lot of effort and hard work, going to work every day with her humble table and a scale to sell vegetables and meat by the pound outside her house, that she was able to put her two older children through school.

She needs a loan to buy vegetables and meat to sell and stock her business with these products so she can offer them to her customers, who come to her each day looking for them. In the short term, her main goal is to finish putting her youngest son through school so he can study in the university. Antoher goal she has is to buy a freezer to store meat and a large wooden table to put her products on because the table she has is very old and deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and meat for resale

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia, 36 years, kind and responsible woman.  She is married and has five children who are 8, 7, 5, 4 and 2 years old. She is happy with her children and husband by her side. She shares her house with them where she and her husband strive daily very much to attain a better quality of life. 
Safia’s work consists in sewing. Her work is home based.  She is well experienced in her business. She is uneducated but she doesn’t want to befall the same destiny to her children that’s why she sews clothes and afford the education expenses of her children.  
Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He offers his services to the passengers by dropping them to the destinations. He charges fare area wise. He has been in this profession for over 10 years.  
By using his rickshaw for past 10 years, he has found his rickshaw’s body is damaging which creates a bad effect on his passengers.  
Therefore, Safia is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for this purpose. Her husband will use the loan in buying a new body of his rickshaw to make his rickshaw a new look and save his business asset. 
She is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to his business.

loans.use: To buy a new body of rickshaw

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: Iván tiene 21 años de edad es soltero y platica que termino su preparatoria pero ya no siguió estudiando debido a que tenía que ayudar a sus padres a sacar adelante a sus hermanos el es originario de un lugar rico en naturaleza donde su principal actividad económica es la venta de Flor de Noche Buena también conocida como flor de pascua. El joven Iván ha iniciado la inversión en un  huerto de aguacates Haas, el esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en su huerto ya que tiene  planeado comprar otras plantas de aguacate, fertilizante orgánico para nutrir el suelo y para no dañar el  ambiente e insecticidas para eliminar plagas y enfermedades  de la manera más segura y para hacer crecer de manera optima las plantas de aguacate en su huerto.  Además de esta actividad, el joven Iván se dedica entre semana a trabajar en una constructora en la capital del país para ayudarles a sus padres y hermanos con los gastos del hogar. Iván tiene la esperanza de que este huerto de aguacates sea lo suficientemente rentable para que el ya no salga a trabajar a otros lados, ya que es un trabajo muy pesado y peligroso, su deseo es volver a casa y dedicarse de lleno a sus árboles de aguacate. La meta que tiene es poder meter una toma de agua a su huerto para ya no comprarla ya que sale muy cara y no le alcanza para regar todos los árboles, también se sueño es aumentar el número de matas de aguacate ya que su terreno es muy amplio.
texts.en:
Iván is 21 years old and single. He says that he finished preparatory school, but was not able to continue studying because he had to help his parents support his siblings. Iván is originally from a place that is rich in natural beauty and where the main business activity is selling poinsettias, which are also known as the “flower of Pascua”. Young Iván began investing in a Haas avocado orchard. He is requesting a loan to invest in his orchard and already has plans to buy more avocado trees and organic fertilizers to nourish the soil without harming the environment. In addition, he will buy insecticides to eliminate pests and diseases so that his trees will be more secure, thus allowing his orchard to produce an optimal quantity of avocados.

In addition to farming, Iván has a construction job during the week in the capital that allows him to help his parents and siblings with the household expenses. He hopes that his avocado orchard is profitable enough to allow him to quit taking other jobs because the work is exhausting and dangerous. Iván wants to return home and dedicate himself full-time to his avocado trees. His goal is to install a water intake system for his orchard because buying water can be very costly since there is not enough to irrigate all of his trees. He also dreams of increasing the number of avocados tress he has on hand because he has enough land.

loans.use: to buy avocado trees, organic fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary 37, is a married woman with two children, whom attend school.  She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing. 

For the past two years, she has sold clothes door to door to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of establishing a stall to sell her products. 

With the Kshs 10,000 loan she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
At 41 years old, Heng has three dependent children; two of them are workers at a rubber plantation factory while the last one is still in school. She has made a living as a farmer for 22 years and she supplements her income by working for others in the village. With her current source of income, she earns less than four U.S. dollars per day and saves two dollars per day. 

Heng has been with VisionFund since 2010 and now she has regular income after the loan. She and her group member, who has been with VisionFund since 2009, are applying for another loan. She wants to harvest her rice crop and use a portion of the loan to renovate her house. She hopes to make more rice and have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: To harvest her rice crop and renovate her house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Karanday Group

texts.es:
El contaco para el presente comite fue la Sra Teofila quien habia formado parte de otro comité, el cual tuvo que dejar por motivos de fuerza mayor, pero sabiendo los beneficios que les traería, invito a sus vecinas y amigas de su confianza a formar un nuevo comite. Actualmente ellas se encuentran en el Séptimo ciclo del programa de comité de la fundación paraguaya.
La Sra. Teofila tiene 44años, está casada con el Sr Ireneo, quien es Mecánico, juntos tienen 2 hijos. Ella es Costurera, y nos comenta que hace ya un buen tiempo que se dedica a esto, por lo que ya tiene muy buena clientela. Sus vecinos siempre le acercan todo tipo de trabajos, por lo que ya es muy conocida. Su propósito es seguir creciendo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
El crédito lo pide para comprar telas, agujas, hilos, etc. Para poder  confeccionar ropas para así venderlas.
texts.en:
Teofila was the referent for this committee. She had been a member of another committee she was forced to leave it due to stronger motives; but aware of the benefits she would have gained, she invited neighbors and friends she trusted to create a new committee. They are currently working their seventh cycle in the Committee program do the Fundación Paraguaya.
Teofila is 44 years old, she is married with Ireneo, a mechanic, and they have two children. She is a seamstress: she told us that since it’s already some time she has been engaged in this activity, she can count on well-established customers. Her neighbors always order her all kinds of jobs, and she is therefore well known. She intends to continue growing and to keep on providing for family through this activity.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fabrics, needles and threads to create clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, needles and threads to create clothes to sell.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es: El señor  Eloy    es una persona muy trabajadora  y  responsable  que  día   con día se  esfuerza  por  salir adelante , en  esta  ocasión  el se  acerco  a la institución  ya  que  desea terminar de construir el  cuarto  de  lavado   que  actualmente  tiene  en su  vivienda ya  que  debido a  la  temporada  de  frío su  esposa   se enfermo  en  varias  ocasiones  ya  que  tenia  que  salir  al patio   a  lavar, agradece  el apoyo  brindado para  la realización de  su proyecto   ya  que  brindara  a  su    esposa   una mayor  comodidad al  realizar  las  labores  del  hogar.
texts.en: Eloy is a hardworking and responsible person that day by day strive to succeed. On this occasion he is approaching the institution as he desires to finish building the laundry room that he currently has at home. Due to the cold season his wife has gotten sick on various occasions since she had to go out to the patio to do the wash. He is thankful for the support provided by the realization of his project as it will provide his wife a better accommodation to do the household chores.

loans.use: to construct a room at home.

loans.name: Pinkey

texts.en:
