She will use her profits to save for her future home. She is working hard to build a safe house and hopefully make her dream come true. Maricela wants to have a store and pay her loans back.

loans.use: to buy shirts, jeans, t-shirts and other items

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Elvira es habitante de una una comunidad llamada Paso Rinco que se encuentra en la Cuenca del Papaloapan, en esta comunidad se cracteriza por ser productora de limon y existe una tradicion la cual consiste en  que en el tiempo de cosecha toda la familia se reune para ir a trabajar en el cultivo del limon desde los abuelos hasta los nietos participan en el corte.

Doña Elvira nos platica que en su familia siempre se ha trabajado en el cultivo del limon asi que desde pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a cultivar el limon y ahora que ya se caso y tiene a sus hijos les esta enseñando poco a poco ya que ella piensa que ya es una tradicion familiar.

ella nos dice "el cultivo del limon es buen negocio pero como todo tiene sus altas y bajas, por eso nos prevenimos ahorrando para cuando no hay"

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para su limonal.
 
ella nos comenta "los arbolitos son como nuestros hijos debemos darles de comer y cuidarlos para que den fruto"
texts.en:
Elvira lives in a community called Paso Rincon which is located in the Cuenca del Papaloapan region. Paso Rincon is known for producing lemons. It is traditional in this area for the entire family, from the grandparents down to the grandchildren, to come together to work during the lemon harvest.

Elvira tells us that her family has always grown lemons. From the time she was little, her parents taught her to grow lemons. Now that she's married and has children of her own, she is teaching them bit by bit what she considers to be the family tradition.

She tells us that "lemon growing is a good business but like every business, it has its ups and downs. That is why we save up for times when business is slow." She needs this loan in order to buy fertilizer and manure for her lemon trees. She tells us that "the young trees are like our children. We have to feed them and take care of them until they are ready to bear fruit."

loans.use: to grow lemons.

location.town: Paso Rincon, San Juan Bautista Tuxtepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en:
Lennie R., who is 45, aims for completeness in life. Hermosa completed high school and is married to Geraldo, a tricycle driver. They have been blessed with three children who are currently studying in public elementary school nearby. Together, they live in Munting Ilog, Silang, Cavite, Philippines.

Lennie has been a tricycle operator for years now. Her husband used to be the driver of their tricycle unit. Every day, her husband earns an estimated net income of around 300-500 PHP.  To help her husband earn more, Lennie is also selling branded apparel and footwear to her neighbors and community.

She is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan to help her continue operation of her businesses. She plans to use this to pay for the repair of their tricycle and plans to purchase a new tricycle unit.  Part of this loan will be used to purchase apparel and footwear ordered in advance by her customers.

Lennie desires a successful business, a healthy body, and a peaceful and happy life. She also prays that her house will be renovated before the end of this year. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair of their tricycle unit and for the partial payment towards a new tricycle unit

loans.name: Arodie

texts.en:
Arodie is 32 years old and is single. She has a small shop where she sells items such as soft drinks, bread, biscuits, and lotion. She has had her business for over a year, and feels it is well organized. Arodie works from 7:30 a.m. until 5:30 p.m. every day except on Sunday. 

Arodie has requested this loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, bread, biscuits, lotion, and other items for her shop. With any extra profit she makes, she hops to expand her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bread, biscuits, lotion, and other items to sell at a small general store

loans.name: Sergio Manuel

texts.es:
Sergio Manuel es padre de familia de 2 pequeños por quien sale adelante para ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. El trabaja en una maquiladora de la ciudad como soldador y en ocasiones se queda tiempo extra para tener un ingreso más por que es el único sostén de la casa ya que su esposa se dedica al hogar para estar al cuidado de sus hijos. 
El señor Sergio desea construir una barda al frente de su casa para que en algún futuro levantar un cuarto en la planta alta de su casa, la barda que se observa en la imagen es la del vecino por ello mismo necesita construir su propia pared para disponer de ella sin tener algún problema en un fututo, para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar material y para mano de obra.
texts.en:
Sergio Manuel is a father of two little ones for whom he wants to get ahead and provide a better quality of life.  He’s employed as a Welder at an assembly plant in the city and sometimes stays on extra hours to earn additional income because he’s the only source of support for his home since his wife is dedicated to the home and to caring for the children.

Sergio wants to build a wall in front of his house so that in the future he can build a room on the upstairs of his house.  The wall that can be seen in the photo is the neighbor’s and this is precisely why he needs to build his own wall to be able to dispose of it problem free in the future.  To do this project, he needs to buy building materials and pay labor costs.

loans.use: to erect a wall.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo tiene 52 años de edad, es un hombre casado que vive con su esposa y 3 hijos en el caserío La Pala ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura.  La comunidad donde Arturo y su familia viven, es pequeña, de condición humilde y no cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz, agua y desagüe.

La actividad a la que Arturo se dedica es la crianza de ganado ovino y actualmente cuenta con 40 animales. Arturo tiene gran experiencia en este negocio pues lo desarrolla desde hace 10 años. Él también es agricultor y cuenta con terreno agrícola en el cual ha sembrando mango y limón, ambos frutales en producción y bien conducidos. Complementariamente trabaja como peón agrícola en quintas de la zona.

Arturo es un hombre emprendedor que está en una búsqueda constante de nuevos negocios que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Él ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales y la instalación de  media hectárea de maíz en sus tierras. Arturo es un cliente conocido de nuestra institución que goza de un buen récord de pagos y estaría muy agradecido con este préstamo pues le ayudaría a producir más para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Arturo tiene 52 años de edad, es un hombre casado que vive con su esposa y 3 hijos en el caserío La Pala ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura.  La comunidad donde Arturo y su familia viven, es pequeña, de condición humilde y no cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz, agua y desagüe.

La actividad a la que Arturo se dedica es la crianza de ganado ovino y actualmente cuenta con 40 animales. Arturo tiene gran experiencia en este negocio pues lo desarrolla desde hace 10 años. Él también es agricultor y cuenta con terreno agrícola en el cual ha sembrando mango y limón, ambos frutales en producción y bien conducidos. Complementariamente trabaja como peón agrícola en quintas de la zona.

Arturo es un hombre emprendedor que está en una búsqueda constante de nuevos negocios que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Él ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales y la instalación de  media hectárea de maíz en sus tierras. Arturo es un cliente conocido de nuestra institución que goza de un buen récord de pagos y estaría muy agradecido con este préstamo pues le ayudaría a producir más para mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Comprar alimento balanceado  e instalar hectárea de maíz.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 48 years old and married with two children. She has been running a sari-sari (general) store for the past ten years as well as earning an income from farming rice and vegetables. Nelia works hard to provide for her family.

Nelia has requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, groceries, etc. to sell in her store. She has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this one.

Nelia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mwagaro

texts.en:
Mwagaro is a married man with 5 children, 3 of whom attend school and 2 of whom have graduated from school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, he has operated a wheat flour selling business from home. He sells to his neighbours and passersby. His major challenge is seasonality. During dry season the availability of products is low compared to cold winter season where the availability of products is high. He dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Alba

texts.en: Alba is 40 years old and lives in the city of Ibarra. She is single and lives with her children. She has a 19-year-old daughter, a 16-year-old daughter, a 15-year-old son and a 5-year-old daughter. Alba is sociable and friendly. She is an artisan who works on embroidery. She began her work with embroidery eight months ago when she was taught the craft by a friend. She works alongside her friends. This is Alba's second loan, which she will use to purchase cloth and fabric to make blouses and dresses. Her past loan helped her increase the articles of clothing she was able to produce for her customers. Alba also reports that the microloan helped her family’s well-being. Alba’s goal is to have a larger business and she dreams of exporting her embroidery one day.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and cloth to make blouses and dresses.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
35 year old Jolly is a lady with a sense of purpose.  The diligent and resourceful business woman has been in the Pub business for the past 5 years in Kihihi in Western Uganda.  Pub businesses do roaring trades in most parts of the country.  The profitable nature of most of these businesses has allured many, including Jolly.  

The happily married mother of 2 says she set forth in her current business with savings from her coffee sales business.  Coffee sales was her maiden business.  The prices of coffee do fluctuate a lot, though it is a high earning cash crop.  This, in most cases, compels most coffee business people to make do with another business.  Jolly still operates her coffee sales trade though she has somebody who oversees it as most of her time now is spent at the Pub serving her clientele. 

Jolly sells all sorts of hard and soft beverages and she says its her hard work, determination and the good rapport she has established with her clientele which has transformed her business and emboldened her on the future prospects of her business.  Weekly, she says her sales profits total up to Ugandan shillings 180,000.  Jolly says she intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more hard and soft beverages such as sodas and beers to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more hard and soft beverages such as sodas and beers to resell.

loans.name: Adela Xiomara

texts.en:
Adela lives in Choluteca, Honduras, where she makes a living selling clothing. 

Adela has had this business for many years and wakes early each day to visit her many clients. 

She is requesting a loan of HNL 15,000 to purchase merchandise. 

Adela is a returning client and is grateful to Prisma for the support and service she has received.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, underwear, watches, swimwear, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.ru: Бахринисо проживает в городе Нурек. Ей 49 лет. Она разведена. У нее четверо детей. Бахринисо имеет среднее образование. Она занимается шитьем. Берет заказы на дому. Она в основном шьет национальные платья и пастельное белье. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новой швейной машинки.
texts.en: Bahriniso lives in the city of Nurek.  She is 49 years old, divorced and has four children.  Bahriniso has a secondary education.  She is involved in sewing and completes her work orders at home.  She primarily sews national dresses and bedding.  She has been involved in this business for five years.  Bahriniso is requesting this loan for the purchase of a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 26 years old and blessed with two children. Her children serve as an inspiration for her to strive harder in her farming business. For the past five years, Noemi has worked together with her husband, planting and harvesting rice. During the last harvest season, she earned 16,000 PHP and covered the allowances of her children, electric bills, groceries, and daily meals. She was also able to use some of her income as revolving capital for her business. 

Noemi is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to hire laborers to help plant and transplant rice seedlings. In the future, she wants to continue harvesting a good crop each season to earn more profit that she will use to educate her children.

loans.use: to hire laborers to help plant rice

loans.name: Shavkatullo

texts.ru: Шавкатулло женат и у них двое детей. Он добрый и целеустремленный человек. Он любит свою семью и хочет содержит их в хороших условиях жизни. Он хочет устроит своих детей в садик, чтобы они стали умненькими детьми. Шавкатулло занимается купля продажей овощей и фруктов на местном рынке. Он приобретает товар у фермеров, имеющихся дехканских хозяйств, потому что они продают дешево. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000$  США для покупки овощей и фруктов. Так как начинается сезон сбор урожая, он хочет покупать побольше товаров дешево.
texts.en: Shavkatullo is married and has two children.  He is a kind and goal-oriented person.  He loves his family and wants to provide good quality of life for them.  He wants to place his children into a kindergarten, so that they become smart children.  Shavkatullo is involved in buying and selling vegetables and fruits at the local market.  He buys products from farmers, who have dekhan farms and, hence, sell their products cheaper.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of vegetables and fruits.  He wants to buy more products at cheaper cost now that the harvesting season is starting.

loans.use: to purchase products

loans.name: Sanyu

texts.en:
Sanyu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children who both go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a retail shop, working seven days a week. She has been in business for the last nine years. 

She has requested a loan of from MCDT SACCO to buy more sugar, rice, cooking oil, salt, and soap. Her major challenges include the ever-increasing prices of commodities and transportation. Her goal is to build a rental houses, own a wholesale house, and educate her children to university level. 

She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, cooking oil, salt, and soap

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This is Rosalinda, 39, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Augusto, her business partner, and mother to their children. Together with her husband and children, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosalinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells cooked viands for added income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosalinda hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams of having other stores in their area.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar, vive con su esposa y 5 hijos, es casado, agricultor, este oficio lo inicio gracias a su padre, quien le enseño el proceso, de sus hijos solamente dos depende de él, los demas estan casados, el trabajo agricola le permite ayudar a su familia, trabaja todos los días a tiempo completo junto a sus jornaleros.
El está solicitando un préstamo para pagar a los jornaleros que le ayudan a prepara la tierra y sembrarla, esto le facilitara a comprar todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios.
Su mayor sueño es tener mayores ingresos económicos, aumentar su trabajo y la producción agrícola y darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Pilar is married and lives with his wife and five children.  He is a farmer, work he began thanks to his father, who taught him the process.  Only two of his children are dependent, the others are married.  Agricultural work allows him to help his family.  He works full time every day alongside his day laborers.

He is requesting a loan to pay the day laborers who help him prepare the land and plant it.  This will help him buy all the necessary agricultural supplies.

His biggest dreams are to have greater income, expand his work and crop production, and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to prepare his land for planting.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres De Cosecha Group

texts.es:
Perfil Banco Mujer Mujeres de Cosecha
Operación 2011-270
900.000 colones


	 El grupo recibe información del BM emprendedoras de Chilamate, también de de la zona de Poas, coordinando la visita de información inicialmente  con 8 personas, de estas 2 solicitan crédito individual una lo hizo con Kiva Milena y  las restantes integrantes se unen para recibir la capacitación formando el Banco Mujer Mujeres de Cosecha.  

	Este grupo está integrado por 6 mujeres, sus nombres son Carmen la presidenta, Rosibel la tesorera, Inés la secretaria, Lorena la fiscal y se completan con Argentina y Laura. Todas pertenecen a una Iglesia Evangélica,  son un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras con la idea de recibir el apoyo económico de Fundación Mujer y mejorar los ingresos de sus hogares, además consolidar su grupo y ofrecer apoyo en su comunidad para que otras mujeres puedan crecer tanto espiritual como económicamente. 

	Demuestran ser un grupo conocido y tienen experiencia en el trabajo en equipo y la solidaridad es parte importante de su trabajo. Manejan conceptos del trabajo en grupo y han desarrollado otras actividades complementA. para la generación de ingresos. Entre las actividades a desarrollar están la artesanía, Productos de Belleza, el comercio, la elaboración de tortillas caseras entre otras.

	 Dos integrantes del grupo tienen sus actividades trabajando, una se dedica a la producción y venta de tortillas y otra al comercio, también una tercera cuenta con maquinaria ya que se dedica a la costura elaborando ropa para hombre mujer y niño. Con este primer crédito se desea apoyar estas actividades e iniciar con las otras compañeras. El grupo cuenta con activos para desarrollar sus actividades, los cuales se tomaron en conjunto para demostrar la solvencia de ellas. Ellas han establecido su plan de trabajo atendiendo tanto al hogar como a su negocio.

	Aparte del apoyo económico a sus actividades, tiene experiencia de trabajo en su Iglesia realizando actividades para generar dinero y crecer, se comprometen al trabajo en grupo para sacar adelante esta empresa y cumplir con las obligaciones adquiridas con este crédito.

	 Se cuenta con una amplia experiencia en la elaboración de tortillas, la costura y el comercio. Se va a apoyar estas actividades buscando su consolidación y apoyar a las otras compañeras a iniciar su negocio. Se cuenta con equipos y una clientela para los productos que ya se están comercializando. Son un grupo unido y han cumplido con los requisitos solicitados para la formación del Banco Mujer en lo que respecta al proceso de capacitación, demostrando compromiso y puntualidad. Están dispuestas a recoger la semilla que han sembrado!
texts.en:
Profile: Banco Mujer/Mujeres de Cosecha
Operation #2011-270
900,000 colones

The bank collected information from the group at Chilamate, in Poas, after a recent site visit.  We collected data for 8 people, 2 of whom applied for individual loans--including one other Kiva loan--and a group of the rest who joined together to form the Banco Mujer/Mujeres de Cosecha community bank.

The group's 6 members, all women, include the president, Carmen; the treasurer, Rosibel; the secretary, Ines; the controller, Lorena; and two other members, Argentina and Laura.  All belong to an evangelical church.  These enterprising women decided to join together, with help from Fundacion Mujer, because they wanted to increase their incomes.  Furthermore, they value solidarity and want to help other women in their community prosper, not only financially, but also spiritually.

Demonstrating team work and solidarity is an important part of the group's work.  They build work skills as a group and develop complementary businesses to generate income.  Among the business they are developing are: crafts, beauty products, general commerce and food-sales.

Two of the members have working businesses.  One operates a business making and selling tortillas and the other has a general retail business.  Another depends on her sewing machine to make clothes for men, women and children.  The women want to use this loan to support these businesses and start others.  The group expects to learn from their experience with existing businesses to help them create new ones.  They also want to be able to create businesses that will leave them time to care for their families.

In addition to their businesses, the women have worked together in the past to raise money for their church.  Now they are committed to working as a team to build their businesses and fulfill the terms and conditions of this loan.

The group has long experience making and selling tortillas, sewing and commerce.  They will use this loan to support their existing businesses, grow them and start others.  They can count on the equipment and customers that they have now.  The report finds that this group has fulfilled Banco Mujer's requirements for forming a community bank in terms of skills, commitment and ability to repay the loan.  They are ready to harvest the rewards of the seeds they've sown!

loans.use: to buy supplies for their retail businesses.

loans.name: Camila Lyli

texts.es: Camila mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, comerciante tiene su negocio de venta de cosméticos y variedades que con sus propios esfuerzos ha alcanzado realizar mejoras en su forma de vida y mediante los prestamos ha sido de apoyo para lograr sus metas. Invirtió en el ciclo anterior en la compra de productos dejándole ganancia utilizada en reparaciones de su vivienda. Con este nuevo préstamo comprar en mayores cantidades y variedad de productos como: perfumes, colonias para niños, cremas de manos, pintura de labios, cejas, pestañas, blusas de damas, camisas para caballeros, pantalones de vestir, jeans entre otros productos que para estos tiempos festivos se vende en mayores proporciones. Obteniendo de esta inversión mayores ganancias, mejorando su nivel de vida y generándole fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Camila, a hard-working and entrepreneurial businesswoman, has her business selling cosmetics and various types of merchandise.  With her own effort she has managed to make improvements in her lifestyle, and the loans have been support for realizing her goals.  In the previous loan cycle she invested in buying products, giving her profits that she used repairing her house.

With this new loan she will buy wholesale a variety of products, such as perfume, cologne for children, hand cream, lipstick, eyebrow pencil, mascara, women's blouses, men's shirts, dress pants, and jeans, among other products that for these holidays are sold in greater numbers.  From this loan she will get greater profits, improving her quality of life and generating work for her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Tojihol

texts.ru: Тожихол проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 57 лет. Разведена, имеет пятерых детей. Работает на рынке. У нее имеется собственная торговая точка, где она продает мужскую и женскую одежду. В этой области Тожихол уже 20 лет. Она берет кредит для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Tojihol lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 57 years old, divorced and has five children.  She works at a market.  Tojihol has her own retail outlet, where she sells men's and women's clothing.  She has been in this business for 20 years.  Tojihol is requesting this loan to increase goods turnover.

loans.use: to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica es una señora de 45 años, su desafío son problemas de salud y la situación económica del Paiz. Verónica tiene un sueño que realizar y es aumentar sus ventas en esta temporada,  porque es época navideña y la venta son buenas. Verónica solicita este crédito para poder comprar zapatos, vestidos, bolsos, perfume, y ropa de niños y otros. Ya que ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general.
texts.en: Verónica is a 45 year old woman who is challenged by health problems as well as the economic situation in her country. Her dream is to increase her sales during this holiday season when sales are good. Verónica is requesting this loan in order to buy shoes, dresses, handbags, perfume, children’s clothes and other items, because she is dedicated to selling general merchandise.

loans.use: to buy shoes, dresses, handbags, perfume, children's clothing and other items.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is applying for another loan to expand her existing business.  She will use this 80,000 Kes loan to purchase more bags of cement.  In the future, Mwanakombo aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Constance has greatly improved her family’s standard of living.  She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more bags of cement for her business.

loans.name: Samean's Group

texts.en:
Samean is a 38-year-old mother who is widowed and has three children. Two of the children are still in school while the last one is a grocery seller and sometimes works as a construction worker. She started farming rice as a primary business 18 years ago and she supplements her income as a grocery seller in the village to raise extra income. With her hard work since the previous loan in 2009 from Vision Fund, she earns more than $10 U.S. dollars per day to feed her children and she saves $5 U.S. dollars daily. 

Samean and her group members are applying for another loan. She will use her entire loan to buy a buffalo as labor for her rice farm. This loan will enable her to increase her rice production capacity in order to earn a larger income to have better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo as labor for her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Florida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORIDA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa donde la señora Fedra es la secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de carne, venta de refrescos y otros, venta de prendas, venta de dulces y comidas, venta de alcohol. 

La señora Fedra indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de su hermana. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que viene trabajando hace años, ya que en su experiencia pudo ver que en la comida se gana.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el crecimiento de su negocio (compra de víveres) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente lo comercializara en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio de salud.

En la fotografía se puede observar al esposo de la Señora Orbelinda, que le acompañó al desembolso.
texts.en:
The communal bank "FLORIDA" will begin its first cyclo with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Villa Exaltación, and is composed of six members. The bank is managed by a bureau where Ms. Fedra is the secretary. The types of businesses that the members bring forward are varied, and among them are the sale of: meat, soft drinks, clothes, candy, food, and alcohol.

Fedra became a member of Pro Mujer six months ago, at the invitation of her sister. She currently runs a business selling food that she has had for years, and experience has shown her that she can earn a living from food.

The loan she is now requesting will be used to grow her business through purchasing provisions which she will buy from La Ceja and subsequently sell at her stall. This type of work allows her to generate an income to support her family as much as possible, as she lives with her partner and has two children.

When asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer, Fedra says that she appreciates the health clinic.

In the picture, you can see Mrs. Orbelinda's husband who accompanied her to the disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase provisions for her food stall

loans.name: Chanh

texts.en:
Mr. Chanh is 52 years old with 2 children who are grown up.  He is managing a grocery shop which started many years ago. Joining in our credit program in 2003, Mr. Chanh is alway a cluster leader and used loans effectively in expanding his sales.

Currently, he wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 Vietnamese dong to buy more kinds of products to meet the demands of customers on the Tet (Vietnamese New Year) holiday.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of products to meet the demands of customers.

loans.name: Alberto Antonio

texts.es:
Alberto es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y siempre querer ofrecer a su familia un mayor bienestar. A pesar de que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades, las ganas de trabajar de Alberto le han permitido salir adelante y continuar progresando junto a su esposa y sus 6 hijos. Anteriormente Alberto tenía un local donde ofrecía todo tipo de mercancía, pero debido a circunstancias ajenas a su voluntad tuvo que abandonarlo y comenzar con su negocio desde cero. Además de esto, también tuvo que abandonar su casa, vendiéndola a muy bajo precio para poder superar la adversidad. Gracias a un subsidio pudo conseguir de nuevo una casa propia y ahora se dedica a la venta de dulces como ambulante. Con el ánimo de surtir su negocio, Alberto aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de dulces y confites para surtir su negocio. 

Alberto espera que de esta manera pueda seguir generando los ingresos necesarios para su hogar, y pueda ofrecerles a su esposa y sus 6 hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Alberto sueña con volver a tener un negocio ubicado en un local y poder atender desde allí a una mayor cantidad de clientes.

loans.use: Compra de dulces y confites para surtir su negocio.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 47 ans et 4 enfants,  les huit femmes du groupe Sabougnouman habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché Château de Ségou. 
Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente de la friperie, des produits cosmétiques, de l’encens, du poisson séché, des draps de lit et des condiments alimentaires (cubes magies, échalotes, ail, tomate, sel iodé, poudre de gombo). 
Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Assan (1ère femme en position debout sur la photo de la droite vers la gauche) est une grande vendeuse d’habits de la friperie au marché Château de Ségou et dans le quartier. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter deux ballons d’habits de la friperie au grand marché de Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile et au marché Château de Ségou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame Assan compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 65.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants.

loans.use: Pour  acheter de la friperie

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rafaela works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell purchase order card business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Rafaela is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more purchase order cards to sell.

Rafaela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more purchase order cards to sell

loans.name: Ana Alexandre

texts.en: In Mozambique, less than 20% of people have a secondary education and over 60% of people are illiterate.  The conditions do not make it easy for people to reach schools, but Ana's two sons, Paulo and Jonas, love learning and so they walk two hours each way to reach their school every day.  Sometimes, they stay at their Grandmother's to be closer, though that is still an hour walk from their school.  Ana is seeking a loan to buy two quality bicycles so her boys can reach school in under 30 minutes.  They will have more time to help around the house and complete homework, and will not have to walk in the dark every day.  Moreover, they will use the bicycles on the weekends to help Ana sell things in the market near their home.

loans.use: to buy 2 bicycles for her sons, who walk over 2 hours to school each day.

loans.name: Amakinde "a" Group

texts.fr:
Aissata  est  la dame qui tient la corde du bélier sur la photo du groupe. C’est une  malienne âgée de quarante-cinq (45) ans, mariée à un cultivateur , mère de huit(8) enfants, cinq(5) garçons et trois(3) filles, âgés de : 7 à 25 ans dont  cinq (5) scolarisés .Aissata  fait recourt au Réseau (R.M.C.R)  en sachant bien  qu’elle  peut avoir une somme importante  pour accroitre son activité d’élevage.
 Expérimenté dans le domaine d’élevage d’ovin depuis vingt-quatre (24) ans, elle a  un plaisir naturel et surtout le bénéfice qu’elle trouve dans cette activité qui lui motive d’avantage.
Elle prend le prêt pour augmenter le nombre de ses moutons, elle s’approvisionne dans le marché  de sa localité la plus proche, fait ses ventes   dans son  village ou aux marchés les plus proche. Elle peut avoir souvent un bénéfice  de 45 000 Francs CFA par bélier dans un cycle (huit (8) mois), mais souvent confrontée à des maladies ou des décès de moutons. 
Les bénéfices de ses activités lui permettront de prendre en charge certaines dépenses de sa famille : les frais de scolarisation de ses trois enfants, d’habillement, de santé et de condiment. 
Elle souhaite acheter des moutons pour ses enfants.

loans.use: Elévage de  moutons pour la vente.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny sells all types of decorations for the home and she also sells clothing for men and women. She has over 10 years of experience in this line of work. Thanks to the support of her husband, who provided start up capital for the business, she has opened a small location in front of her home where she displays her products and merchandise. She opens her store three times a week from 7 in the morning and 7 at night. The other days she travels outside of the city to sell cosmetics and clothing to under served communities where there are sale opportunities. She is 43 years old and has one child, whose father passed away 8 years ago. She is now in a new relationship with a industrial mechanic who is very supportive.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in clothes for hot weather

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 37 years old, married, and has two sons of 8 and 10 years of age. He earns a living by repairing computers, yet he works only on occasions/scarcely and doesn't count his earnings towards heping pay for home expenses. His wife studied to be a stylist and since he does not have a full time position, she decided to open her own shop approximately 10 years ago. She learned her trade and together they initiated this business in their living room. Little by little their business has grown and they have gained clients, and today they already have an air conditioned space in the front of their house.

Manuel and his wife have worked very hard to provide a good service for their clients, but today they are asking for a loan of $650 which would allow them to buy accessories and beauty products necessary for business expansion, as well as improve their business' look. They anticipate repaying this loan within a 5 to 10 month period. This loan will be an important factor in the expansion of this business, and in helping his family, and they appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Manuel tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos, de 8 y de 10 años. Él trabajaba reparando computadoras, pero en ocasiones el trabajo escaseaba y no contaban con los recursos para solventar los gastos del hogar. Su esposa estudio para estilista y como él no tenía un trabajo fijo, decidieron abrir su propio negocio hace 10 años, él aprendió el oficio y juntos iniciaron en la sala de su casa, poco a poco han ido creciendo y ganando clientes, ahora ya tiene un local acondicionado en el frente de su casa.

Manuel y su esposa han trabajado mucho para poder brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes y conservar su preferencia, pero ahora solicitan un crédito por la cantidad de $ 650 dólares que emplearan para la compra de accesorios y artículos de belleza que necesitan para trabajar, así como la realización de mejoras del local, que esta dispuesto a regresar en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, y ayuda a esta familia, ellos agradecen tu apoyo.

loans.use: Acquisition of accessories and beauty products

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris started working with Charity for Peace in 2003. He is originally from one of the villages in the Amuru district called Anaka. The 1986 war made them seek refuge in Karuma in one of the refugees camps. It wasn't until the year 2001 when Morris moved to Gulu with his family for education. He attended Gulu central high school for his A-levels and is currently single.

Morris started working at World Food Programme for 6 months, then he was with Caritas Gulu for a further 6 months. When his contract ended, he came back with the money raised and established a small barber shop together with a water tap. In this way, he has earned a living to supplement occasional short-term contracts with humanitarian organizations in Gulu. Throughout this time he also volunteered in the evenings, taking care of night commuter children at Chatrity for Peace Foundation. In August 2006, he joined Life in Africa where he is currently working.as a gallery salesman and store manager.

Because of the unreliable power in the district, Moris intends to get a loan of 250,000 Uganda shillings (US$ 150) to stablise power to run his machines. He believes that his barbershop would be able to attract more customers because of the stable power. In case of power outages, other barbershops nearby would fail to operate. Morris says the labor cost would be cut as he had employed someone earlier to operate the barber shop.

During the times when there was no power, Morris used to earn only 15,000 Uganda shillings a day, but he believes if he is given the loan he would double his daily income. Morris plans to repay the loan after a period of 3 months.

Below is his budget plan (note that the symbol = means Uganda shillings):

Generator.......................120,000=

Hollow section (container frame)..................100,000=

Fuel.............................30,000=

Total...........................250,000= (US$ 150)

loans.use: Buying a generator

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Born in 1970, Christina L. is a widow with 6 children. Faced with the difficulties of singlehandedly providing for the basic needs of her family, she got her first loan from GHAPE in 1999, with which she raised money to pay school fees for her children and built a house for her family.

Having successfully invested and repaid all former loans, she now requests a loan of $800, with which she intends to carry out sales of foodstuffs and cultivate maize and cocoyam to sell for her family. With the profits she plans to continue paying school fees for her children and invest in her business.

She plans to repay the loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase rice, corn, beans and other foodstuff

loans.name: Herlindo

texts.es:
“My home has a roof made of wood and laminate and when it rains water leaks in and the home becomes very cold. As the winter season approaches, I would like to replace the roof with one made of concrete to avoid this from happening and provide more comfort to my family. I request $1,000 to construct a roof made from concrete to my home.”

Translated from Spanish by Christian García, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo un techo de madera y lamina en mi casa y debido a eso cuando llueve entra mucha agua y también pasa mucho el frío, la temporada se acerca y me gustaría poner un techo de concreto para evitar que esto pase y que mi familia tenga más comodidad” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para hacer un techo de concreto en mi vivienda.

loans.use:
Construct a concrete roof

Poner techo de concreto

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
About 10 months ago Lucía and Patricio suffered the painful loss of their only son, 17-year old Guillermo. His death caused a lot of suffering and pain, but thanks to God they are moving forward and getting past these hard moments that they have had to live through. Now Lucía, who is 52 years old, has decided to take refuge and distract herself in her daily work selling notions, which is work she has done for a long time. Lucía would like to increase the quantity and variety of her merchandise and, with the profits, save enough money to have a secure and tranquil old age with her partner of her entire life, her husband Patricio. In order to realize these and other plans, Lucía is requesting a loan with the promise that she will repay it over a period of 6 months. Let’s help Lucía overcome these difficult times that she’s had to live through, and offer her the tranquility that she deserves.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Hace aproximadamente diez meses Lucía y Patricio, sufrieron la penosa pérdida de su único hijo, Guillermo de 17 años; este hecho que les causó mucho sufrimiento y dolor, pero gracias a Dios están saliendo adelante y superando esos momentos difíciles que les tocó vivir. Ahora la señora Lucía de 52 años de edad, decidió refugiarse y distraerse en su labor diaria de venta de mercerías, trabajo a la que está dedicada desde hace mucho tiempo. El deseo de Lucía, es aumentar la cantidad y variedad de su mercadería para que con los beneficios económicos que obtenga ahorrar lo suficiente para tener una vejez tranquila y segura, ahora solo junto a su compañero de toda su vida su esposo, Patricio. Para concretar este y otros planes, Lucía, solicita un préstamo con el compromiso de reembolsarlos en un lapso de seis meses. Ayudemos a Lucía a superar los momentos difíciles que le tocó vivir y brindémosle la tranquilidad que se merece.

loans.use: Buy a greater quantity and variety of to strengthen her little shop with the goal of having a tranquil old age.

loans.name: Daniel Machecane

texts.pt:
Daniel Machecane N. is 36 years old and native to Santa Maria in the district of Matutuine in the province of Maputo. He grew up with his parents and attended school until the 4th grade when he had to stop because of the war in 1982. When he was 15 year old (1986) he began fishing with his father for six years and was able to arrange conditions for marriage in the church in 1992. In the same year as is custom he went to South Africa where he worked for a fishing company for 8 years. He was able to save enough money that he came to Mozambique, bought a sail boat, and began fishing again.

He asked for a loan through Hluvuku for 6.000,00MT to buy fishing nets. With this work he is able to support a family of 8 people, his 5 children, his wife, and her parents. With good management he was able to purchase 3 boats with motors and employ 4 workers plus others depending on the needs of the day. When there are lots of waves (wind) he needs more workers to pull out the nets, and the number varies between 8 and 10 people.

Through his experience as a sailor he was hired to be a boat driver by a tourist company that works in the area. The job opened his eyes to offering transport services to take people and goods from Mozambique to South Africa and back, but he realized he did not have sufficient funds to pursue it unless he returned one more time to Hluvuku to ask for a loan of $1,200US to buy the vehicle in South Africa. He will be able to hire 2 people, a driver and a helper. Most likely he will consolidate his projects (fishing and transport) and be a reference in the community where poverty continues to affect more than 80% of the population.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva volunteer

Daniel Machecane N., de 36 anos de idade, natural de santa maria, posto administrativo de Machangulo, Distrito de Matutuine, Provincia do Maputo, cresceu junto com os próprios pais, tendo se escolarizado até 4ª Classe, onde deixou de continuar com os estudos devido a guerra, isto em 1982.

Aos 15 anos (1986) começou actividade pesqueira junto do seu pai durante seis anos tendo conseguido criar condições para o casamento pela igreja em 1992, e no mesmo ano como costume da zona foi a Africa do sul, onde trabalhou numa empresa de pesca durante oito anos, dai poupou do seu salário um valor que veio a Moçambique comprar um barco a vela e recomeçou a pesca em Moçambique.

Tendo recorrido a Hluvuku pedir emprestimo no valor de 6.000,00mt para compra de redes de pesca. Com esta actividade sustenta uma familia de 8 pessoas sendo seus 5 filhos, sua esposa e os seus pais. Pela boa gestao que tem levado acabo, conseguiu comprar 3 barcos com respectivos motores, com os quais emprega 4 trabalhadores, mais outros vários sansionais segundo a necessidade do dia, uma vez que quando ha muitas ondas (vento) é necessário muita mão de obra, para puxar as redes e o numero varia entre oito a dez pessoas.

Pela sua experiência como marinheiro foi contratado por uma empresa turistica que trabalha na zona como Piloto de barco e Motorista, o emprego abriu visão na area de prestar serviços de transporte de pessoas e bens de Moçambique à África do sul e Vice versa e para tal viu se sem fundos suficiente para efeito, onde nada menos que ter recorrido mais uma vez a Hluvuku pedir o emprestimo no valor de 80.000,00MT para compra da viatura na Vizinha África do sul. Com esta actividade vai empregar duas pessoas, um motorista e ajudante. Perspectivas, consolidar os actuais projectos (pescas e tranportes) para ser uma referencia naquela comunidade, onde a pobreza continua afectando mais de 80% da populaçao.

loans.use: Purchase vehicle for transportation

loans.name: Kiganda C Group

texts.en: This group has been together for five months. Jalia has a hardware shop. With the extra business profits, she intends to open up another hardware shop. Hellen sells vegetables in the market. Aisha sells firewood while Grace sells fish for a living.

loans.use: To invest in the hardware business

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty is a very hard working girl, always alert to her family needs. It was for this reason that she decided to open a store which offers phone services to neighbors who don't own a phone. This business has helped a bit in improving their lifestyle. However, her children continue to grow and their demands have increased as well. With the desire of improving her business, she's decided to purchase a xerox machine in order to offer additional services. Your help is very important to this hard-working mother.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Betty, es una persona muy trabajadora, siempre esta pendiente de cada una de las necesidades de su familia con el fin de responder satisfactoriamente a cada una de ellas. Fue por esta razón que decidió abrir un locutorio en el que también ofrece servicios de recepción de llamadas de cada uno de sus vecinos que no cuentan con una línea telefónica en casa.El empleo esporádico de su esposo no ha contribuido desde hace muchos años a elevar su calidad de vida, ahora con los nuevos beneficios que obtienen a través de su dedicación a esta labor ha podido concretar este hecho, sin embargo susu hijos han ido creciendo durante todo este tiempo y las demandas de cada uno de ellos han variado y se han ido incrementando. Con el propósito de satisfacerlas ha decidido incorporar en su pequeño espacio un bazar y una máquina fotocopiadota para brindar sus servicios de manera adicional y frecuente.Tu ayuda es muy importante para esta trabajadora madre.

loans.use: Purchase a phone booth and xerox machine

loans.name: Messavi

texts.fr:
Mr. Messavi K. was born on February 24, 1976 in Lomé. Single with two persons in his care, he sells drinks and staples in the Tokoin Doumasséssé neighborhood. His first loan of CFA 300,000 in 2005 enabled him to get established. The loan of CFA 500,000 he is requesting now will enable him to buy four cans of vegetable oil, 25 cases of fizzy drinks, 12 bags of rice, two bags of sugar, one case of Peak milk, two cases  of tomatoes, three cases of insecticide and five cases of soap. Buying this merchandise will enable him to achieve good sales during the Easter holidays. He will thus be able to increase his profit.Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer. 
Monsieur K. Messavi est né le 24 février 1976 à Lomé. Célibataire avec deux personnes à charge, il est revendeur de boisson et des produits de première nécessité dans le quartier de Tokoin Doumasséssé. 
Son premier crédit d’un montant de 300.000FCFA lui a permis de s’installer en 2005.
Le crédit qu’il sollicite d’un montant de 500.000FCFA lui permettra d’acheter quatre bidons d’huile végétale, vingt cinq casiers de boissons gazeuses douze sacs de riz, deux sacs de sucre, un cartons de lait peak, deux cartons de tomates trois cartons d’insecticides et cinq cartons de savon. L’achat de ces marchandises lui permettra de bien vendre pendant  la période des fêtes de pâques. Ainsi il pourra améliorer ses bénéfices.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 36 years old and is married woman with 3 children, ages 16,14 and 5 years old. She and her husband also take care of 4 other children. Mariam owns a small cafe, which she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 7am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items( chairs, tables and microwave) for her cafe.

loans.use: To buy more items(chairs, tables and microwave) for her cafe

loans.name: Solialofi

texts.en:
Solialofi S., 37, is married with 5 children. She has 2 years of experience in the taro plantation business. Her husband grows the taro and Solialofi sells it to the villagers and the public at the main market 2 days per week.

Solialofi has had 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (about $US 250). SPBD loans are Solialofi’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase equipment to maintain her plantation

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Mariam C. is a 49 year old widow with 6 children, currently living with her children in the household of her late father, who took them in after the death of her husband. Without any financial resources, she decided nonetheless to start a revenue-generating business 6 years ago to meet her needs and those of her children.

To satisfy her increasingly large clientele, she acquired a loan from Soro Yiriwaso through her district association (Association SABU GNUMA of Mancourani I). She has worked with this institution for 6 years now and is on her second individual loan, all of which have been reimbursed properly.

She supplies herself generally twice a month at the local market in Sikasso from well-known wholesalers. Now, she intends to buy 5 bolts of Bazin (a cotton fabric), 20 cases of beverages, several boxes of cigarettes, matches, and various other items for her store in Mancourani I. She dyes the bazin for resale to the male and female clients who visit her store. She runs this business throughout the year without any major difficulties. Her sales are especially large during the time of festivals (Tabaski, Ramadan, etc.)

She intends to realize a monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which will help her meet the needs of her fatherless children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mariam C. est une veuve de 49 ans et mère de 6 enfants vivant actuellement avec ses enfants dans la famille de son feu père qui lui a fait venir auprès de lui après le décès de son époux. Sans ressources financières, elle décida neammoins d’entamer une activité génératrice de revenus pour subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants il ya de cela 6 ans.

Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, elle emprunta auprès de Soro Yiriwaso à travers l’association de son quartier (Association SABU GNUMA de Mancourani).Elle travaille avec l’institution depuis maintenant 6 ans et est à son.deuxième pret indivuduel tous remboursés correctement.

Elle s’approvisionne géneralement 2 fois par mois au marché local de Sikasso, auprès de grossistes reconnus. Ainsi elle compte achèter 5 pièces de Bazin, 20 casiers de boissons quelques cartouches de cigarettes, d’allumettes et divers autres articles pour sa boutique à Mancourani I . Elle teint les bazins en couleur pour les revendre à des clients hommes et femmes qui fréquentent sa boutique. Elle mène cette activité durant toute l’année sans difficultés majeures. Ses ventes sont surtout importantes au moment des fetes (Tabaski, Ramandan etc...).

Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qui l’aidera à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants orphelins de père.

loans.use: To buy bazin (a cotton fabric), cases of beverages, and various other articles

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah M. buys fish in large quantities for sale in smaller and affordable quantities. She is married, but her husband's income as a fisherman is not sufficient for Hannah and her 3 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

Hannah is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 28 años, vive con su esposo Francisco y sus tres hijos de ocho, cinco y dos años. Desde muy niña aprendió y ayudó en el trabajo de sus padres con el ganado, teniendo que dejar la escuela primaria en cuarto grado, es así que hoy en día, con una familia por mantener se dedica a la a la venta de ganado ovino y a la elaboración de quesos que fabrica en su casa, de la leche que dan sus animales, los cuales vende los días domingos en la feria.A Isabel siempre le ha gustado el comercio, su soltura y su manera de convencer a la gente para que compre sus productos, se han convertido en sus armas fundamentales para su negocio, lamentablemente los ingredientes para fabricar sus quesos y el poco ganado que le queda hace que el negocio sea más difícil de mantener. Sus tres hijos son su razón de ser, por la que ella trabaja tan duramente día a día. Isabel con el dinero que pide prestado piensa comprar muchas más cabezas de ganado para incrementar la venta y la producción de queso, y así concretizar su sueño de un negocio más rentable y productivo.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Isabel is 28 years old and lives with her husband Francisco and their three sons who are 8, 5, and 2 years old. Since she was a very little girl she began helping her parents with their cows, thus having to leave primary school in fourth grade. Today, with a family to maintain, she less cows, sheep and cheese at the markets on Sunday. She makes the cheese at home from the milk of her animals. Isabel has always liked business and her ability to convince people to buy her products has become a critical weapon for her business; unfortunately the ingredients needed to manufacture the cheeses and the few cows that she has left have made it more difficult for her to maintain her business. Her three children are her reason for being and for them she works hard every day. With the money that Isabel is asking for as a loan she is considering buying more heads of cattle to increase the sale and production of her cheese and as such realize her dream of making her business more profitable and productive.

loans.use: Increase her number of heads of cattle.

loans.name: Lud

texts.es:
La señora Lud, socia del Banco Comunal “Judith Tuanama”, vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, cosméticos y ropa. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio, en el Jr. Comercio Nº 444. Los clientes son los vecinos, amigos y personas que viven en la misma ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños como polos, blusas, shorts, camisas y pedidos que le hacen los clientes, también quiere invertir en perfumes, desodorantes, los cuales son productos que más le solicitan los clientes y que tienen mayor rotación.

Lud tiene 39 años de edad, es natural de Sisa, vive con su esposo y sus 3 últimos hijos, a quienes anhela verlos profesionales. Se caracteriza por ser gentil y atenta con los clientes. Más adelante quiere ver bien surtido el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lud, partner of the communal bank "Judith Tuanama", lives in the state of San Martín, province of El Dorado, district of San José de Sisa. She sells a variety of food products, cosmetics, and clothes.Her business is located at her own home, in the Jr. Comercio Nº 444. Her clients are her neighboors, friends, and people who live in the same city. With this loan of 340 dollars, which will be repaid in 6 months, she plans to invest in the purchase of polos, blouses, shorts, and shirts for men, women, and children alike. She also wants to invest in the purchase of perfumes and deodorants, products with high demand at her store and that have a high turnover. Lud is 39 years old, she was born in Sisa, lives with her husband and her last 3 children, whom she wants to see as professionals in some area. She is characterized as being gentle and caring with her clients. Further ahead she plans to further stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invertirá en la compra de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños/ She will invest in the purchase of clothes for men, women, and children

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul H. is 32 years old and is a married father with one child who is currently in school. To support his family, Abdul has been selling fresh meat in the busy market of Ashaiman in the neighborhood to his loyal customers. Abdul has been in this business for the past six years and he says it is very lucrative; therefore, he wants to expand his inventory so he can add sheep and goat meat to the existing meats he is selling.

Abdul H. is a member of the community group called Wadala (Enjoyment) Trust group. Members in this group have agreed to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan. His picture was taken when he was visited.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh meat in a large quantity.

loans.name: Susana Hilaria

texts.es: Doña Susana tiene 62 años de edad, habita en Villa Venezuela del parque  ocho andenes al sur, en la capital de Managua, con ocho hijos cuatro mujeres y cuatro varones, cuatro están casados y son independiente,  los otros trabajan y a poyan a su mama, la Sra. Susana tiene un salón de belleza desde hace diecisiete años que inicio con esfuerzos propios el cual ha sido el sustento para la familia, con esta solicitud es la séptima en Afodenic, ha sido de gran beneficios ya que ha invertido en la compra de inventario para el salón, con esta préstamo es comprar productos variados para trabajar como cremas de alisar, tintes , tratamientos para el cutis y otros ya que es una temporada en donde la gente obtiene un poco mas de dinero y opta por cambiar el look de su cabello para estar con una imagen diferente, a largo plazo es comprar su propio terreno para mejorar el local de su salón, y apoyar  a sus hijos en lo que pueda.
texts.en:
Susana is 62 years old, lives in Villa Venezuela del parque ocho andenes al sur, in the capital Managua. She has 8 children: 4 girls and 4 boys. Four of her children are married and live on their own; her other children work and help their mother. Susana has owned a beauty salon for the past 17 years, which she started with her own efforts and which has allowed her to raise her family. This is her seventh loan with Afodenic; previous loans have been of great benefit as she has invested them in buying inventory for her salon. With this loan, she will buy a variety of products for her work, such as smoothing creams, hair dye, skin treatments and others as this is the season when people spend a little more and choose to change the look of their hair and change their image. Her long-term goal is to buy her own land in order to improve the location of her salon, and help her children as much as she can.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products such as hair dye, and hair treatment products.

loans.name: Adela Megina

texts.es:
La señora ADELA MEGINA es socia del Banco Comunal “SANTA ANA”, vive en Departamento de San Martín, Provincia y Distrito de Moyobamba. Se dedica a la venta de sabanas y cosméticos. Vende de manera ambulatoria visitando las casas de sus amigas vecinas y familiares.   

Con este préstamo de  S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 06 cuotas mensuales, comprará sabanas de diferentes tamaños modelos y colores, así como también ropa para damas caballeros y niños como polos, blusas, camisas, pantalones entre otros. Una parte quiere invertir en la compra de cosméticos que tienen mayor rotación y que están de oferta para luego venderlos al precio normal y obtener mayores ganancias y así aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año y satisfacer las exigencias  de su clientela.
  
La Señora Adela tiene 44 años de edad, vive con su pequeño hijo y su esposo que tiene un taller de cerrajería. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda-bazar en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adela Megina is a member of the Santa Ana Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martín department in the province and district of Moyobamba. She sells bedsheets and cosmetics. She practices ambulatory sales, visiting the houses of her friends, neighbors, and family. With this loan of $675, which she will repay in 6 monthly payments, she will purchase sheets of different sizes, styles, and colors, as well as clothing for women, men, and children like polos, blouses, shirts, pants and other things. A part of the loan she wants to invest in the purchase of cosmetics so that she has a better rotation and to be offered later for sale at normal prices to obtain higher income and take advantage of the end of year festivals and satisfy the demands of her clientele. Adela is 44 years old, lives with her young son and her husband who has a locksmith's shop. Her goal is to have a boutique store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheets, clothing for women, men, and children, as well as cosmetics.

loans.name: 140-008265-01-6 Group

texts.es:
Hola nosotros somos el grupo Brillante Amanecer, nuestro grupo esta formado de la siguiente forma:
Sayra R.: la Sra. R. tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la venta de cosmeticos y productos plasticos y 4 años de dedicarse a la elaboracion de pasteles, vive en union libre y su compañero de hogar se dedica a la ganaderia, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dependen de ellos, su esposo se encarga de cubrir todos los gastos familiares y en lo poco que ella puede le colabora a el.
Andres H.: el Sr. H. se dedica al comercio desde hace 20 años, su negocio principal es la pulperia, rubro que mas resalta en nuestra sociedad, el es soltero pero el le brinda el estudio y todos los gastos personales a dos hermanos y cubre al 100% la alimentacion en el hogar de su madre, ya que el padre fallecio y su madre quedo desprotegida, haciendose el, cargo de los gastos de alimentacion para su familia.
Gloria de Jesus C.: ella se dedica al comercio, tiene una pulperia, actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace 5 años, vive en union libre y es madre de 3 hijos que toda via dependen de ella al 100%, su compañero de hogar se dedica a la agricultura y es el quien cubre todos los gastos del hogar, con los ingresos que el negocio le genera ella cubre sus gastos personales y tambien le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, pero lo que ella se dedica a comprar en el hogar son los utensilios de cocina y los electrodomesticos, cosas importantes dentro del hogar, todos estos articulos los ha adquirido con las ganancias que le deja su negocio.
Yeni P.: ella se dedico a muchos años a vender cosmeticos, pero como ella es madre soltera con un hijo el cual depende de ella en un 100%, este negocio que tenia no la daba suficientes ingresos para el sustento de su familia, ella logro hacer una pequeña pulperia la cual le ayuda mucho a cubrir con los gastos de su hogar, ahora ella tiene dos negocios y cuando ella sale a vender sus cosmeticos su hijo le ayuda a atender la pulperia.
texts.en:
Hello! Our group is called Brillante Amenecer and the following people are members: Sra. Sayra R. has for 20 years earned her living by selling cosmetics and plastic products and also for four years making baked goods. She lives in Union Libre with her husband who raises cattle. She has four dependent children. Her husband is responsible for the family expenses, and she contributes what small amount she can. Sr. Andres H. has been a businessman for 20 years. His main business is a small convenience store, a common line of work in our society. He is single but is responsible for the education and daily expenses of his two siblings, plus the cost of food for his mother since his father has passed away. His mother was left without support, so Andres had to take over all the family’s food expenses. Sra. Gloria de Jesus Cáliz is a businesswoman and has been operating a small convenience store for five years now. She lives in Union Libre and has three children who are still dependent on her. Her husband is a farmer and pays for household expenses. With the money that she earns from her store, Gloria covers her own personal expenses and as well helps her husband with household expenses. She also works hard to buy kitchen utensils and household electrical appliances, important things for the home--she has bought these out of the profits from the business. Sra. Yeni P. worked selling cosmetics for many years, but as she is a single mother with a son who is completely dependent on her, the business did not supply enough income to provide for her family. She managed to obtain a small convenience store which greatly helps her to cover household expenses, so she now has two businesses. When she is out selling cosmetics, her son helps her with the store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lider

texts.es:
La señora Lider pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el Futuro II”, vive en el jr. Napoleón Chu Ríos Nº 490 – Brisas del shilcayo- sector EMAPA, distrito D. Tarapoto, departamento D. San Martín. Tiene 55 años y es madre D. 8 hijos, 5 mayores D. edad y 3 que aun dependen D. ella, es conviviente, su pareja se dedica a la construcción (maestro constructor). Con su primer prestamo D. S/. 300 deciD. vender frutas en el mercado. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad, además D. venta D. frutas se dedica a la venta D. juanes, tamales, empanadas D. yuca, en un paradero D. motocarristas, lo que genera ingresos para el pago mensual del prestamo.

Con este prestamo D. S/ 2,000 que será pagado en 4 meses,  comprara, 2 mesas, banquitos para que sus clientes puedan comer con comodidad,  además utensilios para transportar sus productos como baldes, bandejas, también 1 docena D. platos, vasos, etc.

Lider esta muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que le brinda a las mujeres como ella.
texts.en:
Ms. Lider belongs to the communal bank "Women for the Future II", an affiliate of Kiva, and lives in the Jr. Napoleon Chu Rivers Nº 490 – Breezes of the Shilcayo- sector EMAPA, district of Tarapoto, department of San Martin. She is 55 years old and is the mother of 8 children, 5 of legal age and three that still depend on her. Her spouse works in construction. With her first loan of $300, she decided to sell fruits in the market. She has been working with the bank for two years. Currently, besides selling fruit she sells tamales and yucca empanadas near a roadway,which provides her income with which to repay her loan monthly. With her loan of 2000 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy 2 tables so that her clients can eat in in comfort, in addition to utensils to transport her products such as buckets, trays, and 1 dozen dishes, glasses, etc. Lider is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for the support that they offer to women like her.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 2 tables so that her clients can eat in in comfort, in addition to utensils to transport her products such as buckets, trays, and 1 dozen dishes, glasses, etc.

loans.name: Normamad

texts.en:
Normamad is a farmer. He lives with his family, including his wife, 2 children that are school aged, and parents. His wife and elder son help him with caring for their land. In the past, they have had problems harvesting, having to sell their crop in advance with reduced earnings. Normamad has gained a lot of experience in his business and his crop is now one of the most demanded at the market. He now faces a small problem because his field is infertile, which makes it difficult to grow his crop. To solve this problem, he has decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and make his crop more productive.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed, mineral fertilizer and cattle.

loans.name: Evelinime

texts.en:
Evelinime T., 32, is married with one children.  She has one year of experience in the pork buns business.  She sells to village people and the general public five days per week. 

Evelinime will use her loan to buy tools and things to start her business.  She expects her weekly net cash flow will be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  

SPBD loans are Evelinime’s only access to capital because she was not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Buy tools to start her business.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent Brako is the 33-year-old married mother of a child who is currently in school. She lives with her child and husband in a rented apartment in a farming community called Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Millicent trades in assorted plastic materials such as bowls, basins, spoons, buckets etc., procuring her products from wholesalers in nearby big towns such as Accra, the national capital. Selling in the market square and hawking as well, Millicent aspires to increase her stock so she can trek to other towns to sell. She has been in this business for seven years and is requesting a loan to purchase more plastics to increase her profits.

loans.use: To purchase assorted plastics.

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Jiguiya est  constitué de quatre femmes  mariées dont deux polygames et deux monogames avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et  3 enfants. Elles habitent à Sanoubougou I  un des  quartiers de la ville de Sikasso  3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur  cinquième   collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de  satisfaire le besoin de leurs  clientèles et augmenter leur profit. Tous les prêts précédents ont été  bien remboursés.
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de pagnes, de condiments alimentaires,  de savons et la teinture. 
Elles comptent acheter  20 pièces de pagnes wax, 20 pièces de bazin pour la teinture, 30 paniers de condiments, 20 cartons de savons  et des ingrédients pour la teinture. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso, de Bamako (la capitale du Mali) et dans les villages environnants. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché de Sikasso ville,  à domicile et  de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant, en détail et à crédit.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 19 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour aider les maris et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités et le remboursement du prêt.
Les femmes du groupe Jiguiya  ambitionnent de devenir des  grossistes.
texts.en:
The group Jiguiya is composed of four women, two polygamous and two monogamous. They average 37 years of age and three children each and live in Sanoubougou I, a district in Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are on their fifth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and to increase their profit. All the preceding loans have been repaid.

The group members do a diversity of work, including selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth), condiments, soap, and dyed cloth. They intend to buy 20 bolts of Wax pagnes, 20 bolts of damask fabrics for dyeing, 30 baskets of condiments, 20 boxes of soap, and some ingredients for dyeing cloth. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City, in Bamako (capital of Mali), and in surrounding villages. The merchandise is sold retail to customers composed of women and men, cash or credit accepted, at the grand market of Sikasso City, at home, and door-to-door.
