They each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 19,000 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used to help their husbands, and the other portion will be invested in business and used to repay the loan. Their ambition is to become wholesalers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Ram Maiya

texts.en:
Ram Maiya M. lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming. Thecho is also famous for woodcarving.
Mrs. Ram Maiya M. lives in a joint family with her mother-in-law, husband, one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 12 and her son is in grade 11.
Both Mrs. M. and Mr. M. are engaged in their own sweet shop. They opened their sweet shop more than five years ago. In their shop, they make different varieties of sweet items. Mostly people buy sweets on the occasion of festivals. 
Now Mrs. M. is requesting an Rs 10000.00 loan to buy food materials needed for their work.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: El Macueliso Group

texts.es:
este es el grupo Macueliso, todos son personas respetables y honorables en su comunidad, ellos tienen mucho tiempo de concerse y siempre han trabajado en grupo, las actividades que ellos realizan son las siguientes:
el Sr. Rigoberto R. tiene una pulperia, misma que inicio desde hace 5 años, el nos comento que inicio con un inventario de Lps.800.00 y ubico su producto en un cajon de madera de 50cm cuadrados, atraves del tiempo el crecimiento de su negocio es muy bueno, ha sido una persona muy trabajadora y muy buen administrador tambien. el es casado y padre de 4 hijos los cuales dependen de ellos al 100%, ademas de dedicarse a este negocio tambien siembra maiz y frijoles, cuando el trabaja en el campo su esposa atienda la pulperia.
El sr. Henry S. tiene 2 años de haber iniciado con el negocio de la pulperia, ya que anteriormente solo se dedicaba a la agricultuara, pero debido a la buena ubicacion con que cuenta su casa tomo la decision de instalar este negocio, su casa se encuentra ubicada contiguo al centro de estudios de esa comunidad y frente a un campo de futbol tambien. ademas en la pulperia tiene un molino para maiz, este negocio es muy bueno ya que en esta comunidad no hay otra persona que se dedique a esta actividad, el es casado y tiene 4 hijos los cuales todos dependen de el.
la Sra. Digna H.: se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas, actrividad que inicio desde hace 7 años, el producto que ella elabora lo vende la los dueños de negocios de la comunidad de Oculi, donde ella reside, ella ha sabido ganar la clientela  por su buen sabor, tamaño e higiene con que elabora el producto, ella tomo la decision de apoyar a su esposo en lo poco que puede con los gastos del hogar. ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos y todos dependen de ellos.
estos integrantes de este grupo necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante con sus negocios y sus familias.
texts.en:
This is the Macueliso group. They are all respectable and honorable people in their community. They have known each other for a long time, and they have always worked in the group. Their activities are as follows: Rigoberto R. has a mini market that he started five years ago with an inventory of Lps. 800.00, which he fit into a 50 square centimeter wooden box. With the passage of time his business has grown well. He has been a very hard working person and a good administrator, too. He is married and has four dependent children. In addition to this business, he also plants corn and beans. When he works in the field his wife takes care of the store. Henry S. started his mini market two years ago. Before that he only worked as a farmer. But, due to the good location of his house, he made the decision to set up this business. He house is located next to the community center for studies and in front of a soccer field. Also, the mini market has a mill for corn. This business is very good since there is not another one in the community. He is married and has four dependent children. Digna H. has been making and selling rosquillas (a regional cookie specialty) for seven years. She sells them to the business owners in the Oculi community where she lives. She has known how to win customers with the good flavor, size, and cleanliness in the production of her rosquillas. She made the decision to help her husband, the little that she can, with the household expenses. She is married and has three dependent children. The members of this group need the loan to be able to get ahead with their businesses and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy salt, sugar, rice, soap, coffee, salsa, shortening, powedered milk, milk products, churros, corn, tortillas, cheese, margarine, oil, four, grains, eggs, juices, soft drinks

loans.name: Hilda Fidelia

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.
Hilda es casada, tiene 56 años y 3 hijos, Hilda tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Hilda necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leche, arroz.
Los sueños D. Hilda son aumentar su negocio y surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the community bank “Poder”. She is 56 years old, married and has 3 children. Hilda has a small grocery shop at her house, where she works every day. Hilda is asking for a loan of $200 which will be invested in the purchase of milk and rice. Hilda's dreams are to grow her business and offer more products.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es:
La señora Enriqueta S. es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer, que consiste de 13 socias que viven en la comunidad de Zhidmad, aproximadamente 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur de Ecuador. Las principales actividades en la zona son la agricultura y la ganadería.

La señora tiene 70 años y es casada con 10 hijos, todos ya grandes con sus propias familias. Ella no sabe leer ni escribir, y lleva casi toda su vida trabajando en agricultura y ganadería. Su papá murió cuando ella era muy joven, y su mamá le crió sola. Sra. Enriqueta tiene 4 vacas, de las cuales saca leche y hace quesillo para vender. Además tiene sus cultivos de maíz, el cual vende en la Feria Libre de la ciudad de Cuenca. Suele viajar a la ciudad una o dos veces cada semana para vender maíz y quesillo. 

Con este crédito, la señora comprará abono para su terreno para mejorar su producción de maíz. Lleva más de 5 años con su banco comunal (es socia fundadora), y anteriormente siempre invertía sus préstamos en su ganado. “Yo vivo de las vacas,” dice. “No soy peluquera, no soy sastre, no soy negociante,” se ríe.
texts.en:
Sra. Enriqueta S. is a member of the communal bank group “Nuevo Amanecer”, which consists of 13 members who live in the Zhidmad community, located about 30 minutes outside the city of Cuenca in southern Ecuador. The main business activities in the area are agriculture and livestock.

This lady is 70 years old, married, and has 10 adult children, all of whom have their own families. She is unable to read or write, but has continued on in her life working in agriculture and livestock breeding. Her father died when she was very young, so her mother raised her alone. Sra. Enriqueta has 4 cows from which she which she gets milk to be used for making cheese for sale. She also grows corn which she sells at the open market in the city of Cuenca. Once or twice each week, she travels to the city to sell corn and cheese.

With this loan, Sra. Enriqueta will buy fertilizer to improve her corn production. She has been with her communal bank group over 5 years (and is one of the founding members). Her previous loans were invested in livestock. "I live for my cows," she says. "I'm not a hairdresser, I am not a tailor, I am not a businesswoman," she laughs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Mr. K. Chem, 46, and his wife, Mrs. Phal Sok, 45, were married in 1983 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of their children has full time employment and the other children study in the local school. The family lives in the small village of National Road Number Two, about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

K. has been growing rice and vegetables since he was married and started another business raising cows and chickens. Mrs. Phal Sok has been a garment factory worker for one year. The couple wants to repair their house to make it bigger and more comfortable, because their old house is small and broken in some parts. They don’t have enough money to repair it, so K. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase wooden materials and zinc to make the repairs.

loans.use: To purchase wooden materials and zinc for house repair

loans.name: Libna

texts.es:
La señora Libna, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Marcelo II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 44 años y es madre de 05 hijos,  01 que aun depende de ella y está estudiando.

Libna, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, en un local  muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en el patio de su casa, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados y al frente de su casa, se encuentra una maderera, donde sus principales clientes son los mismos trabajadores. Ya es muy conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas de 9:00 am a 2:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 700.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papa, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.

loans.use: Comprará insumos, para preparar sus comidas.

loans.name: Geneva

texts.en:
Geneva is a member of the Sokoni borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro.she is 35 year old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are aged 11 and 5 years old. She also cares for other 2 dependent.

Geneva has owned her own business selling tomatoes,potatoes,onions etc for 8 years ago. She works 8 hours a day and earns monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Geneva`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities to her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Geneva hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes,potatoes, onion

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 57 years old and married to Alfredo, a village policeman. They are blessed with two children: the eldest is a college undergraduate while the youngest is a first year college student. Maria's family resides happily in the village of Namnama Cabatuan, Isabela.

Maria manages a general store business that has become an alternative source of income for her family. She is requesting 4,000 PHP from Kiva lenders as additional business capital to further improve her general store. Maria has been operating her store for 25 years and is glad that she has been able to maintain it despite life's difficulties. She hopes to improve the store and become successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Bathuu

texts.en:
Bathuu A. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Khovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All three of A.’s children attend a local secondary school while his wife helps him out with his business. A. operates a dairy product retail business in his town at the local market. He purchases all of his dairy products from the Arkhangai province which is known nationally for its wonderful dairy. A. attributes his business success to his knowledge of the local market demands. He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug (~1750 USD) loan in order to purchase more dairy products to sell during the upcoming winter months when prices for such products traditionally rise.										

One of Bathuu's daughters, who occasionally helps out with his dairy retail business is pictured above

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products to sell during the upcoming winter months

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth O. is from the village of Catarman, in Pobacion Camiguin Province. She is 26 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 1 infant aged child. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. Her main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local market. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies of fish to sell

loans.name: Lonh

texts.en: Lonh L., 42 years old, lives in the province of Siem Reap, Cambodia, where she owns and runs a plot of land next to her house, growing both rice and vegetables. She can plant her crops twice a year, and she was taught how to grow rice by her grandfather. She is a good mother of five children. Three of them are married and live separately, while the other two are going to school and also work on the farm. Her husband is a blacksmith and helph meet a little more of the family's needs,. Lonh L. will use her first loan to purchase piglets to raise additional income and the rest of the loan will supply her  farming business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and supplies for her farming business

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia J. is from the village of Natulongan, Kibawe Bukidnon. She is 55 years old, married, and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Cresencia owns and operates a business venture operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ready to wear items like shirts, ladies' blouses, and pants in the local community. Cresencia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Cresencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Cresencia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Cresencia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa R. is currently in the business of selling milk in a market and is requesting a loan to purchase more jerry cans of milk to sell. Hawa is 32 years old and single. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a retail shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more jerry cans of milk to sell

loans.name: Endurance

texts.en: Endurance is 36 years old, and she is married with children. She is a hardworking woman. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She sells groceries and loaves of bread to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting for the loan amount to purchase more groceries and loaves of bread to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto is a member of Virgen del Carmen de Patria, a communal bank comprised of 23 members in Patria, a town on the edge of the Amazon rainforest - 8 hours by rough road from Cusco.  Modesto is married and has five children, the youngest of which still lives at home and attends high school in Patria.

Modesto works as a carpenter in Patria.  He specializes in making and installing doors and windows and he also makes some furniture out of his workshop in his home.  Modesto’s business has been growing over the past 3 years and he is requesting a loan to buy additional wood and materials to expand his business.

Modesto appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Wood and other construction materials

loans.name: Fidel Ernesto

texts.es:
El Señor Fidel Ernesto B. C., Labora como vigilante en el Mercado Israel Lewites de Managua, el tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y este esta en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y un inodoro, para la construcción de un baño en su casa de habitación, ya que este se encuentra en mal estado.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

 dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ahora cuenta con una vivienda más segura.
texts.en:
Fidel Ernesto B. C. works as a watchman at Managua's Israel Lewites market. He is married and has a school-age child under his care. He has had two loans with CEPRODEL during two years. In this time, he used two loans to make home improvements to his house, thanks to the financing from CEPRODEL. He is an excellent client. The financing requested now is to buy building materils like cement, sand and a toilet to build a bathroom in his house because the one it has is in poor condition. His goal is to provide better security and living conditions for his children. He stated that CEPRODEL loans have allowed him to have a safer home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge and make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is 23 years old.  He has been operating in the boda-boda business (transporting people and light goods in town using a bicycle) in Naivasha town since 2008.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan after paying his first loan well.  He plans to purchase 2 more bicycles and employ people to operate them for him in the same industry.  He will buy one manual bicycle and one which has an engine.

His immediate future plan is to buy a motorcycle to operate in transport.  The upgrade from the bicycle will increase his source of income.

loans.use: To buy 2 more new bicycles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Rwengiri Modern Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
B. Agnes appears at the top left in the small photo just like in the group photo as the group leader.

It’s rare to come by female farmers in Uganda, but here is an exception. At the age of 38, B. Agnes is defying this stereotype and she has been a farmer from Kafunda in Ibanda for two years.

Agnes’s future prospects do not seem to be bad due to her hard work and friendliness. She will be able to expand her business and elevate her family’s standard of living, once she can access a loan to be able to pay her workers and buy manure and mulch her farm.

Agnes is grateful for her loans since she has benefitted a lot and makes more profits from the increased investments.

loans.use: To pay laborers, buy manure and mulch her farm.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn M. is from the village of Danao. She is 29 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jenelyn owns & operates a fishing business. She harvests and sells ocean-caught fish to the local community. Jenelyn has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Jenelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation, and her ability to engage in business activities. Jenelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. That loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Jenelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. For Jenelyn, this will be the 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living condition of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her fishing business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn B. is from the village of Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old. Jocelyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling beauty products from Avon and Natasha in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Flahn Town Women Group

texts.en:
Cecelia J. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called 'Flahn Town Women'. She is 45 years old, married, and has six children who range from 15 to 28 years old.  She was not privileged to go to school due to poverty.

For 19 years, she has been selling dried fish at the Flahn Town Market in Battery Factory, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning.  

She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more fish.  Her goal is to grow her business and get involved in a wholesale  activity and  continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Cecelia is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more fish.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans,  3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles monogames à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali.) 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, tous les prêts passés  se sont  bien dénoués. 
Ce groupe de femmes  excelle dans le commerce d’articles divers, tels les condiments alimentaires avec Awa Dembélé, le  bois de chauffe, le lait,  les pagnes wax etc.
Awa compte acheter avec son  prêt,  5 paquets de condiments alimentaires (cube maggi, huile de palme, sel de cuisine, oignons , choux, concentrée de tomate, poivre, poudre de gombo, les poissons séchés etc)
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et dans des villages avoisinants. Elle les revend au  marché de OUAYERMA I et en famille à une clientèle composée  de femmes au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The members of the group Benkadi are essentially married women averaging 37 years of age and three children living for the most part in monogamous families in OUAYERMA I, a district of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The women are on their sixth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers.  All their previous loans were settled.  This group of women excels in the commerce of various goods, such as condiments (as with Awa Dembélé), firewood, milk, wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), etc.  Awa plans on using her loan to buy five packets of condiments (Maggi bouillon cubes, palm oil, table salt, onions, cabbage, tomato paste, black pepper, okra powder, dried fish, etc.).  She gets her supplies at the big market of Sikasso City and from neighboring villages.  Accepting cash and often credit, she resells as a family to customers composed of women and men at the OUAYERMA I market. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,500 francs CFA.  Part of the profit will be used for family expenses, and the other part will be invested in the businesses.  Her ambition is to increase her sales to satisfy her customers more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying condiments

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard Z. was born in 1966 in Ijevan; she is married and has two children. For about 6 years she lived in Russia, but she returned to her native land and organized a food trading business. In the spring and summer months, she manages a food kiosk where she also sells fruit and vegetables. With the profit from her business, she takes care of her family, and also bought land, where she plans to construct a new shop for her business. For her new shop construction, she needs to increase her shop’s turnover and her profits.

Alvard seeks for a 250.000 AMD loan to buy household goods and fruits to resell.

loans.use: To buy household goods and fruits to resell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda M. is from the village of Cotta, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Imelda is married and has nine adult children. To make a living, Imelda owns and operates an eatery business. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

 In 2009, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her eatery. Imelda is now requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used for additional capital for her eatery. This will be the 3rd  loan taken out by Imelda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her eatery

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene V. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Rene is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rene owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rene has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rene is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital for her Sari-Sari store

loans.name: Angelita's Group

texts.en:
Angelita G. is from the village of Cabisera 14-16. She is the leader of an eight-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Angelita G..
Angelita is 51 years old, married, and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store selling rice in the local community. Angelita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Angelita joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Angelica Gerardina

texts.es:
Angélica de 56 años,  ella tiene una papelería (llamada en Ecuador “bazar”) y vive en la Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución). 

Ella empezó a trabajar vendiendo cuadernos a sus vecinos en época escolar, para ayudar con los gastos de manutención de su hijos, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar  mercadería, después de haber ahorrado dinero pudo readecuar su casa y ubicar su papelería en un mejor lugar. 

Para tener mas mercadería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo zapatos, cuadernos. En el futuro quiere aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Angélica is 56 years old and manages a stationery shop (also called a “bazaar” in Ecuador). She lives in Primavera de Duran, which is in a periurban area with a deteriorating ecosystem.

Angélica began working by selling notebooks to her neighbors during the school year so that she could pay for expenses related to raising her children. With a little effort, she was able to set aside some money to remodel her house and establish her shop in a better location.

To acquire more merchandise, Angélica will use her loan to buy shoes and notebooks. In the future, she wants to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes & notebooks

loans.name: Symon

texts.en:
Symon is the chairman of Kauma Self Help Group in Murang'a town, Central Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for over 30 years and has employed two farmhands. His mixed farm produces coffee, maize, and milk which he sells both to the local market and to Kenya Cooperative creameries respectively. He also depends on his pension pay to meet the needs of his family.

Symon has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 63,600 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will improve his income and enable him to pay school fees for his daughter in college and reduce his dependency on others. His primary challenges have been poor marketing and transportation problems due to seasonal roads. Despite the challenges, he hopes to acquire six more high yielding dairy cows in the future.

Symon is 57 years old. He is married with four children who are all adults. His youngest daughter is attending school. He says that the future is bright since farmers can access loan facilities with ease and thus are able to grow.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 38  años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de vendedora, ella trabaja con una empresa que vende productos de limpieza, ella ofrece estos productos a las diferentes tiendas que hay en la ciudad del Cusco, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para la mantención de su casa, para el estudio de su hija que estudia ingles.

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Wanchaq district, which belongs to the Cusco province, Cusco department. Rosa, age 38, is married and has two children. She combines her household chores with her work as a salesperson. She works for a company that sells cleaning products. She sells these products to different stores in the city of Cusco. She works from 7:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. She wants to have a grocery store. She is requesting a loan for maintenance on her house and for her daughter’s education. Her daughter is studying English. She is grateful to those people who, through these means, form part of her dream . She promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House maintenance and her daughter's education

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia D. is from the village of Lantay, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Lilia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her inventory. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Lilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the product offering.

loans.name: Safura

texts.en: Safura T. sells "wakye", a local dish prepared with rice and beans cooked together, and also sells plain rice at Nyinasi, a town near Abura. Safura is married and has three children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She will use the loan given to her to expand her business by ordering more rice and beans to cook her "wakye" and plain rice to sell. She will then use the profit from her business to cater for her children and also help her husband to provide for the family.

loans.use: order more rice and beans to cook

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma S. is from the town of Banga. She is 38 years old. Thelma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Thelma owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Thelma is just starting this business.

Thelma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Thelma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Thelma is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Philip Kipkorir

texts.en: Philip K. is 48 years old and is from the Chebara area in Kilgoris. He is married to Rosaline Kipkorir and they have eight children aged between 15  and two. Philip has a retail shop that he has been running for the past 30 years in Chebara centre near Chebara Primary School. He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, after paying back the previous loan successfully. His monthly income from the business is Kshs 12,000. He will use the money to buy flour, cooking oil, tissues, bar soaps, and soft drinks to add to his stock. The family depends on him and he will use the profit to take care of the family's basic needs. His desire is to see his business expand and be able to open up a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: To buy flour, cooking oil, tissues, bar soaps and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Sengee

texts.en: Sengee B. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and 5 daughters in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. He and his family all live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. His oldest son has recently graduated from university and is helping with his parents' businesses. Sengee's eldest daughter is a university student, while his two younger children attend a local secondary school. Sengee and his wife own and operate two family businesses selling and trading items such as spare parts and consumer goods in their town. He started his business in 2003 by selling ice cream and other small items, and through this he was able to start his machinery parts trading business with his wife. After many years of successful operation, they were able to expand their business and establish their second business, which is a consumer goods selling business. They sell a variety of common used goods that are imported from Erlian, a border city of China. The couple has built two stable businesses. In addition, Sengee works as a guard in a local government agency to supplement his earnings. In the future, he hopes to continue to grow both of his businesses and says that he is "planning to save enough money in order to purchase an apartment in Ulaanbaatar for my son." Sengee is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to increase his working capital for his businesses.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun C. (pictured in the photo) is a married, 52-year-old woman. Her husband, Mr. Song Sorn, is 52 years old, and they have been married since 1979. They have ten children: two sons and eight daughters. She notes that several of their children are married and live outside of their family home. She and her husband live on an island on the Mekong River, approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

To earn a living and to support her family, Savoeun sells desserts in her village. She buys ingredients from the local market and makes desserts from scratch by herself. Her husband is a weaver by profession. She is requesting her first loan in the amount of $200 to make additional desserts, which she will then sell for profits.

loans.use: To expand her business by making and selling additional desserts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more products

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared has been in the farming business for five years now. He has a mixed farm in Kisii town, western Kenya, that produces milk, maize, beans, bananas and tea which are all sold locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to meet his family's basic needs. 

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The income from this loan will be invested in the family's other businesses. He would like to venture into poultry and pig farming in the future. His challenges include lack of enough capital for expansion and a poor transport network.

Jared is 27 years old and married with 2 children ages 5 and 7. Both children attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC SONCCO ”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Marco; el tiene 55 años de edad y es casado  y tiene 4 hijos; el socio se dedica a al negocio de alquilar equipos de sonido para cualquier tipo de compromiso como matrimonios, fiestas de 15años, bautizos entre otros más el socio lleva años en este negocio y se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio el solventa los gastos de su hogar, siendo esta la única actividad que realiza el socio.  

El socio solicita el préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento de sus equipos de filmación y otra clase de equipos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mr. Marco belongs to the SUMAC SONCCO Communal Bank, located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Marco is 55, married, and has 4 children. He has a business where he rents out sound equipment for every kind of event, such as weddings, 15th birthday parties, and baptisms, among others. He has had this business for several years and is happy because this business covers his household costs. This is his only job.

He is requesting this loan for maintenance for his equipment.

He is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of his quotas.

loans.use: for maintenance for his film equipment and other equipment.

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: From Kompong Chhnang province, Mrs. Eam T., age 55, and her husband, Chomroeun, age 30, earn their daily profit by farming a rice crop. In addition, the family also buys bamboo to make baskets to sell. Recently, Mrs. Eam T. gets a lot of orders from her valued customers to make a basket for them. However, she doesn't have enough raw materials to make the baskets. So, Mrs. Eam T. is looking for a loan to buy bamboo for basket-weaving. She proposes that she will use the rest of her funds to buy rice for the whole family to eat.

loans.use: To buy bamboo for basket-weaving. She proposes that she will use the rest of her funds to buy rice for eating for the whole family.

loans.name: Luk

texts.en:
Luk N. is 27 and widowed. She lives with her family in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. She appears in this photograph with her mother. Luk is employed at a hotel to produce cakes and she earns a daily income of 5 USD. Each month, the family has to spend 50 USD on food and 55 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Luk is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase buffaloes to help plow her rice fields. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. In the future, Luk would like to use the additional income to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy buffaloes to help plow the rice field

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia de 44 años de edad, reside en Moncagua departamento de San Miguel, vive con su madre de 85 años de edad, una sobrina de 17 años de edad, tiene casa propia y se dedica a vender verduras.
El negocio de Antonia está ubicado en un local del mercado municipal de Moncagua, ella solicita un préstamo para comprar verduras (tomates, chiles, zanahorias), esta inversión le ayudara a surtir el negocio, a realizar la compra por mayor cantidad, tener mejores precios, lo que además le generara más ganancias.
El propósito de Antonia es agrandar el negocio y poder cubrir la demanda de los clientes, abrir un nuevo puesto para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Antonia, 44, lives in Moncagua, San Miguel department with her 85-year-old mother and a 17-year-old niece.  She owns her house and is a vegetable merchant.

Antonia’s business is located in a stall in Moncagua’s Municipal Market.  She is asking for a loan to buy vegetables (tomatoes, chilies, carrots).  This investment will help her stock the business, to buy in larger quantities, to provide better prices which will generate more profits.

Antonia’s purpose is to enlarge the business to meet customer demand and to open a new stand to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy vegetables (tomatoes, chilies, carrots)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: the purchase of school supplies, such as books, backpacks, notebooks, and uniforms

loans.name: Rio Grande Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Río Grande llamado así porque las integrantes viven esta población que lleva el mismo nombre. La población en la que habitan los integrantes es muy hermosa ya que existe variedad de flora y fauna además de que existe un río que atraviesa el poblado. Las 11 personas que integran el grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades y son Aura (venta de productos para la limpieza de autos), Hortencia y María (venta de antojitos), Cirila, Vianey y Sara (venta de productos por catálogos), Herminia (elaboración y venta de tortillas), Ysaura (venta de medicinas naturistas y vajillas), Natividad (venta de artículos para el hogar), Socorro (venta de pescado y refrescos), Hortencia (venta de tamales).
La representante de este grupo es la Señora Hortencia S. A. quien vive en unión libre con el señor Félix Raviera, tiene 5 hijos los cuales estudian la secundaria y primaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos como son, tacos, tostadas, enchiladas y sopes, negocio que adquirió hace 14  años debido a la necesidad que tenia ya que en esa apoca su esposo no tenia trabajo y necesitaban dinero es por ello que empezaron con este pequeño negocio. Hortensia solicito el préstamo solicito este préstamo para poder comprar más insumos como son: carnes, verduras, y otros productos que necesita. De las ganancias que obtiene es para el sustento de su familia y para que sus hijos estudien.
Otras de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Socorro una mujer de avanzada edad que a pesar de ello trabaja todos los días para obtener el pan de cada día ya que ella esta sola y tiene que mantener a su nieto que quedo a su cargo desde pequeño, es una mujer admirable que  a pesar de los años y de las diferentes enfermedades que a enfrentado ah sabido salir adelante, actualmente ella sufre de sordera pero eso no es impedimento para seguir adelante y trabajar, ella tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa en donde vende pescado y refrescos, ella solicito el préstamo para poder comprar mas productos ya que se le esta terminando y no tiene el dinero suficiente para comprar ya que de las ganancias que obtiene es para los gastos de sus casa y los gastos de su nieto para los útiles de la escuela.
Ella lo que pide a dios es que le vida para ver a su nieto crecer y que tenga una buena educación, aunque a su edad pues es muy complicado ya que ella tiene 70 años.
Ella le agradece a dios por la vida y a las personas que le realizaron el préstamo por confiar en personas como ella.
texts.en:
This group is called “Río Grande” because the members live in the town of the same name. The community in which the members live is quite beautiful because of the variety of animal and plant life that exists. In addition, there is a river that runs through the town. There are eleven members in the group who engage in the following activities:

• Aura sells automobile cleaning products. • Hortencia and María sell snacks. • Cirila, Vianey, and Sara sell products through catalogs. • Herminia prepares and sells tortillas. • Ysaura sells natural medicines and dinnerware. • Natividad sells household goods. • Socorro sells fish and soft drinks. • Hortencia sells tamales.

The group representative is Sra. Hortencia S. A.. She is in a common law marriage with Sr. Félix Raviera. They have five children who are either high school or elementary school students. Hortencia sells snacks such as tacos, tostadas, enchiladas, and “sopes” (fried tortillas topped with refried beans, onions, and hot sauce). She started this business fourteen years ago out of necessity because her husband did not have a job and they were in need of money. For this reason, she started a small business. Hortencia is requesting a loan to buy more supplies such as meat, vegetables, and other products that she needs. With her earnings, she is able to sustain her family and provide for her children’s education.

Another member of the group is Sra. Socorro. Even though she is an elderly woman, Socorro works every day to provide for her daily needs. She is single and has a grandson that she has been supporting since he was little. Socorro is an admirable woman who knows how to press forward despite her age and the number of illnesses she has had to endure. She currently suffers from hearing loss, but she does not let this impediment keep her from working and getting ahead. Socorro has a small business in her home where she sells fish and soft drinks. She is requesting a loan to buy more products because she is out of inventory and does not have sufficient funds to acquire more. The earnings she generates are used to cover her household expenses and her grandson’s education. She prays to God in hopes that she will see her grandson grow up and have a good education. Socorro knows that this will be difficult since she is 70 years old. She is grateful to God for life and the people who have entrusted individuals like her with these loans.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for making snacks.

loans.name: Kazo 2 Abamwe Group, Ibanda

texts.en: Charles B. is the leader of Kazo 2 abamwe group in Ibanda. He is 40 years old, married,and has six children, all of whom attend school. Charles sells produce, which includes bananas and maize, to the general public in Kyampangala. He works with his wife who sells milk and runs a grocery store. He has been in business for 20 years after working with his uncle who owned a produce store hence the experience. He is very hard working and hopes to educate all his children.  Charles is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase more matooke and maize.

loans.use: To purchase matooke and maize

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 31 years old and is married with three children between 3 and 8 years old. Innocent sells a vareity of merchandise in his business such as cooking oil, body lotion, bread, soap, juice and so on. Innocent has had his business for six years. His business is well organized.

Innocent has requested a loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing more foodstuffs like sugar, rice, cooking oil and so on. With his profit, he will be able to build his own house and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To puchase more goods like cooking oil, body lotion, bread, juice, and soap.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Don Domingo, tiene 66 años de edad, es originario de la comarca el Jicarito localizada en el departamento de León, el es casado, padre de 8 hijos, el se comerciante, se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos pero también vende pescado.  El empezó en este negocio junto con su mama cuando el tenia 16 años de edad, su madre le regalo un cerdo para que lo reprodujera, aprendiera a criarlos y a comercializarlos después fue la venta de pescado el vende en la comarcas cercanas tales como Telica, Malpaisillo, San Antonio. Aunque el tiene muy buenos clientes en las comunidades le gustaría tener un local en el mercado de León para vender mas.
El solicito el préstamo para comprar cerdos ya que es un mes excelente para ventas.  El espera que esta inversión le ayude a obtener ganancias que le permitan seguir invirtiendo, pues desea diversificar su negocio, quiere vender maíz también. 
El tiene como planes futuros comprar mas cerdos, gallinas y  comprar cosechas de maíz y frijol. Su próxima meta es ahorrar lo suficiente y ser  comerciante mayorista.
texts.en:
Mr. Domingo is 66 years old. He is originally from the district of Jicarito, located in the department of León. He is married and the father of eight children. He is a businessman who works buying and selling pigs. He also sells fish. He started this business together with his mother, when he was 16 years old. His mother gave him a pig so that he could breed it and learn to raise animals for sale. He started selling fish later.

He sells in nearby districts like Telica, Malpaisillo, and San Antonio. Although he has very good customers in these communities, he would like to have a spot at the market in León in order to sell more.

He is requesting this loan to buy pigs, as it is a very good time for sales. He hopes that this investment will help him to earn profits so that he can keep investing. He would like to diversify his business by selling corn as well. His future plans are to buy more pigs, hens, and to expand his crops to include corn and beans. After that, his goal is to save enough to become a wholesale merchant.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Saci

texts.en:
Saci is a married 22-year-old young woman who lives in the region of Bilasuvar of southern Azerbaijan. Her husband is a farmer, but his income was not enough to cover all the needs of a four person family. Their primary dream is for their two children to be able to study.

In 2008 Saci decided to help her husband to earn money for their family. She began a cattle-breeding business. Saci requested a loan of 1,300 AZN for the first time from AqroInvest and Kiva. With this loan, she bought three more cows to expand her business. Her goal for the future is to breed 10 more cows.

loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters. Only her daughters are able to attend school and get an education. Her sons support the family by working for a private organization. Her husband is a milk seller by profession. For that purpose, he has some buffalos at home. He takes their milk everyday and sells to community clients and milk shops for good profit. 

Sughran is a housewife. She stays at home and does her household tasks but in her spare time she also supports her husband by taking care of the cattle and milking them. 

Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, because her husband wants to buy another buffalo for the further expansion of his milk selling business. This will provide him more milk and increase his profits by selling more. He has been operating this business for the past 20 years and Sughran is very confident that by purchasing another buffalo he will not only build an asset for his business but also improve his income. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her husband’s business.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is showing the Fante kenkey she makes from corn at Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast.  Her husband is a farmer.  They have 5 dependants. 

As part of her marital responsibilities she cooks, and pays utility bills.  A loan of 200 GHS will help to buy two bags of maize to prepare Fante keykey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy two bags of maize to prepare Fante keykey for sale.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 35 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has seven children, four of whom are currently in school. Henry has a small retail shop that sells essential commodities such as sugar. He has run this business for four years. He also has rental houses.
To help expand his business, Henry has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Henry hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his retail business further.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Cambodia is a developing country that depends on mostly farming. Men, who lives in Prey Chor, Kompong Cham Province of Cambodia, is a farmer. She and her husband have cultivated the same field for a long time, which has given them experience. Together, they make a daily profit of 2.5 USD to support their family. 

Mem is requesting a 100 USD loan to purchase seed, fertilizer, and other farm materials. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's standard of living and send her children to the university to gain knowledge and improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, and farm supplies

loans.name: William David

texts.es:
William de 29 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona es agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

William se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años, además de ser productos consumido diariamente por las personas, una vez que realiza su cosecha lo comercializa en los diferentes mercados de la zona y fuera de ella,  con los ingresos que adquiera puede brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposa.

A observar que su negocio va creciendo y a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo y su producto, también para el pago de mano de obra por los trabajos de dehierbo y poda del cultivo y una vez que se inicie la cosecha de su limón, con las ganancias que obtenga podrá pagar su crédito y solventar las necesidades diarias de su familia.  William con trabajo y dedicación le brinda lo mejor a sus hijos, con la intensión de que ellos sean mejores en la vida y logren todos sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Sr. William is 29 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and children. The only service they receive is electricity. William resides in the rural section of the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area has businesses involving farming, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

William has been farming on his own land for four years. He grows lemons as well as other products that people consume on a daily basis. Once his crops are harvested, he sells them at different markets within and outside of the area. The income he earns helps to provide a better quality of life for his wife and children.

Noticing that his business has grown, William decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN so that he can buy fertilizers to improve his farmland and his product. He will also pay for labor to have the weeds removed from his land so that he can begin harvesting lemons. With the revenue he generates, he will be able to repay the loan and cover the daily needs of his family. Through work and dedication, William will be able to provide for his children. He intends for them to have the best in life so that they can achieve all of their goals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor to help with removing weeds.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is married with 3 children.  Elsie is 36 years old and lives in Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Elsie sells RTW's to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years.  Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan for 6,000 PHP to purchase more RTW's (ready to wear) clothing to retail.

Elsie has been a member of PMPC for over 1 year.  In the future, Elsie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more RTW's clothing to retail

loans.name: William

texts.en: William wants a loan to buy more land so as to expand his tea plantation. He is a forty-six-year-old married man living in his own semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a tea farmer and has been in the agricultural sector for twenty years. His dream is to construct a permanent house and buy land for tea expansion.

loans.use: to buy more land so as to expand his tea plantation

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en:
Nicodemus is 31 years old. He is married to Penina; they have no children yet. He owns a motorbike that he uses to offer transportation means to the residents of Kiserian, Nairobi. He has been doing this business for the last three years and gets an income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

He was introduced to KADET by KADET staff. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD with which he plans to buy spare parts to repair his motorbike. He will use the anticipated profit to buy another motorbike. He hopes to have a taxi through his hard work.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the motorbike.

loans.name: Faty

texts.fr:
Mariée mère de 7 enfants, Faty est âgée de 42 ans, et vie dans une famille polygame  avec son époux sa coépouse  et leurs enfants dans la ville de Koutiala. 
Pour des raisons sociales, Faty n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études, pour cela elle s’est intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis à bas âge. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par opter pour la vente des bois de construction depuis maintenant 15 ans. 
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle en quantité et  augmenter la taille de son activité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 6 ans. Elle a déjà bénéficié de 10 prêts dans l’association (prêt de groupe) tous payé sans difficulté  et est à son 3 eme prêt individuel dont les deux précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 2 chargements de bois de construction dans un  village de Koutiala, et effectue sa vente  devant sa porte  à une clientèle  de femmes et d’ hommes  au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour  le remboursement des intérêts,  participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of seven children, Faty is 42 years old and lives in a polygamous family with her spouse, her co-spouse, and their children in the town of Koutiala. 

For socio-economic reasons, Faty did not have the good fortune to attend school and for that reason she got into money-generating activities at a young age. After having tried several activities without success, she opted in the end for selling construction wood, which she has been doing for 15 years now. 

In order to satisfy the needs of her clientele as to quantity and to grow her business, she decided to turn to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso six years ago. She has already received 10 loans with her association (group loans), all repaid without problems, and is on her third individual loan with the two preceding individual loans correctly reimbursed. 
 
With this loan she expects to buy two loads of construction wood in a village near Koutiala and plans to sell her wood in front of her door, to a clientele composed of women and men, for cash or credit. 
 
She expects to make an average profit of 100,000 F CFA each month which she plans to use to reimburse the interest, participate in covering daily expenses for the family, and invest the rest in other money-earning undertakings.

loans.use: to buy construction wood.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 25 years old and married to Margaret, who runs a kiosk to bring some additional income to the family. They support a family of three people. He has a transportation business and he has been in this business for three years. Right now his monthly income from the business is KES 60,000.

He is borrowing a loan of KES 15,000, with which he intends to purchase goats for resale. He plans to buy more goats for sale with the anticipated profit from the business.

This is his first loan and his hopes are to buy a plot in Eldoret municipality and construct rental houses and also to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Ana Yancy

texts.es:
Ana, se decide por un nuevo financiamiento para mejorar el negocio, comprando mercadería, ya que debido a la necesidad de resurtir el negocio, se ánimo para volver a fortalecer en la compra de plátanos, pepinos, papas, güisquiles, manzanas, ciruelas, sandia, entre otros que le ayuden para continuar generando ganancias.
Este al igual que el anterior préstamo, Ana tiene la confianza que de las buenas ventas, alcanzara para pagar las cuotas y poder cubrir las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Ana has made up her mind to take out a new loan to improve her business, by buying merchandise. Because she needs to re-stock her business, she decided to build it up again, by buying plantains, cucumbers, potatoes, squash, apples, plums, watermelons and other things that help her to continue generating profits. 

As with her previous loan, Ana is confident that with good sales, she will manage to pay the instalments, and cover her family's household expenses.

loans.use: To buy plantains, cucumbers, potatoes, squash, apples, plums, and watermelons.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bokk Jom a été crée depuis le premier cycle du Banc Villageois . Il est composé de 13 membres qui habitent le même village. 

Madame Mame Gnilane debout à l'extrème droit sur la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. elle est agée de 21 ans elle est mariée et  mère de 2 enfants. elle s'active dans la vente de produits divers activité qu elle maîtrise bien pour l avoir pratiquer depuis longtemps. 

Avec les bénéfices de son activité elle va désormais participer a la dépense quotidienne et acheter des habits à ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Bokk Jom group was created during the first cycle of the Banc Villageois. It is composed of thirteen members who live in the same village.
Ms. Mame Gnilane, who is standing up and raising her hand at the far right of the photo, is the leader of the group. She is twenty-one years old, married, and the mother of two children. She works in sales of various products, an activity that she handles well because she has practiced it for a long time. 
With the gains from her business she will from now on participate in everyday spending and buy her children's clothing.

loans.use: to buy baskets of fish, sets of jewelry, and pigs.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: AmA. is a 49-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan. She is the mother of two children. AmA. is making candies from her home and she is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars to purchase molds to make new shapes of candies. AmA. is looking to open a shop for her candies.

loans.use: to purchase candy molds

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 62 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Vicenta has an internet café business in the Philippines. Vicenta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional computer unit and computer supplies.

Vicenta has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Vicenta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional computer unit and computer supplies.

loans.name: Oscar Rene

texts.es:
El sr. Oscar tiene 33 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de camaron y pescado, Oscar es un hombre trabajador y con muchos deseos de salir adelante, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, sus ventas las realiza a personas que viajan de Nicaragua hacia Honduras y viceversa, tiene muchos clientes ya que su producto es bueno y sus precios son bajos.
Oscar es padre de un hijo, su esposa se dedica al cuidado de su hijo y a los trabajos de la casa.
en sus tiempos libres visitan la iglesia.
texts.en:
Señor Oscar is 33 years old, and works selling shrimp and fish.  Oscar is a hard-working man, with great desire to get ahead in life.  He has been doing this type of work for three years, and makes his sales to people to people traveling from Nicaragua to Honduras and vice versa.  He has many customers as his product is good and his prices are low.

Oscar is the father of one son.  His wife works taking care of their son and their home.

In their free time, they attend church.

loans.use: to purchase shrimp and fish.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a single mother with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a beauty salon business, her potential customers are neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of high competition from other beauty salon operators. She dreams of expanding her business to improve her family’s living standard.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase cosmetics and hair weaves for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and hair weaves for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
40-year-old Corazon is a married woman with three children aged 14, 8 and 5. She and her husband run a fishing business in Trinidad, Bohol. According to Corazon, they have had this business for 15 years and earn about 9000 PHP per month.

Corazon has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets, bait and other materials. She hopes that this loan will help improve their business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, bait and other materials.

loans.name: Zebogul

texts.ru: Зебогул замужем. Ей 46 лет. У нее семеро детей. Ее муж вместе с сыновьями работает в Российской Федерации. Сама Зебогул имеет среднее образование. Она занимается скотоводством. В этой области она уже тринадцать лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота с целью увеличения их количества.
texts.en: Zebogul is 46 years old, married, and has seven children. Her husband and sons work away from home in the Russian Federation. Zebogul herself has a secondary education. She has been involved in animal husbandry for thirteen years. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle so she can increase their quantity.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Damaris Helena

texts.es:
Damaris es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo, sus ganas de trabajar le han permitido salir adelante junto con sus hijos. Damaris es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 3 hijos de 18, 5 y 1 año de edad, quienes son su motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio. Anteriormente, Damaris atendía un bar, el cual no le agradaba debido al mal ambiente de este negocio, es por esto que decidió tomar clases de elaboración de peluches y empaques con una amiga, y desde esto montó una tienda de sentimientos. En su negocio, ella misma produce los peluches y los empaques, de modo que su rentabilidad es más alta que las demás tienda. La desventaja que presenta Damaris es que su negocio está muy recién montado y existe mucha competencia en su sector. Es por esto que Damaris quiere aumentar la cantidad de productos que ofrece en su tienda para hacerla más atractiva para los clientes. Damaris, por esto, está en busca de que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas para la elaboración de peluches y empaques y poder tener mayor variedad en su tienda para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Damaris espera que de esta manera su negocio aumente las ventas considerablemente, pues podrá obtener mayor variedad de productos sin que sus ingresos mensuales se vean afectados. Damaris anhela que con mayores ingresos sus 3 hijos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y puedan cumplir su sueño de acceder a una educación de calidad. Damaris sueña con tener un gran negocio, ser la proveedora de peluches y empaques de otras tiendas, y generar más empleo del que genera actualmente.

loans.use: Compra de materias primas para la elaboración de peluches y empaques y poder tener mayor variedad en su tienda para ofrecer a sus clientes.

loans.name: Ndeye Arame's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 27 femmes faisant partie du banc villageois Adja Saly1. Les plus anciennes sont membres depuis l'inauguration dudit banc villageois le 09 juillet 2011. Ces femmes sont en bonne entente.

L'emprunteuse en vedette de ce groupe, Khady, est une femme de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 03 filles. Elle fait du petit commerce de tissus. Elle fait aussi de la couture. Sur la photo, elle est debout tout à fait à droite avec la main levée.

Avec son prêt, elle espère pouvoir agrandir son activité en achetant plus de tissus que dans le passé.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle voudrait pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group comprises 27 women who are members of the Adja Saly 1 "banc villageois".  Some of these women have been members since July 9, 2011, when the banc villageois was created.  The members of the group get along well with one another. 

Khady, the group's featured borrower, is a 50-year-old woman.  She is married and the mother of five children, including three girls.  She is involved in small retail business and sells fabrics.  She is also a seamstress.  She is standing at the far right of the photo, raising her hand.

With her loan, she hopes to be abe to expand her business and purchase more fabric than in the past.
