She hopes that her profits will help her to take care of her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for sewing and retail resale.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru:
Назокат добрая и милая женщина из маленького городка Куляб. Жители Куляба отличаются от жителей других районов несравнимым стилем гостеприимства. Назокат одна из тех уроженцев города, которые любит гостей и с удовольствием примет их в свой дом. Назокат замужняя женщина. Ее мужу 55 года, он работает охранником. У них единственный сын. Сын рабочий-строитель. Ее сын вместе с женой и двумя детьми живет с Назокат и ее мужем. Назокат обожает проводить время с внуками. Она не жалеет время для игр с внуками, но и не забывает о своей работе. 
  Назокат дома занимается шитьем "курпа" и "курпача". Курпа" и "курпача"- это ватные матрасы. "Курпа" шьют стандартно квадратном размере, ее используют в качестве одеяла. Курпача длинные матрасы используется как диваны. Она их шьет и продает. Назокат решила расширить деятельность и увеличить производства. Она надеется получить кредит и на заемные деньги приобрести ткани и вату. Назокат благодарит и верит в Вас.
texts.en:
Nazokat is a kind and sweet woman from a small town of Kulob. The residents of Kulob stand out from residents of other districts by an incomparable welcoming style. Nazokat is one of the natives of the town, who loves guests and would gladly invite them into her house. Nazokat is a married woman. Her husband is 55 years old, and he works as a security guard. They have an only son, who is a construction worker. Her son, his wife and their two children live with Nazokat and her husband. Nazokat adores spending time with her grandchildren. She does not spare time to play with the grandchildren, yet does not forget about her work.

Nazokat is involved in sewing kurpa and kurpacha at home. Kurpa and kurpacha are cotton-filled mattresses. Kurpa is sewn in a standard square size and used as a blanket. Kurpacha are long mattresses and used as couches. She sews and sells them. Nazokat decided to expand her business and increase her production. She hopes to obtain a loan and use the money to buy fabrics and cotton filling. Nazokat thanks and believes in You.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and cotton filling for sewing kurpa and kurpacha mattresses

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is 43 years old and has 11 children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Rosemary is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 16 farmers in Chwele District, Kenya.

Rosemary started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Rosemary’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 9.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights."

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Hard working, entrepreneurial, honest and responsible, these are the principal qualities that define Miss Felipa. She is mother of 4 children and is married. In 1981 she started selling cookies, snacks, candies, soft drinks, etc., in front of her house to help out her husband as his wages were not enoguh to cover the household costs (mostly because she had just resettled from another city, Cerro Azul, and they had many expenses following their change in residence to Tampico). All these years Miss Felipa has worked very hard, with the only objective being to obtain income to improve the family economy and to pay for their children's studies. This business has made it all possible as her husband's income is very small.

Today she requires a loan in the amount of $925 that she will use towards the purchase of merchandise to increase her sales and consequently her income. With your generosity you can contribute to the wellbeing of Felipa and her family. Do not wait any longer. She will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Trabajadora, emprendedora, honesta y responsable, son las principales cualidades que definen a Doña Felipa, quien es madre de 4 hijos y es casada. En 1981 ella comenzó vendiendo galletas, frituras, dulces, refrescos, etc., en la parte delantera de su casa para ayudar a su esposo, ya que lo que él ganaba no nos alcanzaba para los gastos del hogar, sobre todo porque habían llegado de otra ciudad, Cerro Azul, y tuvieron muchos gastos por el cambio de residencia a Tampico. Todos estos años Doña Felipa ha trabajado arduamente con el único objetivo de obtener ingresos para mejorar su economía familiar y además poder solventar los estudios de sus hijos, que si esta actividad sería imposible, pues el sueldo de su esposo es muy bajo.

En éste momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $925 DLLS, mismos que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Con tu generosidad puedes contribuir a el bienestar de Felipa y su familia, no lo dudes más, ella de lo agradecederá sinceramente

loans.use: purcahse merchandise

loans.name: Misael Albino

texts.en:
Albino produces rice, corn, soy beans, mango and plantains. He is extremely happy to have such a productive land. He also has a few cows, chickens, pigs ,and ducks, but arecomplimentary sources of income. He makes ends meet with the profits he makes from rice production. In his home he lives with his wife, kids, some grandchildren and his mother. He will invest the loan in preparing his lands and in fertilizer. He hopes with the investments he will have more productivity from the land and to fix the roof of his home.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large mulitnational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by the small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soy beans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soy beans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice farming

loans.name: Phau

texts.en: Mrs. Phau P. is 36 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She runs a farm growing crops and a variety of vegetables. Typically, she makes a meager sum from her output, while her husband is a construction foreman and makes about $3/day in revenue. To help in financing and servicing the family's expenses, Phau P. is asking for a loan amount of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for one of her children to operate a business as a motor-taxi driver. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family's savings.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her child to run a business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia C. T. works at weaving, as well as raising chickens and other home-based work. Her dream is to set up a tailoring shop and, to start, she’s already bought a sewing machine. Now, she’s mulling over shops where she can operate a tailoring business. This loan will be used to invest in the purchase of cloth and other materials that a tailoring business requires.

Lucia and her husband, Jose, have three children and together they’re fighting to get ahead and provide schooling for their kids. Their dream is to see their family overcome every obstacle.

The loan that they’ve asked for will be used to draw a good base of customers so that in the future they’ll be able to have a tailoring business even larger than the one they used to dream about.

Written by Juana Cedillo.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucia C. T. se dedica a las actividades en el hogar y el cuido de sus pollos y a la vez de sus tejidos. Su sueño es poner una sastrería, y para empezar ya compraron una maquina de coser ahora están pensando en un local donde pueda funcionar la sastrería. Este prestamo se usara para invertirlos en la compra de tela y otros materiales que son necesarios en una sastrería

Lucia está unida con José y tienen tres hijos y juntos luchan para poder salir adelante y darles el estudio a sus hijos. Que es el sueño de ellos es ver triunfar a su familia.

Los resultados que esperan es llegar a tener una buena clientela y así en un futuro mejor poder tener una sastrería más grande de lo que soñaban.

Escrito por Facilitadora Juana Cedillo.

loans.use: To Invest in her tailoring shop

loans.name: Francisca Salazar

texts.en:
Francisca, 44, married and mother of 4 children (two boys and two girls), runs a fried food store that she started nine years ago. The couple is living with their two girls (10 and 7 years old), since the boys (21 and 18 years old) are working in another part of the country. The oldest guy is actually a military student. The girls are going to the local public school.

Francisca prepares various types of fried foods like fried fish or bananas. She wants to continue diversifying the range of foods she offers to her clientele. She'll introduce foods like spaghetti, stuffing, and some hotcakes. She also wants to give a new touch to the locale where she prepares and sells the fried foods. For those purposes, and in order to keep taking care of this large family, Yudelka is requesting the loan of US$ 325 that she hopes she'll have soon.

loans.use: To introduce a new category of foods (spaghetti, stuffing, hotcakes) to her business and to remodel the locale

loans.name: Domitila Teodora

texts.es:
Ever since she was a little girl, Domitila has always been committed to the agricultural activities because she comes from a family distinctly of farmers and cattlemen. All the life lessons that she received in her home have taught her to practice efficient labor in the fields of cultivation, dedicating herself to sowing potatoes, corn, and vegetables. She also raises cows and grows alfalfa for them year after year. Thanks to this activity she can satisfactorily meet the needs of her family and be a very important leader in the maintenance of her home, along with her husband who also aids her in these activities. Although last year she lost her entire harvest and earnings when an unending winter force fell over her fields, this did not discourage her and she continues forward by having planned to grow spinach and carrots this year during the wait period for the potato and corn harvests. Domitilia does all these activities for her three children who motivate her to continue forward with her longings to offer them the best so that they can achieve higher education. For this reason she is requesting a loan for this growing season to buy seeds and fertilizer and also improve her little cattle stable. All this and each of these earnings will be for the benefit and education of her children. Let's support Domitila in her noble mission to prepare her children for the life ahead of them.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Domitila, desde muy niña ha estado siempre ligada a las actividades agrícolas ya que proviene de una familia netamente agrícola y ganadera, todas las lecciones de vida que recibió en su hogar han hecho que ella ejerza de una manera eficiente su labor en sus campos de cultivo, dedicándose a sembrar papa, maíz y verduras, así mismo cría vacas y para ellas cultiva la alfalfa, año tras año. Gracias a esta actividad puede solventar satisfactoriamente las necesidades de su familia y ser una protagonista muy importante en la manutención de su hogar, junto a su esposo que ahora también la apoya en estas actividades.A pesar de que el año pasado perdió totalmente su cosecha y ganancias cuando cayó sobre sus campos de cultivo la implacable fuerza del invierno, esto no la desanimó y sigue adelante y ha planeado para este año sembrar espinacas y zanahorias durante el tiempo de espera de la cosecha de papa y maíz. Todas estas actividades, Domitila, las realiza por el bien de sus tres hijos que la motivan a seguir adelante con sus anhelos a fin de ofrecerles lo mejor para que lleguen a superarse estudiando.Es por ello que para esta época de siembra solicita un préstamo con el propósito de comprar semillas y abonos y también para mejorar su pequeño establo de vacas, así mismo todas y cada una de estas ganancias serán en beneficio y para la educación de sus hijos.Apoyemos a Domitila en su noble misión de preparar a sus hijos para la vida.

loans.use: Buy seeds, fertilizer, and improvements for the stalls in her little stable.

loans.name: Sununa

texts.en:
Sununa is married with 8 children and also cares for 10 orphans. For the past 13 years, Sununa has been the owner of the Sebbi Metal Workshop. With her Kiva loan, she plans to purchase another welding machine and buy more metal for her shop. Metal workshops are quite common along the roadways. As with most services, suppliers and manufacturers here, you will tend to find several of the same type of businesses one right next to the other.

Although fabricators, using welding machines can make most anything out of metal, the bread and butter of the business tends to be metal doors, gates, railings and windows. Their shops are blackened with the "soot” of their trade and the blinding sparks can be seen some distances along the roadways.

loans.use: Sunwna plans to use her loan to purchase another welding machine and buy more metal for her shop.

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde F. is 37 years old, married with two, and hails from Ishashi in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells clothes, weavon (hair weaving product), attachments (extensions) and is also a stylist. She has been into her business since 1987 and needs the loan of $875 to buy more weavon, attachments and clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more weavon (hair product) and attachments (extensions)

loans.name: Sabankul

texts.ru:
Sabankul Ziyaevich H. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 45 years old, married and has 6 children. He has a college education and is an agriculturist by profession. He is currently unemployed. Sabankul is in the business of buying and selling of calves. His experience in this field is 10 years. He plans to use the loan to buy more calves to feed them and then to resell. This business is the main source of income for his family. The development of the farming sector also allows to supply the local residents with meat. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хасанов Сабанкул Зияевич житель города Яван.Возраст 45 лет , женат имеет 6 детей.Образование высшее. По снециальности Огроном. В данный момент без работы. Занимается купле продажей бычков. Опыт работы 10 лет.Кредит планирует использовать на покупку бычков, откормки и последующей реализацией. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Так же развитие сельхоз сектора позволяет обеспечить население мясом. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Blanca Margarita

texts.es:
Blanca E. is an entrepenourial woman who is married and has 3 children of ages 14, 12, and 10 months. A few years ago, she went through a difficult financial situation since her husband, who was the main provider for the family, fell ill. This left them with no money to pay for expenses, so she started to make and sell steamed tacos. Little by little, her business started to prosper and currently, her husband helps her manage and run the establishment.

Due to lack of funds, she is looking for a loan of $425 USD which she will repay in 6 months to renovate her business' image, better her presentation and increase her sales. Lets support Blanca and her family so that her business thrives.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca E. es una mujer emprendedora esta casada y tiene 3 HIJOS DE 14, 12 AÑOS Y 10 MESES, hace unos años vivió una difícil situación económica ya que su esposo quien era el sostén de su familia enfermo, por lo que al no tener dinero para solventar los gastos elaboro tacos a vapor y empezó a venderlas, poco a poco su negocio empezó a progresar y actualmente su esposo le ayuda en el manejo y operación del mismo.

Debido a la falta de dinero para renovar la imagen de su negocio es que ella ahora busca un crédito por US$425 que pagara en 6 meses para así tener una mejor presentación e incrementar sus ventas. Apoyemos a Blanca y su familia para que su negocio prospere.

loans.use: Renovate her shop's image

loans.name: Hadija's Tushikamane Group

texts.en:
Hadija is 38 years old and married, with two children, ages 11 and 13. Hadija sells soft drinks, which she started in 2002. Everyday, she works from 7:30am to 2pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her group members Ester, Salma, Sofia and Raufu, who have businesses dealing in food vending, charcoal sales and soft drink sales.

loans.use: To buy more soft drink items for her business.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Miss Chanthy B., 40, is single and lives with her widow mother who is a silk weaver. The family lives on an Island on Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Miss Chanthy has been a weaver since she was 17 years old. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase silk material to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji is the wife of Ifitkhar A.. (Baji is an Urdu term meaning "eldest sister".) The couple lives in a two-room brick house with their three sons in Arifwala, Pakistan. Her eldest son, Sultan Haider, is in kindergarten.

Yasmeen successfully repaid her first loan from a microfinance institute of Pakistan. She used the money to purchase a vehicle made by Mazda. She is a housewife and runs an academy where she teaches young girls the skill of stitching clothes. Her daily income is approximately five dollars.. She is requesting a loan to buy an electric sewing machine.

She has one other member named Nasreen baji who wants loan to buy donkey cart. The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine to teach young girls how to sew

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr:
Born on August 12, 1977 in Zinvié, in Atlantique County, Ms. Charlotte O. is originally from Sakété, in Ouémé County. She is married and the mother of two. Her husband Germain ADEYE is a tailor-embroiderer by profession. She is improving in the sale of various goods, such as: sandalettes (flip-flop sandals), plates, drinking glasses, kitchen utensils, etc. She has been in sales and distribution for almost seven years and stocks up at the international marketplace of Cotonou. She is on her fifth loan. After the distribution of her different articles, she sees her customers to collect payment. Her plan is to get settled in a shop in order to limit trips to her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née le 12 Août 1977 à Zinvié dans le département de l'Atlantique, dame O. Charlotte est originaire de Sakété dans le département de l'Ouémé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Son mari ADEYE Germain est Couturier-Brodeur de profession. Elle évolue dans la vente de divers articles comme: les sandalettes, les assiettes, les vers à boire, les ustensiles de cuisine, etc. Elle est dans la distribution vente depuis près de sept ans et s'approvisionne au marché international de Cotonou. Elle est à son cinquième prêt. Après la distribution de ses différents articles, elle passe chez ses clients pour la collecte.Son projet est d'avoir une boutique pour s'installer afin de limiter les déplacements vers clients.

loans.use: To buy plastics, kitchen utensiles, plates, and various soaps

loans.name: Thi Huong

texts.vi:
Mrs. V. Thi Huong, 42 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2003. She borrowed the first loan of 2,000,000VND (125USD) to invest in her small general store in the market. Her daily income from this is about 100,000VND (6.25USD). Since joining the Fund, the income from this business has been higher. Besides the store, she also invests in rearing pigs. This is also the main source of income for her family, as every year she can sell 3 rounds of pigs, each round 3 tonnes, yielding a profit of about 35,000,000VND (2187.50USD). This time, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) to continue investing in rearing pigs. Her average monthly income is 5,000,000VND (312.50USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thi Hương 42 tuổi, Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003. Vòng vốn ban đầu gia đình chị xin vay 2.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán nhỏ. Hàng ngày vợ chồng chị đi chợ thu nhập bình quân 100.000đ. Từ khivào Quỹ việc vay vốn của gia đình chị thuận lợi nên thu nhập từ buôn bán của gia đình chị cũng được cao hơn. Ngoài những lúc đi chợ anh chi vẫn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn đây cũng là nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị, bình quân mỗi năm gia đình chị xuât 3 lứa lợn mỗi lứa. 3 tạ cho thu nhâp khoảng 35.000.000đ. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân.5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Rearing pigs

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es: Ninfa, a su corta edad (22) sufrió la penosa perdida de su esposo Fredy de 23 años de edad, con quien tenía muchos planes y proyectos en la vida, desde entonces, trata de sobre llevar este episodio y salir adelante junto a su pequeño niño, quien la motiva a cumplir con los sueños y proyectos que algún día tuvo con su compañero.Esta joven madre pone su mejor esfuerzo y creatividad  en cada una de las prendas que teje, gracias a eso, tiene  gran cantidad  de  solicitudes, por ello recurre a este préstamo, dinero que será invertido en adquirir variedad de lana, para seguir tejiendo sus prendas y cumplir satisfactoriamente con los pedidos de sus exigentes clientes.
texts.en:
Ninfa, a su corta edad (22) sufrió la penosa perdida de su esposo Fredy de 23 años de edad, con quien tenía muchos planes y proyectos en la vida, desde entonces, trata de sobre llevar este episodio y salir adelante junto a su pequeño niño, quien la motiva a cumplir con los sueños y proyectos que algún día tuvo con su compañero.Esta joven madre pone su mejor esfuerzo y creatividad en cada una de las prendas que teje, gracias a eso, tiene gran cantidad de solicitudes, por ello recurre a este préstamo, dinero que será invertido en adquirir variedad de lana, para seguir tejiendo sus prendas y cumplir satisfactoriamente con los pedidos de sus exigentes clientes.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool so she can sew in order to be able to meet the demand of her clients.

loans.name: Arissou

texts.fr: Arissou T. est âgé 30 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. Il réside à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Arissou est revendeur de CD audio et vidéo. Il souhaite avec ce crédit alimenter sa boutique en achetant des cartons de CD et aussi des lecteurs afin de satisfaire les demandes de la clientèle. Les profits que généreront ses vents lui permettront de mieux satisfaire les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Arissou T., age 30, is married and the father of one child. He lives in Danyi, a village located approximately 175 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Arissou sells audio and video CDs. With this loan, he wishes to bolster the stock of his shop by purchasing boxes of CDs, as well as CD players, in order to better meet customer demand. The profit he will make out of his sales will enable him to better support his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of CDs as well as CD players

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo Chug Rodríguez tiene 53 años y pertenece al Banco comunal Mujeres Emprendedora II, vive en la calle Desamparados 720 del balneario Buenos Aires Norte del distrito Víctor Larco de la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria, quedó huérfana por lo que no pudo continuar sus estudios. Se casó a los 14 años pero por falta de comprensión se separó de su pareja.
Tiene 4 hijas cada cual con su compromiso.
Trabajaba en venta de zapatos y ropa, llegó a tener un restaurant, actualmente trabaja en sociedad con su hija, tienen un locutorio y una bodega de golosinas y otros productos. El negocio se ubica en su casa.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró las golosinas.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas comprará zapatos para ir a vender a Lima y de allí traerá ropa.
Consuelo sueña con tener un negocio bien implementado y poder cubrir todos sus gastos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Consuelo Chug Rodríguez is 53 years old and belongs to Enterprising Women II Communal Bank. She lives at 720 Desamparados Street in the resort town of North Buenos Aires in the Victor Larco district, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied until 9th grade but then became orphaned and could not continue her studies. She married at 14 years old but due to a lack of understanding, she separated from her husband. She has four daughters, all of whom are on their own. She worked selling shoes and clothing, then she had a restaurant, and now she works alongside her daughter at their phone booth business and a general store with sweets and other products. The businesses are located in her home. With the first loan of 300 soles ($100), which were repaid over 4 months, she bought sweets. With this loan of 800 soles ($275), which she will repay over 6 months, she will buy shoes to sell in Lima and she will bring clothing back with her. Consuelo dreams of having a well-stocked business and being able to cover all of her expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes

loans.name: Sorphea

texts.en: Mrs. Sorphea S. is a farmer in Trapaing Suom village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Or Da, is a construction worker. Even though they have different businesses, they earn little income to provide a better life for their family. Thus, Mrs. Sorphea S. decided to ask for a loan to combine with her saving to buy timber to build a house for her family. She is 35 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To add her saving to buy timber to build a house for her family.

loans.name: Candida

texts.es:
La señora Cándida es socia del Banco Comunal “Flores la Pampilla” del distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos. Cándida con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró prendas de vestir pata venderlas. Nos cuenta que ha variado su negocio vendiendo diferentes tipos de prendas de vestir. Tiene casi 7 años trabajando con el banco. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1000 que pagará en 4 cuotas comprará polleras, mantas para venderlas. 
Cándida desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia
texts.en:
Cándida is a member of the Community Bank “Flores la Pampilla” of the district, province and department of Puno. She is 52 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Cándida used her first $100 loan to purchase clothes for sale. She comments that she diversified her business selling different types of clothes. She has been working with the bank for almost 7 years. With this loan of $350, which will be paid off in 4 months, she will purchase skirts and blankets for sale. Cándida would like to continue working to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes typical of her area (skirts and blankets).

loans.name: La Buena Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Grupo la Buena Esperanza esta formado por 4 personas las cuales se conocen hace varios años y han trabajado juntos por mucho tiempo.
la Sra. M. C. tiene 33 años de edad y se encuentra en union libre con el Sr. Luis M. con el cual han procreado un hijo que tiene 2 años de edad, ella se dedica a la sastreria y tiene experiencia en el mercado competente desde hace 7 años y tiene muchos clientes.
La Sra. Eydi M. tiene un hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y costura desde hace 4 años, su compañero de hogar trabaja de motorista y los dos sacan adelante su hogar.
la Sra. B. ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 20 años en el barrio nacaome, valle, su negocio es bien visitado por muchos clientes ya que les gusta mucho el sabor de sus comidas.
texts.en:
The group "La Buena Esperanza" has 4 partners that have known each other for several years and have worked together for a long time.

Mrs. M. C. is 33 years old and lives with Mr. Luis M.. They have a 2 year-old son. She is a tailor and she has experience on the competitive market and has many clients.

Mrs. Eydi M. has a son. She has been selling cosmetics and clothing for 4 years. Her life partner is a motorist and both maintain their home.

Mrs. B. has sold food for 20 years in the neighborhood of Nacaome, Valle. Her business is visited by many clients as they enjoy the seasoning of her meals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material for tailoring, cosmetics and raw material for candy production

loans.name: Nila

texts.es: Nila tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en la casa que lograron adquirir hace un par de meses. Ella se dedica  a la venta de cosmeticos desde hace 10 años, y su principal actividad es salir a distribuir sus pedidos de casa en casa, para lo cual se toma 8 horas y lo realiza en las mañanas, esto no le desagrada pues gracias a este negocio pudo relacionarse con las demas personas de su localidad y entrelazar lazos de amistad con sus vecinas. Ella tiene el anhelo de tener con el tiempo un local, pues su gran cantidad de productos no puede venderlos con comodidad porque no tiene un lugar propicio para ello, pero instalando un bazar dentro de su hogar podría incrementar sus ventas y generar más ingresos económicos, pues la venta de cosmeticos es muy rentable ya que la moda y el buen vestir atrae a las señoritas y señoras del lugar. Ella está trabajando con MFP PRISMA hace varios años, este es su séptimo crédito, los cuales le ayudan a mejorar su negocio y tiene en su grupo un espacio de socialización. El dinero que solicita es para comprar una vitrina para poder exhibir sus productos, en lo cual invertirá 2500 soles.
texts.en:
Nila is 51 years old, and lives with her husband and two children in a house they acquired a few months ago. She has been selling cosmetics for 10 years, and her main activity is going out to distribute orders door to door, which takes eight hours every morning. She doesn't mind it because thanks to this business she has been able to meet other people in her community and form bonds of friendship with her neighbors. She longs to eventually have a shop, since she can't sell her large quantity of products comfortably because she doesn't have an appropriate place for them. But by setting up a shop in her home, she could increase her sales and generate more income. Cosmetic sales are very profitable because style and fashion appeal to women young and old in her town. She has been working with MFP PRISMA for several years, and this is her seventh loan. They have helped her improve her business, and the group provides her with a place to socialize. The money she has requested is to purchase a display case in which to display her products, which will cost 2500 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a display case for her products

loans.name: Menglikul

texts.ru: Менгликул мужчина 37 лет , женат имеет четверых детей, работает в колхозе Уткансоя пастухом мелкого скота колхоза.Со своей работы Менгликул не получает денежной платы , а получает лишь продукты питания рассчитанные на год проживания.Поэтому Менгликул занимается откормом и продажей скота.Для получения кредита Менгликул обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Menglikul is a 37 year old man, married and with four children, who tends the sheep of the Utkansoy collective farm. He receives no salary for his work, only a year's worth of foodstuffs, so he also raises and sells cattle. He came to Microinvest to obtain a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feed and sale of livestock

loans.name: Kun

texts.en: Mrs. Kun S. was born in 1961 and she lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. She is a rice soup seller. Her husband, Mr. Hong Kem, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Although this couple work hard, they still earn insufficient  income to support their household. To improve their standard of living, Mrs. Kun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy 10 piglets and pig meal for her pig breeding business. She would use the rest of the money to dig a well for her family. She has three children. One is employed in a garment factory, another uses the horse and cart to transport  goods and passengers, and the youngest one is enrolled in the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy 10 piglets and pig meal for her pig breeding business.

loans.name: Corina Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Corina Leonor O. Orbegoso tiene 59 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Buen Pastor, vive en el caserío Lluin del distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudio hasta segundo grado de primaria, le hubiese gustado seguir estudiando pero lamentablemente no tuvo apoyo departe de su familia.
Se casó a los 26  años y tuvo dos hijos, de los cuales uno falleció.
Corina tiene una panadería y una bodega donde vende golosinas, pasteles y pan, su trabajo empieza a las tres de la mañana para poder aprovechar el tiempo.
Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles cancelados en 4 cuotas, con lo que compró insumos para su panadería.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que cancelará en 6 cuotas comprará insumos para la panadería y  para su pequeña bodega.
texts.en:
Señora Corina Leonor O. Orbegoso is 59 and belongs to the communal bank, "Buen Pastor" (Good Pastor). She lives in the town of Lluin, in the district of Mache, in the province of La Libertad, Perú. She studied through second grade. She would have liked to keep studying, but unfortunately she didn't have her family's support. She got married when she was 26 and had two children, one of whom passed away. Corina has a bakery and a grocery store where she sells candy, cakes, and bread. She starts working at 3 a.m. to make the most of her time. Her first credit was for 300 PEN, which was paid off in 4 months. She used it to purchase supplies for her bakery. With this credit of 800 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase supplies for her bakery and her small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy supplies for her bakery and small grocery store

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is 36 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. Some of her children are in the junior high school and others are in the primary school. Her husband is a cocoa farmer. Ama lives with her husband and the children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Ama is a trader. She trades in smoked fish. She procures the goods from nearby towns and sells on a tabletop in the market square. Ama has been in this business for more than 15 years and desires to expand her business. Ama is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Jonathan Omar

texts.es: Jonathan Omar L. G. vive en Santa Tecla departamento La libertad,Junto a su novia y su padre y madre.Jonathan se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado de Santa Tecla, sus principales clientes son los vendedores del mercado ya que Jonathan ofrece sus productos a mayoreo, a pesar de tener tan solo 22 años de edad Jonathan tiene  11 años de experiencia en el negocio, ya que sus padres también se dedican a la venta de verduras desde que el era un niño hasta la fecha. Jonathan solicita este crédito por que quiere surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Jonathan Omar L. G. lives in the La libertad neighborhood of Santa Tecla with his girlfriend, mother, and father.

Jonathan sells vegetables in the Santa Tecla market. His primary clients are other sellers in the market, and therefore Jonathan offers his products wholesale. Although he is only 22 years old, Jonathan has 11 years' experience in the business, as his parents also sell vegetables and have done so since he was a child.

Jonathan seeks this loan in order to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his inventory of vegetables

loans.name: Isidro Eradio

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo en el Mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Isidro P. se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos ferreteros ofreciendo todo tipo de producto del ramo de la ferretería.

A este negocio se dedica desde hace dos años y se ha logrado ver el cambio que ha tenido el negocio habiéndose desarrollado cada día más. Hoy en día espera ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de los productos ferreteros y así continuar logrando la satisfacción de todos sus clientes en el mercado.
texts.en:
With a lot of enthusiasm in the central market of Chinandega city, Isidro P. dedicates himself to his business of selling hardware products, offering all types of products from the hardware industry. He has worked in this business for two years and has been able to see the business change, developing more every day. Today he hopes to benefit from a loan to buy more hardware products and thus continue winning the satisfaction of his customers in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hardware products

loans.name: Nelly Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Nelly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor Azangarina II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Azangaro, Provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 53 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa,  vive en el Barrio Vilcapaza.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de útiles de escritorio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, comprará cuadernos, fólders, lapiceros, engrampadores, grapas, chinches, etc, para su negocio.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando para solventar los gastos familiares.

A ella le gusta la responsabilidad que hay en su Banco Comunal y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Nelly belongs to the Flor Azangarina II Community Bank, which is located in the Azangaro district, Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 53, married, and has three children. She has a high school education. She lives in the Vilcapaza neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, which she used to buy desk supplies. With this loan for 500 PEN, she will buy notebooks, folders, ballpoint pens, staplers, staples, and thumbtacks, etc. for her business. Her biggest wish is to keep working to pay the family expenses. She likes the community bank’s responsibility and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy notebooks, folders, ballpoint pens, staplers, staples, and thumbtacks, etc.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
La señora Amanda S. tiene ya mas de cinco años dedicándose a la como distribuidora de productos de belleza. 
Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos para su familia ya que su esposo le ayuda, pues por su problema de diabetes le afecta la vista y no le pueden dar trabajo en otras partes. 
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar la mercancía para mostrarla a su clientas y así pueda vender mejor. 
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que extra que genere su negocio con está inversión.
texts.en:
Sra. Amanda S. has 5 years experience working as a distributor of beauty products. Her business is the primary source of family income because her husband is disabled. He suffers from diabetes, which affects his vision and makes it difficult for him to maintain a job.

Sra. Amanda is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to present to her clients and thereby increase her sales. She plans to repay the loan with the extra income generated as a result of this business investment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Mr. S. Sao, 53, and his wife, Mrs. Bora Soy, 51, got married in 1978. They have five children: three sons and two daughters. One of them is married and lives in a separate house; two sons are construction workers; one daughter is a garment factory worker and the other one is in school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Two about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

S. has been a mason since 1981. He does his work in his village and in nearby villages. His wife stays at home and takes care of the household. His children don’t have their own transportation; they spend a lot of money to take motor taxis. So, S. is asking for a loan of US$ 1,200 to purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to work.

loans.name: Mujeres Hacia Un Futuro Mejor Group

texts.en:
The communal bank “Mujeres Hacia un Futuro Mejor” (Women Towards a Better Future) has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past year. “Mujeres Hacia un Futuro Mejor” currently has 10 members, all of whom live in and around the city of Pucallpa. Though some of the 13 original members had some difficulties in their previous loan cycle, the communal bank collectively overcame its problems and its current members are now eager to receive their next loan.

The women of “Mujeres Hacia un Futuro Mejor” dedicate themselves to a variety of different business ventures. Many of them have small home-based restaurants and/or sell barbecued meats. Others sell vegetables, fish, chicken or basic grocery items. They are requesting a total loan amount of 3800 soles, and each will invest her share in her business. Each member is gradually working toward achieving her business goals.

Señora Nelly M. is the official president of “Mujeres Hacia un Futuro Mejor.” She is 52 years old and is married with two adult children, aged 28 and 24. Nelly works together with her husband in a fish sales business and plans to invest her loan in purchasing ice and coolers to store her product. Nelly buys her fish in the small agricultural and fishing communities along the banks of the Ucayali, the wide brown river that flows past the city of Pucallpa and eventually joins the Amazon to the north.

loans.use: Inputs necessary for the individual businesses of each communal bank member

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama Z. is from the village of Lower Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 61 years old. Salama is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Salama owns and operates a transportation services business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating jeepney transport services (a popular means of public transportation in the Philippines). Salama has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 8,400 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Salama joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Salama is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair existing vehicles for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Salama from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicles for better service

location.town: Lower Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miraim is a 47 year married with six children aged between 4and 20 years All her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. Miriam resides and rents three roomed house where she is staying with four people. There is electricity and no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week. Miriam owns a poultry farm in Kawempe. She buys chicken feeds from Owino market She uses public transport to and from shopping.  She sells to all categories of people and on both retail and whole saleMiriam has been with MCDT for seven year servicing her twentieth loan. working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more chicken feeds and chicks. Miraim is aspiring of owning 700 chickens.

loans.use: To buy  more chicken feedsand chicks

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 39 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh in the  southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their child. Hasan has been selling espresso coffee for three years. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and phone cards for his work. This is the first time that Hasan has requested a loan. 
His clients are his neighbors and people from his region. Hasan decided on this business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on opening a shop to sell mobile phones and phonecards.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and phone cards for his work.

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
“Patience is the key to success," says Cerelina. This is her favorite quotation and also her guiding principle in her life. 

Cerelina is a vegetable vendor in her village and in the market; her husband Wilson is working as a farmer. Some of the vegetables that she sells come from their own harvest. Her income is not enough to meet the demands of her customers, however; consequently, in order to improve her vending business, she is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 8,000.00. This will help her in purchase more vegetables, which will then result in an increase in income.

loans.use: purchasing more vegetables

loans.name: Peng

texts.en:
Peng P., 35, is a true entrepreneur who has had a business selling sweet picker radish since 2002. She makes US$2 of profit per day. Her husband stays at home and makes picker for his wife for sale. Cambodian people like picker radish and normally they serve it with rice. To make picker radish, first they wash the fresh radish and slice into four pieces. It is then dried under the sunshine. They then collect the dry radish and keep it in a jar along with  much sugar and little of salt. Ten days later they have a very delicious picker radish. Peng P. would like a loan from Kiva of US$1000 to make picker radish for sale.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: Supplies to make picker radish.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
T. Oyunchimeg is 51 years old and lives with her 13-year old son, Otgontugs, in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her son live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her son currently attends a  local secondary school. 

Oyunchimeg operates a meat and raw materials trading business in her town. She started her business in 2002 with capital of 50,000 tugriks (MNT). She has grown her business over the years and enjoys a stable operation today. She attributes her success to her good accounting skills, and today her working capital exceeds 800,000 tugriks. 

Oyunchimeg has much hope for the future and says, "I want to further expand my business in order to improve my life." She is requesting a 700,000 tugrik loan to purchase meat and raw materials to sell in her business.  

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

loans.use: To purchase meat and raw materials to sell in her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa M. is currently in the business of selling rice and beans and is requesting a loan. Hawa is 41 years old and is a widow. She has seven children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to stock more bags of beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Eloho

texts.en: Eloho sells baby things like bottles, clothes, cream and toys. She is a friendly woman and she uses her friendly skills to attract more customers to her stall. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is 43 years old and she is married with 6 children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the home. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more baby things to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby things to sell

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Juana Maria S. es madre soltera y tiene una hija bajo su responsabilidad, y le quiere dar lo mejor.
Es solicitando un crédito para empezar un negocio de novedades (bolsas para dama, cintos, cartera), ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para el inicio del un negocio.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de su sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como guardia de seguridad de una compañía.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana Maria S. is a single mother with one daughter under her care, and she wants to give her the best. She is requesting a loan in order to launch a small business (selling handbags, belts and wallets) since she does not have the money necessary to start a business at this time. She plans to repay her loan using a portion of the income that she earns as a security guard for a company.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to launch a business

loans.name: Teodora Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Teodora tiene el negocio de elaboración de calzado, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para el mismo, ella ha trabajado mas de dos años con CEPRODEL de los cuales los créditos le ha beneficiado grandemente ya que ha podido mejorar el local donde tiene el taller y también ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, ella tiene clientes fuera de Nicaragua los cuales viajan a honduras, y también en el sector donde habita esto le dado el beneficio de incrementar sus ventas y así tener mayores ingresos es madre de tres hijo, dos de ellos ya son independientes y uno de 14 años que esta estudiando.
texts.en:
Teodora is a shoemaker. She will use the funds to buy materials and supplies for her shop. She has collaborated with CEPRODEL for over two years and, during that time, the loans have been of great benefit to her because she has been able to make improvements to the locale where she has her workshop and also have helped her get her family ahead in life. She has customers outside of Nicaragua, who travel to Honduras, and also from her own neighborhood. This has allowed her to increase her sales and have higher income. She has three children, two of whom are already independent and one, who is 14 years old, who is still a student.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy high and low soles.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Benkan (5 mariées et 1veuve) ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent  toutes dans des familles traditionnelles au quartier Banankabougou de la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioila, deuxième région administrative de la république.
Ces femmes se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et font le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de fruits et légumes, de condiments, de céréales, du savon, des tubercules etc et de la transformation.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les six prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Benkan sont à leur septième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 1 tonne de céréales, des colis de plusieurs variétés de condiments et quelques chargements d’oranges.
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement sur place auprès des producteurs et grossistes et effectuent leurs ventes d’une façon ambulante et au marché, généralement au comptant, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.000FCFA qui servira à essentiellement étoffer leur fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The six women of the group Benkan (five married and one widowed) average 35 years of age and four children each. They live in traditional families in the Banankabougou district of the city of Fana, prefecture of Dioila, in the 2nd administrative region of the republic. These women know one another by community ties. They do commerce in a variety of goods, such as fruits and vegetables, condiments, grains, soap, tubers, etc. And they process goods. After having correctly repaid the six preceding loans, the women of the group are on their seventh solidarity loan, which will be used to buy a tonne of grain, some packages of several types of condiments, and a few loads of oranges. The goods are essentially acquired locally from producers and wholesale merchants. And sales are made door-to-door and at the market, generally in cash transactions with customers composed of women and men. The group members each envision making an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to build up their capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying food items

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en: Meriam, 57, is grateful to be tilling her own farm because other farmers at her town only tend other people’s farm to earn a living.  She currently has two hectares of rice field located in a town in Agusan Del Sur.  Being in a province where rice farming is one of the main livelihoods, she intends to sell quality rice to people in her community.  Meriam also joined CEVI, an MFI, to get financial support for her business.  She said its program is really helpful to farmers like her who need additional capital. She is asking to loan Php4,000. With this amount of money, Meriam will buy certified seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou T., 39, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Jolito T., a driver, they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn enough so that their family can have a better life.  She has been operating their tricycle business while maintaining a fruit stall for quite some time now.

Marilou has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow 11 times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 30,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business. She will be buying more products to replenish her inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: For the repair of tricycle used for fruit vending, buying more products to replenish her inventory.

loans.name: Audeli Paublina

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es originario de telica, tiene un negocio de comideria, es casada y ha sido cliente activo de esta empresa ceprodel, de las cuales ha mejorado su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
This client is from Telica. She is married, has an eatery and has been an active member of Ceprodel. Its loans have improved her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install wood decorative touches on her wall.

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en: Erdenetsetseg is 40 years old and lives with her three children in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her family have been living together in a rental house and yard for three years. Her oldest daughter, Baasantseren, is 19 years old and studies at the university. Her other two children, ages 12 and 7, attend a local secondary school. Erdenetsetseg operates a cell phone repair service and food retailing business in her town. She has been operating a food retailing business since 2000 and has built a loyal customer base. In 2009, Erdenetsetseg started operating a cell phone repair service. Her 19-year-old daughter conducts the food retailing business after her lessons while her mother operates the cell phone repair service. Erdenetsetseg is a very hardworking and determined person who is working very hard to create a bright future for her three children. She is focused on the future and says, “I am working hard to purchase my own house and yard for my family. I have been planning to expand my business in the future.” She is requesting a 470,000-tugrug loan to purchase more food products to sell and spare cell phone parts for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna A. O. is a wife and a mother of five daughters from Jenin city, and BA degree student. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee and owns bee cells where he produces honey to sell, but still the family income is relatively low and doesn't cover family and university expenses.

Muna took a $500 loan from FATEN to cover her tuition fees, hoping that once she graduates she will be able to support the family and help her husband Oqba cover household expenses.

Oqba, Muna's husband, appears in the picture above at FATEN's office because Muna doesn't accept having her picture published online.

loans.use: To pay off tuition fees

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 31 years old and is married with four children who are between 6 and 10 years old.

Theogene is commonly known in the business of selling a variety of drugs in his pharmacy and he has been in this business for about three years. The hours of his business are from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day.

Theogene is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company which will allow him to expand his pharmacy through purchasing a large quantity of drugs to sell as well as satisfying the demand of his customers.

With this business satisfaction, Theogene will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business for better financial stability. In addition, he will be able to continue to take care of his family.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of drugs for his pharmacy

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Mrs. Samon C. is married with three children. Two are enrolled in local public school, and the youngest is eleven months old. Her husband, Mr. Phean Ghoem (who appears in the photo with her), is a rickshaw driver who earns some money to support his family. This family lives in Traok village in Prey Veng province.
Mrs. Samon C. is a farmer who owns one point three hectare plot of land On this land, she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. But now she has a problem because her soil is infertile. So to improve production, Mrs. Samon C. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she will buy some piglets for breeding in order to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Katabushera Tukore Group, Rukungiri

texts.en:
Over the last six years, to improve his family’s welfare, K. James has depended on his agricultural produce business and his side-business selling domestic animals in Kagashe, Rukungiri. At the young age of 28, he is a man with duties, being that his wife is a housewife and he has one child. He also has five dependents to cater for.

Before James even took thought of setting forth on this business, he was a builder who survived on peanuts. Builders are not highly paid in his part of the country. In a month, this cheerful hard working gentleman says he now makes close to 200,000 shillings.

With this loan, James wants to buy bags of the more lucrative coffee crop that he thinks will earn him more income. He thinks he has already laid a strong foundation for the future and, with this loan, he says his future business prospects are promising.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of the more lucrative coffee crop that he will later resell

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en:
Dolgorsuren D. is 50 years old and lives in Arhangai, western Mongolia. She lives in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Dolgorsuren operates a pharmacy business in her town. She used to work as a nurse and has found out that the pharmacy business is a familiar one to her. Her working capital now exceeds 3,500,000 MNT and with the business profits, she hopes to enlarge her operation. 

Dolgorsuren is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more supplements and a variety of drugs for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma J. is from the town of Surallah. She is married and has five school-aged children. She is a farmer and, with her husband, maintains their rice farm. She says that, as for other farmers, they have experienced a lot of challenges in keeping their farm productive. According to her, it is part of farming and she does not let difficulties stop her from reaching her dreams. 

Emma joined Kiva partner CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Emma is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be the second taken out by Emma from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Damas Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Zoila es químico farmacéutico desD. muy jovencita trabajo en diferentes  farmacias  pero  siempre tenia en mente tener la suya propia, para no seguir trabajando para otros, gracias a la ayuda D. su esposo y unos ahorros que tenían en comun lo pudo lograr, empezó con muy poca mercaderia solo algunas medicinas lo esencial. gracias a sus conocimientos en farmacia gano clientes ya que la atencion era mas personalizada en la actualidad  su botica ha crecido mucho tiene variedad D. productos para ofrecer a su clientela, ahora esta pensando en poner otra sucursal D. su botica pero en provincia es algo que espera concretar muy pronto su mayor logro es tener  su botica bien surtida y poder vivir junto a su familia cómodamente, con su présT. quiere seguir  invirtiendo en la compra D. medicinas y perfumeria , “DAMAS TRIUNFADORAS” es el grupo al cual pertenece  donD. es la tesorera cargo que desempeña con mucha responsabilidad.

 * Zoila es la 5ta D. la foto esta sentada con casaca negra.
texts.en:
Zoila is a pharmacist. Since she was very young she has always worked in a pharmacy. She has always had the dream of having her own pharmacy so that she would not have to work for others any more. Thanks to her husband's help and with some savings she has been able to manage her dream. She started with only a modest inventory, only a few medicines, only the bare essentials. With her knowledge of pharmacy she has gained a good deal of clients and because her service is personalized her pharmacy has grown significantly, offering a large variety of products. She is now thinking about putting up another pharmacy at a different location. Her greatest dream is to have her pharmacy well stocked and to live with her family comfortably. This loan will be used to acquire more inventory, to purchase more medicines and perfumes. Triumphant Women is the name of the community group to which she belongs. She is the treasurer of the group, a position of great responsibility. *Zoila is the 5th person in this photo, seated wearing a black sweater.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase medicines for her pharmacy.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been operating his mixed farm in the town of Nkubu, eastern Kenya for the last two years. His main products are bananas and coffee, which he sells through the coffee factory and at the local market. He also earns income from his motorbike business and masonry business.

John has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to start a poultry project. He intends to purchase both layers and the local breed of poultry. He says that the extra income from this loan will enable him to take his children to better schools and to build a decent home. He faces the challenges of pests and diseases, poor prices for his products and insufficient water for farming.

John is 33 years old. He is a married father of two children, ages 3 and 5. One of the children attends school.

In the future, he hopes to start a hardware shop business and buy an extra motorbike. He is happy about Juhudi's fast processing of loans and training for clients.

loans.use: To start a poultry project

loans.name: Itala

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KAROLL WOKTILA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Itala; tiene 37 años de edad, la socia es natural de sicuani y es casa y tiene 2 hijos, ella es profesora trabaja en el distrito de Chacan, perteneciente a la provincia de  Anta, La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en algunos acabados de sus hogar, la socia esta trasladándose de casa y desea pintar algunas habitaciones y comprar algunas cosas para su nuevo departamento. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su nueva casa.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Introducing Itala, a member of the “KAROLL WOKTILA” Communal Bank, located in Huanchac, a district of the Cusco province in the Cusco region. Itala is 37 years old, she comes from Sicuani, she is married and has 2 children. She is a teacher and she works in the Chacan district, located in the Anta province. The loan she is requesting will be used to do some works in her new house. She is moving from her old house and she wants to paint some rooms and to buy some new things for her new apartment. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the improvement of her new house. She is thankful for the loan that will be granted to her, and at the same time she commits to comply with the repayment of her dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the improvement of her new house.

loans.name: Magdalena's Group

texts.en:
Magdalena A. is from the village of Arcon. She is 52 years old and the group leader of a nine member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Magdalena A..

She is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $115 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Magdalena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magdalena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Magdalena is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 5th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Meybis Lorena

texts.es: Meybis Lorena tiene 38 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos, hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio. Por lo que inicio este medio de vida para sufragar los gastos de su hogar y mantener a sus 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a buscarla para realizar los diferentes pedidos que ofrece ellos se encuentran contentos con el buen servicio y los diferentes productos que ofrece. El financiamiento es para la compra de pintura de uñas, pintura de labios, polvos. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos y proporcionar mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en: Meybis Lorena is 38 years old and has made a living selling cosmetics for more than 8 years. She started this business to help defray her household expenses and support her two young children. Most of her customers come to her to order different things and are happy with the good service and different products offered. The funding is to buy nail polish, lipstick,  and powder. She dreams of improving her income and making home improvements.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel vive en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. 
 Es técnico electricista, mantenimiento de casas, trabaja en los moteles INN. de la ciudad de La Paz, y sus funciones son mantenimiento de alcantarillado, electricidad, y otros que requiera el inmueble.
Es casado y tiene dos hijos
