El crédito será destinado para el pago de un anticrético de  habitación y así mejorar sus ingresos y generar ahorro, para el beneficio de su familia, y pensar a futuro incrementar su anticrético, y condiciones de habitat.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Fidel lives in the district of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. He works as an electrician, maintaining houses and motel rooms in the city of La Paz. In addition, he is in charge of plumbing and other types of building maintenance.

Fidel is married and has two children. This loan will be used to enter into an “anticrético” agreement (a special type of arrangement in which property is pawned to the tenant in exchange for an upfront rental payment, and the rent is returned to the tenant at end of the rental period). Such a contract will benefit his family since he must provide for their living conditions and guard against an increase in the cost of an “anticrético” in the future.

This is the fourth time Fidel has requested a loan from IMPRO. His credit history indicates he is a Level 1 client, which means he has completed his payments on time.

loans.use: Payment for entering into an “anticrético” rental agreement

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old, single woman living with her mother and three siblings in Lebanon. She has almost ten years of experience working as a beautician. Specifically, she offers her beauty services, such as manicures and pedicures, to local customers.

Now, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 from a Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to expand her inventory and to buy new tools. She has high hopes for the future of her business, and she is looking to continue the expansion of her business in the coming year.

Women continue to play an important role in Lebanese society, especially in the development of the family. Women are able to serve as strong role models for their family while also helping to supplement their household incomes. In almost all parts of Lebanon, demand for beauty and fashion products continues to be high.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory and tools

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda P. is a married woman who lives in Proper, Brgy. Caigangan, Sta.Catalina, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a rice and corn retail business.  Her husband Benito, who is 44 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 11 and 22 years old. 

Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Erlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, with which she intends to buy corn and rice to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. 

Erlinda P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more corn and rice to stock and sell to customers

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad D. is from the village of Salucong. She is 44 years old. Caridad is married with five school-aged children. She owns and operates a business venture raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from growing and selling a variety of vegetables. Caridad has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Caridad joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. Caridad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Caridad is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. This loan will be her fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants.

loans.name: Ramón Antonio

texts.es: El señor Ramón Antonio H. H., tiene la edad de 38 años, vive en el populoso Barrio de Laureles Norte, es casado y su esposa se dedica a realizar los trabajos del hogar, ellos tienen 2 hijos adolecentes que se dedican a  los estudios secundarios, trabaja como guarda de seguridad  desde hace 15 años, son una familia de limitados recursos económicos que habitan en una humilde vivienda, ya que desean realizar unas remodelaciones en el frente de su hogar que solicita un préstamo con el fin de  arreglarla para este periodo navideño, esta inversión le permitirá la tranquilidad de ofrecerle a  los suyos mejores comodidades para su familia.
texts.en: Ramón Antonio H. H. is 38 years old and lives in the crowded neighborhood of Laureles Norte.  He is married and his wife takes care of the household chores.  They have 2 teenagers who are in high school.  Ramốn has been working as a security guard for 15 years and they are a family of few economic means who live in a modest home.  They would like to do some work to the front of their home and are requesting a loan so that they can do this work for the Christmas period.  This investment will enable Ramón to offer his family a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To build out the front of their home

loans.name: Zachariah

texts.en:
Zachariah is forty-eight years old and married with eight children between the ages of 3 and 23 years old.  Five of his children currently attend school. He has been farming for twelve years in Kisii, western Kenya.  His farm produces maize, beans, vegetables, sugarcane, and coffee, which are sold locally.  His major business challenges have been low market prices for farm produce and pests and diseases that affect his production.

He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  The extra income from this loan will help him improve his family's livelihood. He plans to expand his dairy farming in the future and also to own a posho mill.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen B. is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 25 years old. Aileen is married and has an infant. To make a living, Aileen runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, beverages and toothpaste. Aileen has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Aileen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aileen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Aileen is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods and canned goods. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Aileen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods and canned goods

loans.name: Rokel Social Club Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Rokel Social Club” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Regina M. T.. Regina is twenty-eight years old. She was born in one of the villages that make up Yoni, in northern Sierra Leone. Currently, she lives in Magburaka, together with her husband and four children, who attend primary school. Regina sells firewood and cooked rice. With her share of this loan, Regina will buy cooking ingredients – rice, palm oil, tomatoes, etc. - and firewood in order to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients and firewood

loans.name: Sandra María

texts.es:
La Señora. Sandra L. es socia del banco comunal Sol Naciente, vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es admirada por su belleza arquitectónica la misma que le permitió ser nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su belleza natural, su gastronomía muy variada y su gente amable y cordial hacen de Cuenca una bella ciudad.

La Señora. Sandra tiene 28 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 11, 9 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian un una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Sandra es oriunda de Ventanas y  vive en Cuenca hace 7 años. Ella es comerciante, vende comida que elabora desde muy temprano, trabaja en dos jornadas que son de 6 a 11 de la mañana y de 3 a 6 de la tarde, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 4 años y los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, este  nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para continuar con la venta de comida. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Sandra L. is a member of the Communal Bank “Sol Naciente” (Rising Sun). She lives in the sector of Feria Libre in the city of Cuenca. This city is admired for its architectural beauty, which contributed toward its recognition as a World Heritage Site. The natural beauty, different cuisines, and the kind friendly people are all characteristics that make Cuenca a lovely city.

Doña Sandra is 28 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 11, 9, and 2). Her older children attend school in the city. Sandra’s husband works as a merchant. They do not own a home, so they currently rent.

Doña Sandra is a native of Ventanas, but has lived in Cuenca for the past seven years. She is a merchant who sells food that she prepares early in the morning. Sandra works in two shifts, from 6am to 11am and from 3pm to 6pm. She has managed this business for four years.

Sandra joined the Communal Bank four years ago and the loans have benefited her business. This new loan will be invested in the purchase of groceries so that she can continue selling food. Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for her food business

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis, de 23 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su familia, sus padres y su esposa, dos hijos, en la familia todos trabajan y solo sus hijos dependen de él; Luis se dedica a la venta de especias, este negocio comenzó hace muchos años, no tiene un horario fijo y actualmente solicita un préstamo para aumentar el negocio comprando equipo de transporte para movilizarse y vender a más personas. 
El quiere comprar una motocicleta, este medio de transporte le ayudara abarcar más zonas donde actualmente no puede llegar, espera que al conocer otros lugares pueda ganar más clientes y que sus ventas sean mejores.
El objetivo de Luis es seguir prosperando en el negocio, ampliar su zona de atención, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis, 23, lives in the El Transito in the department of San Miguel.  He lives with his family, which includes his parents and his wife and two children.  Everyone in the family works, and only his children are dependent upon him.  Luis has a business selling spices.  He started this business many years ago.  He does not have fixed hours.  He is now requesting a loan to expand his business by purchasing transportation equipment that would increase his mobility so that he could sell to more people.  He wants to buy a motorcycle; this type of vehicle would help him to cover more territory by including areas where he cannot currently go.  He hopes that by getting to know some other areas he can gain more customers and have increased sales.

Luis' goal is to continue to prosper with his business, expanding his business territory and improving the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.ru: Шарифов Толибчон проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. Детей не имеет. Образование-среднее. Он три года как занимается торговлей. У него имеется собственный магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для покупки растительного масла, новых видов конфет и молочных продуктов.
texts.en: S. Tolibjon lives in the Hamadoni region. He's thirty-five years old, married and has no children. He has a high school level of education and for the past three years has worked as a salesman in his own store, where he sells groceries. He's asking for a loan in order to purchase vegetable oil, some new types of candy and dairy products.

loans.use: to buy vegetable oil, candy and dairy products

loans.name: Por

texts.en:
Four people are forming this group loan. Mrs. Por was born in 1962,  and is a village bank leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the other members.  Each member of this group will use her money to support her own purpose.

Mrs. Por is a widow with four children.  One is a farm laborer and the other three are students and also help their mother in her businesses. 

Mrs. Por earns her living by knitting. Currently her business is not earning enough income to support her family. Thus, in order to increase income to improve her family's condition, she would like a loan to buy pig food and piglets for breeding, .

loans.use: to buy piglets for breeding, and pig food.

loans.name: Saidahmad

texts.en:
H. Saidahmad is married and has five children. He lives with his family in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. For the past 14 years he has been selling men’s clothes in the market of Shohmansur in Dushanbe city. He buys goods and resells them with a small extra charge. He was also engaged in repairing apartments and houses. Today his working capital in his business is 6,000 US dollars ($US). Saidahmad would like to get a loan of 1400$US to buy new seasonal men’s clothing according to the market demand and he hopes that lenders will support him.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy seasonal men's clothes.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, composé de femmes mariées et de veuve, ont en moyenne 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Dosouma, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’articles divers, de poissons et de condiments.                                                                                                                              
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
KONDIGUE D. compte acheter des articles divers de boutique (sucre, savon, pétrole etc.…) avec les revendeurs de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 11000 F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group, all married women or widows, are on the average 36 years old with  three children. They all live in traditional extended family in the village of N’Dosouma, sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell various items, fish and condiments. The members of the Benkadi group are on their first solidarity loan.

Kondigue D. plans to purchase various first-necessity items (sugar, soap, gasoline etc) from resellers in Fana. She sells daily out of her home, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 11,000 West African francs, which will be used to pay off the loan and cover her costs of participating in major social events, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various  items for resale

loans.name: Haydee Del Socorro

texts.es:
Haydee, es originaria del departamento de León, tiene 58 años de edad ,esta casada , es madre de dos hijos los cuales ya son profesionales . Antes de dedicaba  a trabajar como secretaria ejecutiva ,pero después decidió dedicarse  al negocio de ventas,  cuando tenia 27 años ella tenia una tienda de zapatos, ropa y carteras. Después con ayuda de su esposo decidió vender libros ,como biblias, posters religiosos,cuadros religiosos. Con el tiempo fue creciendo su clientela poco a poco , sus libro son vendidos alrederdor de todo el departamento de Leon incluso fuera de La misma ciudad.    
Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar libros, articulos religiosos. Esta inversión le ayudara a satisfacer la demanda de pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, hacer nuevos clientes, ampliar su negocio. Su meta próxima es vender 5,000 unidades de libros.
texts.en:
Haydee lives in the department of León. She is 58 years old, married and the mother of two children who are already working. She had a prior job as a secretary and management assistant, but then she decided to become a store owner. She had already a store when she was 27, where she sold shoes, clothes and handbags. Later, with the help of her husband, she decided to sell books, mainly bibles, and religious posters and framed pictures. Over time, her clientele gradually grew and she sold books not only to clients living in her city, but anywhere in the department of León.

Haydee applies for a loan to buy religious books and articles. This investment will help her to meet her customers' demand, acquire new clients and expand her store. Her next goal is to sell 5,000 books.

loans.use: to buy religious books and articles.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Doña Daisy es una señora casada, madre de cuatro niños con una edad de 37 años. Vive actualmente con su esposo y tres hijos. Es una clienta con trayectoria en la Fundación, anteriormente era integrante de un banco mujer y ahora decide solicitar un préstamo bajo la modalidad de crédito individual. 

Siempre se ha dedicado a la pequeña industria y ahora al comercio. Ella confecciona bolsos, ropa interior y también cose a la medida. El préstamo lo va invertir en la compra de materia prima como telas, hilos, encajes y otros. Además de zapatos para vender. Es muy trabajadora y siempre le ha ayudado a su esposo en los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos. 

Su meta es tener un negocio grande para obtener más ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos, para mejorar la calidad de vida y la de su familia. En algún momento su dificultad era el dinero para invertir y tener mas variedad de mercadería pero gracias al apoyo de Fundación Mujer con el financiamiento he podido superarme poco a poco.
texts.en:
Daisy is married, the mother of four children, and is 37 years old. She lives with her husband and three of their children. She is a client that has history with the Foundation. She was previously a member of a women’s communal bank, and now has decided to request a loan as an individual. 

She has always worked in small industry and now sells things. She makes bags and underwear and she also does custom sewing. She will use the loan to buy the materials, such as fabrics, threads, laces, and other items. She’ll also buy shoes to sell. She is very hard working and she has always helped her husband with their childrens' education expenses. 

Her goal is to have a big business so she can have a better income, to help her children get ahead, and improve her family’s quality of life. At one time her difficulty was having money to invest in a greater variety of merchandise. However, thanks to the support and financing from Fundación Mujer, she has been able better herself, little by little.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as fabrics, threads, laces, and other items.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is 43 years old and has given birth to four children. Only two of them are able to attend school, while the others stay at home and help their parents with the routine work. Her husband is a milk seller by profession. He has 11 buffalos at home. He has been doing this business for the past 10 years and has full support of Kosar who takes care of his cattle and provides them with timely food and water. His business has vastly expanded and he makes a good income from it. Due to the good quality of his milk, his clientele base is increasing day by day. He needs to expand his business further, so Kosar has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo that will help him fulfill the orders of his customers and get more milk. 

Kosar is hopeful that an investment will help her husband improve his business further and help her family to live a better financial life.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 23-year-old single man living in Tyre. He has been working as fruit-and-vegetable dealer for 11 years. He worked hard to open his business and improve it over this period. His customers include fruit-and-vegetable retail dealers in addition to friends and other community members. 

Hasan is an honest man with a good reputation and good customer service.

Hasan is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to enlarge and improve his business through buying vegetables and fruits with special prices; through its income, Hasan will be capable of paying for the rest of his house.

Hasan hopes to expand and succeed more in his business. He hopes to make a small, happy family of his own, too.

loans.use: to expand his business through buying more products with special prices.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.en:
Rocio, 40, was born in Quillabamba and currently resides in Urubamba. She has three children and lives with her partner.

Rocio is a cook for a woman who has a restaurant that serves local workers. She is saving up to buy her own house. With the 200 dollar loan, she plans to begin to construct a house for herself. It is her dream to have her own house because right now she rents her house from the children of the woman for whom she works. Rocio is very ambitious and is committed to making all the necessary payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of her new house

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
Adelina has a pigpen from which she sells grown and matured pigs. She has run this business for three years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs. Adelina is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Rocio Del Carmen

texts.es: Rocio vive en Sabanagrande, municipio del departamento del Atlántico y se dedica a la preparación y venta de comidas. Ella tiene un hijo de 24 años de edad con quien sueña verlo feliz y muy exitoso.  Su negocio indicó hace 8 años vendiendo almuerzos entre sus vecinos, hasta que el jefe de una empresa cercana probó “las delicias de su sazón “y le dio el contrato de su empresa. Desde ese momento se han incrementado sus ventas y todos los días proyecta su crecimiento., hacia otros mercados, pero el insuficiente capital de trabajo para extenderse es su gran desafío. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el  cual comprará materias primas como arroz, aceite y víveres, con tal de tener un mayor stock de inventarios.  Su sueño es lograr importantes adecuaciones para su vivienda donde haya un espacio para su restaurante visiblemente confortable, para quienes trabajan pero especialmente ara que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos y cómodos.  En la actualidad su negocio tiene liquidez y sus ventas presentan estabilidad y las hace  de contado en las tiendas de su barrio, con una frecuencia diaria, razón por la cual sus inventarios rotan rápidamente y se le incrementa el costo porque  no tiene descuentos por las cantidades que compra.  Esta es una de las soluciones que obtendría con su credikiva al invertirlo en sus materias primas.
texts.en:
Rocío lives in Sabanagrande, a municipality in Atlántico Department, and works preparing and selling meals.  She has a 24-year-old son that she happily lives with and dreams of seeing him being happy and very successful.  She started her business 8 years ago selling lunches among her neighbors until the boss at a nearby firm tasted “the deliciousness of her seasoning” and gave her the contract for his firm.  Since then, sales have increased and she projects daily growth toward other markets.

However, insufficient working capital is her great challenge to attain this growth.  This is why she’s calling on her Kiva loan, the first financing she’s done with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy raw materials like rice, oil and foodstuffs in order to have a larger stock of inventory.  Her dream is to make adequate adjustments to her house so that she’ll have visibly comfortable space for her restaurant for those who work there but especially for her customers so that they will feel satisfied and comfortable.

At present, the business has liquidity and her sales are stable.  She purchases daily from local stores and pays cash so her inventory turns over quickly but costs increase because she doesn’t get any discounts for volume purchases.  This is one of the solutions her Kiva loan will provide when she uses it to buy raw materials.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like rice, oil and foodstuffs.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 58 years old, is married and has been blessed with four children. He used to be a driver of a hand tractor but nowadays he chose to be a farmer. He has his own fields where he grows rice. Once it’s harvested he sells it in the market in order to obtain a higher income and be able to cover his household expenses. He is a father who is concerned about his family because at his age, he is still cultivating rice fields to sustain the needs of his family. He would like to expand his rice fields through cultivating the areas which are not yet cultivated. 

George is asking for additional capital amounting to P40,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticides to improve his land’s productivity. He hopes that he can improve his rice fields to be able to have good produce and increase his yields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for rice farming business.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar, de 34 años es un hombre trabajador, vive junto a su esposa Norma y sus dos hijos a los que cuida y educa en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Ricrican.Su principal actividad económica es “la agricultura”; ahí emprendió el largo camino del trabajo duro y sacrificado. Desde muy joven comenzó con la siembra de papa y avena; los cuales realiza una vez al año, ya que sus terrenos son “temporales”, quiere decir; que necesitan de la temporada de lluvia para que puedan producir. Pero a pesar de esa dificultad, Edgar siempre tiene buenas ganancias en su cosecha, pues dedica todo su esfuerzo en el cuidado de sus cultivos. Además de tener un ingreso extra en el cuidado de su ganado ovino, a los cuales enseba para luego vender su carne a un mayor precio. Esta actividad le proporciona el ingreso suficiente para sustentar sus gastos de alimento, vestimenta y educación de sus hijos a los cuales desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Además gusta de trabajar con su entidad de confianza ya que le brindan el apoyo económico que necesita.       
Él pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando a un futuro mejor” y este es el duodécimo préstamo con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo ofrecido durante todo este tiempo. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, asimismo asegura que esta jubiloso de pertenecer a un banco comunal  muy organizado. Edgar de recibir, su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
34-year-old Edgar is a hard-working man who lives together with his wife Norma and his two children who he cares for and educates in his own home which is located in the village of Ricrican.

Edgar's main business activity is "farming" and this is the business in which he set off on the long path of hard work.  Edgar started growing potatoes and oats when he was very young.  He grows these crops once a year as his land is "seasonal" which means that they need the rainy season in order to grow anything.  However, in spite of this difficulty, Edgar always makes good profits from his harvests as he puts a great deal of effort into looking after his crops.  He also makes additional income by caring for his sheep.  He fattens the animals and then sells their meat for a good price.  This business makes him the income he needs to feed, clothe and educate his children who he would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Edgar is a member of the "Mirando a un futuro mejor" community bank and this is his 12th loan from MFP.  He is grateful for the support that they have offered him over the years.  Edgar pledges to make his loan repayments on time.  He tells us that he is very happy to belong to a very well-organized community bank.  With your support, he will invest the money he has requested in buying natural fertilizers for the crops which he is about to sow.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en: Mary Louise is married and has 4 children who are all in school. Her husband works out of the country. She runs a general store in which she sells rice, cooking oil, soap etc. She has used the profits to take care of her children. She needs a loan to buy more items for her store. She would like to use the profits to pay for school fees for her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy food items that she will sell in her general store

loans.name: Jaime Jose

texts.es: Jaime José es un hombre emprendedor de 47 años, su actividad es una panadería. Tiene más de 15 años de poseerla, el negocio es completamente familiar ya que era su familia quien les había enseñado este medio de vida para que el obtuviera un medio de ingreso para mantener a su familia. Jaime tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solamente 2 están bajo su cargo y les enseña a ganarse el pan de cada día. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de harina, huevos, mantequilla, leche, queso, piña, entre otros productos.
texts.en: Jaime José is 47 years old.  He is an entrepreneurial man and his business is running a bakery.  He has owned his bakery for more than 15 years.  The business is entirely a family business as it was his family who taught him this way of life so that he would have a source of income with which to support his own family.  Jaime has four children, only two of whom are in his care, and he teaches them to earn their daily bread.  Jaime will use the loan that he has requested to buy flour, eggs, butter, milk, cheese, pineapple and other products.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, butter, milk, cheese, pineapple and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more breads, juice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Ever Antonio

texts.es:
Ever, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, es casado. Dueño de un taller de estructuras metálicas, dicho negocio surgió gracias a su esfuerzo e iniciativa y el apoyo de su esposa para poner el negocio en su casa, por ello no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de material para realizar su trabajo como hierro, pintura, entre otras cosas, esta compra le ayudara a realizar mejor su trabajo para mejorar las ganancias.
El sueño de Ever, es crecer en el negocio, capacitarse para hacer mejor los trabajod, para tener o ganarse más clientela y mejorar en lo económico para  su familia.
texts.en:
Ever, who lives with his wife and two children, is married.  He is the owner of a metal structures workshop.  The business came about thanks to his effort and initiative, and his wife’s support of opening a business from home.  Because of this, he does not have a fixed schedule to serve his customers.

He is requesting a loan to buy material to work like iron and paint, among other things.  This purchase will help him do a better job and improve his earnings.

Ever’s dream is to grow his business, train to do better work, gain more customers, and improve his finances for his family.

loans.use: buy iron and paint for the workshop.

loans.name: Deysi Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Deysi, tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y sus cinco hijos.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que lucha por sacar adelante a sus hijos, y ayudar a su compañero de vida, quien trabaja como jornalero, ganando $50 dólares semanales, pero ese dinero no es suficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades básicas de su familia. Deysi se dedica a la crianza de ganillas indias y al engorde de cerdos, estos los vende cuando surge alguna emergencia o necesidad. Las gallinas las vende en un 100% en el mes de diciembre de donde obtiene buenas ganancias.
Deysi conoce muy bien su trabajo, ya que lo ha realizado desde niña, proviene de una familia muy humilde y de esa manera la crecieron sus padres y fue de ellos que aprendió este trabajo. De esta forma colabora en su hogar y no descuida a sus hijos.
Los materiales que utiliza para crecer a sus animales, una parte la compra al crédito en una ciudad, ella tiene la ventaja que su compañero de vida a parte de trabajar como jornalero, cultiva maíz y ese lo utiliza, para alimentar a sus animales. Ellos son una pareja luchadora y se ayudan mutuamente, ella le proporciona dinero de la venta de las gallinas y cerdos, cuando necesita comprar abono y él la ayuda proporcionándole el maíz.
Deysi solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar: 5 cerdos, 3 sacos de concentrados para cerdos, 2 quintales de concentrado para gallinas, 2 libras de clavos, 8 laminas y 4 cuartones de madera; para hacer una galera, para que no se asoleen los cerdos. 
El préstamo le ayudara a obtener mejores ingresos, que le permitan ofrecer a sus tres hijos menores el estudio, ya que los dos mayores no continuaron por razones económicas, también obtendrá los insumos, para alimentar a sus animales y vender más cantidad de estos. Además ya no comprara al crédito los insumos. Una parte de las ganancias la ahorrara para el estudio de sus hijos, por eso ella lucha sin descansar, para preparar aunque sea a uno o dos de sus hijos.
Ella espera tener una granja de cerdos y gallinas muy fuerte, obtener más ganancias para sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles a sus hijos una vida digna, para que no tengan las mismas necesidades que ella pasó cuando era una niña.
texts.en:
Señora Deysi is 35 years old and lives with her partner and their 5 children. She is a very hardworking woman who is determined to get ahead with her children and help her partner, who works as labourer earning $50 a week. However, this is not enough money to cover the basic needs of the family. Deysi raises Indian hens (type of chicken) and fattens pigs. These are sold when there is an emergency or need. She sells 100% of her hens in December and obtains a good profit. 

Deysi does this work very well as she has been doing this since she was a girl. She comes from a humble family and her parents raised her this way. It was from her parents that she learned this job. In this way she can contribute to the household as well as not neglect her children.

She buys on credit in the city some of the materials she uses to raise her animals. She has the advantage that her partner, as well as working as a labourer, plants corn which she uses to feed her animals. They are a determined couple who mutually help each other. She provides him wiith money from the sale of the hens and chickens when he needs to buy manure and he helps her by providing corn. 

Deysi is asking the Fundación Campo for this loan to buy: 5 pigs, 3 sacks of concentrates for the pigs, 2 quintals (1 quintal equals 100lbs) of concentrate for the hens, 2 pounds of nails, 8 sheets and 4 timber scantlings to make a covering so the pigs are shaded. 

The loan will help her obtain a better income which will allow her to give her 3 children an eductaion, as the 2 eldest were unable to continue with their studies due to economic reasons. She will also obtain the consumables needed to feed her animals and sell more of these. In addition she will no longer buy the feed on credit . She will save part of the profits for her children's schooling, something she fights for tirelessly, to prepare if it be only 1 or 2 of her children.

She hopes to have a strong chicken and pig farm, obtain more profits to raise her family and give her children a decent life so that they don't suffer the same necessities that she did as a child.

loans.use: to buy 5 pigs, 3 sacks of concentrates for the pigs, 2 quintals of concentrate for the hens, 2 pounds of nails, 8 sheets and 4 timber scantlings to make a covering so the pigs are shaded.

loans.name: Nelson Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Nelson de 37 años de edad, está casado con la señora María de 38  años de edad, tienen 2 hijos, una niña de 10 años y un varón de 5 años.
Nelson es chapista de autos, tiene un taller propio donde realiza el servicio, se dedica a esto hace más de 10 años. Había empezado como ayudante trabajando con un señor que le había enseñado a realizar de forma profesional el trabajo. Con mucho esfuerzo monto para su taller donde tiene todo lo necesario para dar sus servicios. Su esposa se encarga del cuidado de sus hijos, y en horas libres realiza artesanía en ao po’i.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de un nuevo soldador, lo cual le ayudará mucho en su negocio. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Sr. Nelson is 37 years old and married to Sra. María, age 38. They have two children, a 10-year-old daughter and a 5-year-old son.

Nelson performs auto body work. He has his own workshop where he provides his services and has been in business for more than 10 years. Nelson started out working as an assistant for another gentleman who taught him how to become a professional in this line of work. With great effort, he established his own shop and acquired everything he needed to provide this service. His wife takes care of their children. During his free time, Nelson makes crafts out of “ao po’i” (a fine cotton cloth that is unique to Paraguay).

He is requesting a loan to buy a new soldering iron, which will be a great help to his business. Nelson is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to him.

loans.use: to buy a new soldering iron for his repair shop.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Teofila has a shop and also peddles clothing like t-shirts, blouses, and underwear. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Teofila has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Teofila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ariel Carlos

texts.es: Ariel de 29 años,  con su credikiva anterior hizo muchas cosas: adecuó su local, invirtió en mercancías  y su miscelánea desde ese momento ha lucido muy surtida. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará una vitrina de segunda y mucha mercancía de la época navideña, con la cual atraerá la atención de sus clientes, quienes en esta temporada esperan encontrar en la miscelánea de Ariel,  un surtido ajustado a sus necesidades familiares, especialmente porque tienen las bonificaciones y primas en sus manos, con las cuales comprarán todo lo que exige las hermosas fiestas familiares de navidad y año nuevo. Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente: “Agradezco el haber tenido en cuenta mi solicitud de crédito, ya que este  crédito me ha permitido realizar mis metas en gran parte. “
texts.en:
Ariel is 29 years old. With his previous Kiva loan he was able to do many things such as equip his shop, invest in merchandise, and other tasks. He is well-stocked at the moment.

Ariel is currently applying for a new Kiva loan so that he can buy a secondhand display case and more merchandise for the Christmas season in order to grab his customers’ attention. During this time of the year, they visit Ariel’s store because it is stocked with an assortment of items to meet the family needs. His customers come holding their cash bonuses in their hands so that they can buy everything need to throw beautiful Christmas and New Years parties for their families.

Ariel sends the following message to Kiva lenders: “I appreciate that you have taken the time to consider my loan request because the funds will play a large part in helping me accomplish my goals.”

loans.use: to buy a secondhand display case and additional merchandise for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru:
Вера – вдова. У нее есть дочь-подросток, которую она воспитывала сама. Вера живет в Ивано-Франковске и занимается розничной торговлей парфюмерно-косметическими средствами и средствами гигиены. Она держит целых 3 торговых точки по городу, у нее 6 наемных работников и отдельный склад для товара. Вера раньше работала учителем английского языка, а ее супруг вел этот бизнес. После смерти мужа Вера была вынуждена взять управление бизнеса на себя. Вера установила сравнительно низкие цены на весь широкий ассортимент товарного ряда, ее точки очень выгодно расположены по всему городу. В бизнесе Вера уже занята 20 лет. 

Вера планирует вложить кредит КИВА в 20 000 гривен в закупку парфюмерной продукции с целью расширения ассортимента перед праздниками. Закупив духи, одеколоны, туалетную воду, а также краски для волос, Вера надеется удовлетворить возрастающий спрос перед новогодними и рождественскими праздниками. Главная личная цель, которую ставит для себя Вера – оплатить образование дочери в ВУЗе.   
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Vera is a widow. She has a teenage daughter, who she raised all by herself. Vera lives in Ivano-Frankivsk. She is engaged in retail trade in perfumes, cosmetics and hygiene products. She has as many as three sales points around the city, six employees, and a separate warehouse for the goods. In the past, Vera worked as an English teacher. After her husband's passing she had to take over his business. Vera set relatively low prices for the whole range of products; her vending stalls are conveniently located throughout the city. She has been in this business for twenty years. Vera plans to invest the Kiva loan of 20 000 hryvnas in the purchase of perfumes. She would like to increase the assortment before the holidays. She will buy perfumes, eau-de-cologne,  hair dyes, etc. in order to meet the increasing demand before the New Year and Christmas holidays. Vera's goal is to finance her daughter's college education.

Note: original text in Russian

loans.use: to buy perfume products in order to expand the assortment before the holidays

loans.name: Gonzala

texts.en:
Gonzala, a 52-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol who does her best to support her family, runs a fishing business with her husband. She also buys and sells seaweeds to help augment their income.

Gonzala has requested this loan to purchase paint and adhesives for the fishing boat. She plans to pay her children's school fees with her profits.

loans.use: to purchase paint and adhesives for the fishing boat.

loans.name: Karel

texts.en:
Karel is a 51-year-old man and married. He has 4 children, namely: Defri, 31, Sarce, 25 – both married; Julius, 21, is working in a cooperative; Fadly, 18, graduated from Senior High School.

Karel is running a petrol stall business to support his family. He has been running the business for years. Karel often does some odds job such as mini-van driver, construction worker, etc. to generate more income. Karel dreams of expanding his petrol business to enable him to generate more income for his family, but he does not have money to do so. He is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on more petrol. Karel is hoping that TLM will approve his loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase more petrol.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 35 years old, married with three children aged 1, 3 and 7. She sells shoes to earn a living, she has been in the business for 8 years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Los Andenes Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Los Andenes” en el distrito del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por doce personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Concepción nació en la ciudad de Apurimac y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 38 años de edad  y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos. Su actividad económica principal de la socia Concepción es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante pues trabaja en el area de cocina en uno de los hoteles de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que trabaja en esa entidad y le ha ido muy bien. En esta oportunidad Concepción requiere el préstamo porque necesitan para uso personal para pagar las matriculas de sus hijos. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del "Inti Raymi" y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.(la señora Concepción esta levantando la mano en la fotografía y las fotos adjuntas llegaron déspues a la reunión).(Las personas que están tapadas en la fotografía no pertenecen al banco comunal).
texts.en:
A group of friends and neighbors formed the communal bank “Los Andenes” in the Cusco district.  This communal bank is made up of twelve people who are looking for opportunities to get ahead at every turn.  Through their daily efforts they are delivering a better future to their children.

Concepción was born in the city of Apurimac and lives in Cusco.  She is 38 years old and is married.  Out of this beautiful relationship she has two children.  She is a hardworking and enterprising woman.  Concepción’s main job is working in the kitchen of one of Cusco’s hotels.  At this point, she has been working there for a number of years and it has gone well for her.  Now Concepción needs a loan for her personal use, to pay the school fees for her children.

Señora Concepción is raising her hand in the photo.

All the group members are grateful for the opportunity given to them and are committed to making the payments for their various loans in the established timeframe.  Cusco is located in the Cusco district and province.  It is the heart of the ancient city of the Incas.  It is characterized as a tourist attraction due to the archaeological sites throughout its historic downtown, as well as for its landscapes and its history.  It is also known for being one of the enchanting cities of the southern part of the country.  Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial area with the “Inti Raymi” festival.  One of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu, is located there.  

The two attached photos are of people who arrived after the meeting.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.name: Gloria Natividad

texts.es:
Gloria, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, no pudo continuar estudiando porque sus padres no contaban con los recursos económicos para seguir apoyándola; es madre soltera de 3 hijos que están estudiando.

Gloria, se dedica a hacer tortillas para vender, ella se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace algunos años, tomo la decisión de iniciar con este negocio, porque necesitaba generar ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos. 

Gloria, necesita el préstamo para comprar más maíz y leña para elaborar más tortillas para vender, porque en esta temporada navideña se vende más.

El sueño de Gloria, es darle la oportunidad a sus hijos de prepararse academicamente para que sean profesionales.

loans.use: para comprar más maíz y leña para elaborar más tortillas para vender
